loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 48 años, esta casada con Mariano de 69 años, con quien tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Puerto Cocos, Pichari. Ella es una excelente cocinera, pues sabe preparar ricos potajes, que son del gusto del cliente. En un inicio le fue difícil tener un posicionamiento que ahora tiene, pero gracias a su paciencia, sazon y dedicación ha logrado ser la preferida frente a la competencia. Además es su esposo es quien más la ayuda en éste trabajo, él se encarga de atender a la clientela y dar la mejor cordialidad posible para hacerlos sentir cómodos; asimismo cuenta con una joven que la aydua en la cocina. Ella está contenta con el negocio que tiene, sin embargo de proveerse de toda clase de productos, pues tiene pedidos de un platillo típico, más de la sierra peruana, por lo que le resulta difícl conseguir ciertos insumos para tal comida. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles, podrá comprar sillas para implementar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Teresa is 48 years old and married to 69-year-old Mariano with whom she has two children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Puerto Cocos community, in Pichari.

Teresa is an excellent cook who knows how to prepare delicious stews which are to her customers' tastes.  At first it was difficult to achieve the positioning that she now has but, thanks to her patience, the good flavor of her food and her commitment, she has managed to become more popular than her competitors.  Her husband is the one who helps her the most in her work.  He takes care of serving the customers and providing them with the most friendly service possible in order to make them feel comfortable.  Teresa also has a young girl who helps her in the kitchen.  She is happy with the business that she has.  However, she must obtain all kinds of products.  For example, if she receives orders for a dish which is more typical of the mountain region of Peru, it becomes difficult to get hold of certain supplies she needs.

This will be Teresa's third loan from MFP and she pledges, once more, to make her repayments on time.  She will use her 2,000 soles to buy chairs for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Mubiru

texts.en:
Mubiru is 45 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Mubiru has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells clothes and cosmetics. 

To help expand his business, he has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more t-shirts for resale, and will help him generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Mubiru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts for resale.

loans.name: Hanson

texts.en:
Hanson is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, he has been working hard to manage his small farm, which raises poultry. 

To help expand his business, Hanson has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hens, and will help Hanson to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. Hanson hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger farm. 

Hanson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hanson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more hens for resale.

loans.name: Amori

texts.en:
Amori is 30 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 9 years, Amori has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand his business, Amori has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items, and will help him generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. Amori hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a supermarket. 

Amori is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es: Ligia, tiene la edad de 29 años, está casada y vive con su esposo actualmente. Ella con el crédito va comprar los repuestos para la mejora de su vehículo de trabajo. Ella cuenta con un camión para las labores agrícolas y le sufrió un desperfecto mecánico por lo cual tiene que repararlo para seguir adelante con su trabajo y su proyecto actual. Ella con este camión reparte la mercadería a los clientes de su esposo y lo necesita en óptimas condiciones urgente para seguir prosperando con su negocio cada día. Ella con esta mejorar al camión pretende obtener el mejor rendimiento de este y salir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar la economía de ambos para una mejor bienestar de ambos en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ligia, 29, is married and living with her husband at present.  She will use the loan to buy replacement parts to repair her work vehicle.  She has a truck used in farming chores that had a mechanical breakdown so she needs to repair it in order to continue with her work and current project.  She uses this truck to deliver her husband’s customers' merchandise and she urgently needs it to be in optimal operating condition to continue making progress in her business every day.  With a repaired truck she hopes to get better use out of it and to succeed with her project improving both her and her husband’s economy for their better mutual future wellbeing.  This is her first FUDECOSUR loan.  She has had no previous loans from state banks.  Fudecosur has offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair her work vehicle.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 40 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, he has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells second-hand shoes. 

To help expand his business, Julius has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale, and will help Julius to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for him and his wife. He hopes that in the future he will be able to have children and educate them up to university level. 

Julius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is 36 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Twaha has been working hard to manage his small farm, which grows a variety of vegetables. 

To help expand his business, Twaha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer,  and will help him generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a supermarket. 

Twaha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionicio de 40 años de casado con Marina 32 años de edad, con quien tiene 2 hermosos hijos. Juntos habitan en la localidad de Pichari alta. Él es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo, pues su único fin es ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su Herramienta de trabajo es un mototaxi, y con el se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte. Es así que desde muy temprano recorre las diversas calles de su ciudad, para captar algún cliente que necesite del servicio. Él esta feliz con su trabajo, por que gracias a ello percibe un ingreso económico, pero cree que no siempre se va a dedicar a ello, tiene la esperanza de iniciar un nuevo negocio, por lo que no cuenta con capital suficiente. Por tanto realizará su primer crédito con MFP, y por tanto se compromete en pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles, lo invertirá para amueblar su local y montar una librería, y para ello necesitará comprar productos para abastecerlo.
texts.en:
Dionicio is 40 years old and is married to 32 year old Marina with whom he has two beautiful children. They live together in the Pichari Alta area. He is very dedicated to his work, as his only goal is provide his family with a better quality of life. The tool of his trade is a mototaxi with which he provides transport services. He subsequently sets off very early, travelling around the different streets of his city to pick up customers.

He is happy in his work because it generates an income but he does not think that he will do it forever. He hopes to start a new business, for which he does not currently have sufficient capital. Therefore he will take out his first loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual in his repayments. With the 2,000 soles he will furnish his premises and open a bookstore, for which he will need to buy stock.

loans.use: to buy scaffolding and office supplies.

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Victoria, de profesion docente, medio tiempo, el cual sigue comercializando la venta de cosmetico, que ha venido aumentando al introducir mas mercaderia con los financiamiento de Afodenic,
Para ella es de gran sastifaccion lograr el objetivo de sus ventas, ya que tiene que cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. Sus clientela ha crecido y espera seguir captando mas clientes.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, podra comprar: ropa nueva de dama, niño, caballero, a si como cosmetico unos encargado y para tener en existencia.
texts.en: Doña Victoria, a part-time teacher, continues to sell cosmetics. Her turnover increased after she added more merchandise to her inventory thanks to the loan granted by the microfinance institution Afodenic. Victoria feels great satisfaction at achieving her sales target, since she must cover all household expenses. Her clientele has grown and she hopes to attract even more customers. With this new loan she will buy new clothes for women, children and men, as well as ordered cosmetics which she doesn't have in stock.

loans.use: To buy a large variety of cosmetics as well as women's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Elison

texts.en:
Elison is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Elison has been working hard to manage his small pharmacy, which sells medicine to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Elison has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for his shop, and will help him generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Elison is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for his shop.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El joven Manuel esta invirtiendo a mejorar la casa de sus padres ya que como el vive con ellos desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y así un mejor patrimonio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el materia que es (madera, clavos, y cemento) y empezar a construir el cuarto de madero que sea para sus padres. 
Manuel planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una farmacia, ya que su papa se encargara de los gastos familiares. 
Desean  estar más seguros y protegidos antes de que llegue la temporada de invierno y así evitar enfermedades.
texts.en:
Manuel is investing in improving his parents' house, since, as he lives with them, he wants to give them a better quality of life and so a better inheritance.

He is requesting a loan to buy the materials (lumber, nails, and cement) and begin to build the wood room for his parents.

Manuel plans to repay the loan with the salary from his job in a pharmacy, since his father takes care of the family expenses.

They want to be safer and protected before the winter season arrives, and so avoid illness.

loans.use: to build a room with wood.

loans.name: Maria Leonila

texts.es:
María Leonila tiene 57 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos. María se dedica ha hacer pupusas y tamales de elote para la venta. Para el Día de Difuntos en El Salvador, celebrado el 1ro y 2ndo día de Noviembre, María fabrica adornos de flores de papel para la venta (llamados "coronas"). En El Salvador es una tradición ir a visitar al cementerio a los familiares o amigos que hayan fallecido, y colocar una corona de flores en su tumba. La corona comunmente es fabricada con flores hechas de papel de muchos colores.

María solicita un préstamo de la Fundación Campo para comprar la materia prima necesaria para vender las coronas. Normalemente, María deja de vender sus otros productos (pupusas y tamales) para invertir en la fabricación de las coronas. Con la ayuda del préstamo, María no tendría que dejar de vender sus otros productos para poder vender las coronas. De este modo ella puede tener una fuente de ingresos adicional.

En un futuro a María le gustaría poder dedicarse a hacer coronas permanentemente, y posiblemente tener un establecimiento en donde ella pueda venderlas. Con las ganancias de sus ventas María quisiera hacerle mejoras a su casa, y así poder dejar un patrimonio para el menor de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Leonila is 57 years old, divorced, and has five children.  Her business is making and selling pupusas and corn tamales.  For 'el Dia de Difuntos' (The Day of the Dead) in El Salvador, which is celebrated on the first and second day of November, María makes decorations from paper flowers (called 'crowns') and sells them.  In El Salvador, it is traditional to visit the cemetery and place a crown of flowers on the graves of family members and friends.  The crown is commonly made with multi-colored paper flowers.

María is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy the raw materials she needs to make her crowns.  Normally, María stops selling her other products (pupusas and tamales) so that she can invest in making her crowns.  With the help of this loan, she won't have to stop selling her other products in order to be able to sell her crowns.  This means she will be able to have an additional source of income.

In the future, María would like to be able to have a permanent business making crowns and possibly have an establishment where she can sell them.  With the profits she makes from her sales, María would like to make some improvements to her home.  This will enable her to have something to leave her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy materials for making 'flower crowns'

loans.name: Cecilia Antonia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 43 años de edad, originara de la ciudad de León, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, ella es comerciante se dedica a la  venta de mercadería  en general. Antes de dedicarse a este negocio ella trabajaba de limpieza en un colegio de secundaria, después trabajo atendiendo una panadería era vendedora. Pero después decidió tener su propio negocio que le permitiera movilizarse por varios lugares fue entonces que comenzó a vender ropa ,zapatos, cosmético , bisuterías de manera ambulante lleva 8 años con este negocio, en ocasiones cuando no esta vendiendo se dedica a trabajar como ayundante de cocina es restaurantes. 
Realizo el préstamo para comprar mercadería tales como ropa, zapato,cosméticos, artículos del hogar. Pues necesita mercadería nueva y variada para ofrecer y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Le gustaría poner una tienda grande de venta de mercadería en general. Seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
43-year-old Cecilia is from the city of León.  She is a single mother and has one child.  She is a trader who sells general merchandise.  Before she started working in this business, she used to work cleaning a high school and then serving in a bakery.  However, she decided to start her own business which would allow her to get around different places.  She started selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics and costume jewelry as an itinerant vendor and has been in this business for eight years now.  Sometimes, when she isn't selling her products, she works as an assistant cook in restaurants.

Cecilia took out this loan to buy merchandise such as clothes, shoes, cosmetics and household items as she needs new and varied merchandise to sell to her customers and meet her customer demand.  She would like to set up a large store selling general merchandise and to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothes, shoes, cosmetics and household items

loans.name: Kahab

texts.en:
Kahab is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Kahab has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, which sells fresh cuts of meat. 

To help expand his business, Kahab has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beef and cows for fattening, and will help him generate greater profits and feed his family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to own the biggest butcher shop in town. 

Kahab is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more beef and cows for fattening.

loans.name: Elvia Dinora

texts.es:
Elvia, vive con sus dos  hijas de 9 y 4 años, ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el mercado, desde hace muchos años y recibe ayuda económica de su esposo, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más frutas y verduras como: bananos, manzanas, plátanos, repollo, y de esa forma surtir más el negocio y recibir más ingresos.
El sueño de Elvia es que sus dos hijas estudien con su esfuerzo para que sigan adelante, y darle mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Elvia lives with her two daughters who are 9 and 4 years old.  She has sold fruit and vegetables in the market for many years and she gets economic help from her husband; she works every day, Monday through Sunday.

She needs the loan to buy more fruit and vegetables like: bananas, apples, plantain and cabbage to better stock her business and earn higher income.

Elvia’s dream is that with her efforts her two daughters will study so that they can get ahead and to provide them with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 4 years, Hadijah has been working hard to manage her clinic, which administers herbal medicine. 

To help expand her business, Hadijah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more herbs, and will help her generate greater profits and meet her basic needs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to become self-reliant. 

Hadijah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more herbs.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana de 24 años, es soltera, vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Tununtuari. Ella es una señora de corazón noble y muy trabajadora; se dedica al cultivo del cacao. Actividad que lo realiza en compañía de sus padres y hermanos. Bien sabe que esta planta del cacao es perenne, y que con el pasar de los años el suelo va perdiendo sus nutrientes, razón por la que se requiere fertilizarlo constantemente. Cuando es temporada de cosecha debe contratar jornaleros para que la ayuden en la recolección de los frutos, y del que luego serán comercializados en la comunidad de valle esmeralda. Ella esta conforme con esta labor que realiza por que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, de esta manera puede apoyar a sus hermanos menores pagando sus estudios. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Juliana is 24 years old, single, and lives in her own house located in the city of Tununtuari. She is a lady with a noble heart and she is a hard worker. 

She works growing cacao. She does this work alongside her parents and siblings. She knows very well that cacao is a perennial plant, and that as the years go by the soil will lose its nutrients, and so the soil requires fertilizing constantly. 

During harvesting season she hires laborers to help harvest the crops and then later she sells the product in the community of Valle Esmeralda. She is happy doing this work because it provides a good income, so she can support her younger siblings and pay for their studies. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the loan of 2500 soles to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Sully

texts.es:
El negocio de doña Sully, ha venido mejorando, ya que por su especialidad en la sopa de res y marisco, el cual gusta mucho de los clientes, por su rico nutrientes.
Negocio que sigue trabajando junto a su esposo. En los ultimos meses se vio mal, con el parto de su bebe, los que sus ventas bajaron y se retraso con sus pagos, teniendo el apoyo de su familia, pero no es lo mismo.Su bebe esta bien, y ha traido felicidad al hogar.
Hoy en dia esta contenta por que ha logrado la estabilidad, en sus ventas,  y que gracias Afodenic, ha sido posible esta nueva inversion. en donde comprara: granos basicos, carne, pollo, hueso, cola de res, camarones, cangrejos,punche, pescado,productos de la coca cola, frutas y verduras, para seguir elaborando su rica comida.
texts.en:
Sully's business has been growing since she added a new specialty to the menu—beef and seafood soup—which has been popular with her customers because it's tasty and nourishing.

She continues working with her husband in the business. In the last few months she has felt ill, while being pregnant with her baby. Sales declined and she was late with her payments, but with the support of her family, things are different now. Her baby is fine and has brought joy to the house.

Today she is happy that her sales are stable, and thanks to a loan through Afodenic, with this new loan, she can buy basic grains, meat, chicken, bones, beef tails, shrimp, crabs, punch, fish, coco-cola, fruits and vegetables in order to continue making her delicious food.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 11 years, Shakirah has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help her generate greater profits and meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a second business. 

Shakirah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria, una joven de 23 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León,  es comerciante, tiene una pulpería localizada en su casa de habitación,  debido a problemas económicos no ha podido empezar a estudiar su secundaria se ha dedicado a trabajar, ella lleva tres años con su propio negocio, la venta de granos básicos, verduras gaseosas, snacks que son parte de los productos que ofrece en su pulpería que ella misma atiende.  
Ella solicito el crédito para comprar producto tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, huevo, leche, verduras, gaseosas que son parte de la demanda de sus clientes. Pues al tener más producto que ofrecer podrá vender un poco más y le permitirá invertir en otro tipo de mercadería tales como ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Sus planes futuros son quiere  finalizar su secundaria e iniciar la universidad y hacer crecer su negocio de pulpería.
texts.en:
Gloria, a young woman 24 years old, lives in the city of León. She is a merchant, and has a grocery store in her home. She could not begin her studies at high school because of economic reasons.

She has had her own business for 3 years selling basic grains, vegetables, sodas, and snacks. These are the items she offers for sale in her store.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, eggs, milk, vegetables and sodas, which are some of the things her customers ask for. The more varieties of items she can offer, the greater her chances to sell a bit more, and in this way invest in other types of merchandise, such as clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. 

Her goal is to finish high school, attend college, and see her grocery store grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, eggs, milk, vegetables and sodas

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
Germán, se dedica a la albañilería, vive con  su familia, él realiza su trabajo desde las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm, lleva 22 años en este oficio, además ha logrado tomas cursos para fortalecer sus conocimientos y realizar de una mejor manera su trabajo.
Actualmente necesita comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, porque esta mejorando las instalaciones de la vivienda, con esta ayuda podrá realizar el trabajo y mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia, ofreciéndole un mejor ambiente.
La aspiración de Germán es que su vivienda cuente con todo lo necesario para que su familia tenga una vida adecuada y con mejor espacio.
texts.en:
Germán is a bricklayer.  He lives with his family.  He works from 6am until 3pm. He’s been in this occupation for 22 years.  He’s also managed to take courses to strengthen his skills and help him do his work in a better way.

He currently needs to buy building materials and supplies like cement, sand and iron rods because he’s making some home improvements.  With this help he’ll be able to do the work and improve his family’s quality of life by offering them a better environment.  Germán’s wish is that his home has everything necessary for his family to have an adequate life with more room.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Rocío

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido para mejorar su negocio. Tiene 34  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos de 17, 14, 10 y 8 años, los dos mayores  estudian en  colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es maestro albañil.

Doña Mercedes trabaja en un hotel de Montecristi, allí realiza diversas actividades y trabaja de lunes a sábado hasta las 16h00, ella además de este trabajo también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y realiza sus ventas en sus tiempos libres, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada dia domingo. Lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los cosméticos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos, ella comprar los productos de oferta que son los que más ganancias le dejan.
 
Sus sueños son tener su propio hotel o un gran restaurante ya que le encanta la cocina.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Unidas por un Futuro Mejor" (United for a Better Future) community bank meet in Montecristi canton.  This canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  It is the birthplace of the famous Panama hat. 

Mercedes is a founding member of this community bank and she likes it because the loans have helped her to improve her business.  She is 34 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage who are 17, 14, 10 and 8 years old.  Her two eldest are in high school and the younger ones are in elementary school.  Her husband is a master builder.

Mercedes works in a hotel in Montecristi where she carries out a number of activities.  She works from Monday to Saturday, until 4.00pm.  In addition to this work, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She makes her sales door to door in her free time.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every Sunday.  She has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well.  What she sells most of are cosmetics.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.  She buys sale products as these make her the most profits.

Mercedes' dreams are to own her own hotel or a restaurant as she loves cooking.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Bartola Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 15, 13 y 6 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es chofer. 

Doña Elizabeth para ganar algo de dinero y así poder ayudar a su esposo  con los gastos del hogar realiza los quehaceres domésticos en una casa de la localidad, pero adema de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella después que sale de su trabajo se desplaza por la ciudad visitando  a sus clientes con la finalidad de vender y cobrar los productos que ha entregado, lleva 4 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, la mercadería ella compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 ciclos  y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
The community bank "Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor" (United for a better future) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its crafts, which are recognised at a national and an international level. It is also known for its famous straw panama hats. 

This is where Elizabeth lives. She is 34 years of age and lives with her partner with whom she has four children of 16, 15, 13 and 6 years of age. The older children are in high school and the younger children are in primary school. Her husband is a driver. 

Elizabeth works in a home in her neighbourhood as a housekeeper to earn some money and help her husband with the household expenses. She also works selling clothing and visits her customers all over the city to sell clothes and collect payment for delivered orders. She has been working in this field for four years and it is going very well for her. She buys items in Guayaquil anytime she needs to stock up her supplies.

With this loan Elizabeth will buy items including pants, shirts, tops and children's clothing. She has been with the community bank for five loan cycles and she likes to use this service because of the ease with which she can obtain a loan.  

Her dream is to give her children the best opportunities possible.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, tops and children's clothing.

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana sigue comercializando ropa nueva, pues es el medio de apoyar  a su familia, y cuidar de ella misma, ya que parte de sus ventas las hace en su casa de habitacion. Ya que sus hijos aun estan pequeño.
El objetivo desde hace años, ha sido la mejora de su casa, pero devido que tenian otra pioridad con sus hijos, los financiamiento los invertian en el negocio, equilibrando sus gastos.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo va hacer mejoras en las paredes interna de su casa, como comenzar con el arranque del muro en la parte frontal. Logrando tener un techo en mejores condiciones, y mejor seguridad para su familia. materiales a comprar: bloque, hierro, bolsa de cemento.Mejorando toda la infraestructura, ya que solo una parte esta en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Johana is still selling new clothes to support her family and herself. Part of her sales go towards her living expenses, as her children are still little. 

For years Johana's goal has been to improve her home, but since her other priority is her children, she has to invest her money in her business to balance out her costs. 

Now with this new loan she will make improvements on the internal walls of her home, starting by tearing down the front wall, which will leave the roof in better condition and will provide a safer environment for her family. For this project she will need to buy cement blocks, iron and bags of cement. She will make improvements to the entire structure, as only one part is in good condition.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to keep expanding her business.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María Fernanda. Tiene 35años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos de 14, 10, 7 y 5 años, el  mayor  estudian en  colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.

Doña María Fernanda es maestra por contrato y trabaja en una escuela de la localidad desde hace dos años, pero ella para ganar dinero extra también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, lo que más vende es ropa de niños ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son padres de familia de la escuela donde ella labora y compañeras de universidad ya que está estudiando su último semestre para sacar su licenciatura y con esto tener mas posibilidades de conseguir un nombramiento del estado en la escuela donde trabaja. Ella lleva tres años dedicada a sus ventas y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio   y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a salir de muchas situaciones difíciles. 

Sus sueños es obtener su licenciatura y conseguir un nombramiento en una institución educativa.
texts.en:
The community bank "Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor" (United for a better future) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are recognised on a national and international level as being the birthplace of the famous straw panama hats.  

This is where María Fernanda lives. She is 35 years old, married and has 4 children of 14, 10, 7 and 5 years of age. The older children study at high school and the younger ones go to primary school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

María Fernanda is a teacher and has worked in a school in the neighbourhood for two years on a contract. However, to get some extra money she sells all types of clothing, but she mostly sells children's clothing to the parents of the children who go to the school where she works and to her classmates at university where she is in the last semester of her degree. This degree will open up more possibilities of receiving a letter of appointment to the school where she works. She has been selling clothing for three years and she has done very well with it.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, tops and children's clothing. Maria Fernanda has been with the community bank since it began and she likes to use their services because their loans have helped her out of many difficult situations. 

Her dream is to get a degree and be appointed to an educational institution.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, tops and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes, posee su propio negocio, que logro gracias al esfuerzo y apoyo de su esposo, una pulperia con mas de trece años en las ventas, y que ha venido incrementando mas productos de variedad con ganancias y financiamiento que ha logrado en Afodenic.
Lo que para ella ha sido de gran sastifaccion, ya que ha ayudado a su familia y a su hijo con los estudios y gastos del hogar. Su esposo sigue laborando como contador en una empresa privada.
Con los prestamo que ha hecho han sido para introducir mercaderia variada y hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, comprara tres quintales de azucar, tres quintales de arros y productos de la coca cola en cantidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes owns her own business which she acquired thanks to the effort and support of her husband.  Her business is a grocery store and she has been selling for more than thirteen years.  She has been increasing her range of products with her profits and loans from Afodenic.  This is of great satisfaction to her as she has helped her family, helped her son with his education and helped with the household expenses.  Her husband continues working as an accountant in a private company.

Mercedes has used her loans to introduce a variety of merchandise into her store and she will use this new loan to buy three 100lb sacks of sugar, three 100lb sacks of rice and Coca Cola products in bulk.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains and Coca Cola products

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de 32 años, convive con Bernardina de 32 años, con quien tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Él es un hombre dedicado, desde muy joven daba el servicio de transporte público, y que gracias a sus padres, lo ayudaron a comprar un vehículo y desde hace 7 años realiza esta actividad. Este negocio le esta generando buenas ganancias, ya que le pone todo el esfuerzo, se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana en busca de sus primeros clientes, entre ellos comerciantes que a esa hora se movilizan al mercado central. La labor que realiza es de constante movimiento, por ello debe procurar tomar todas las medidas para evitar cuelquier tipo de accidente. Actualmente su vehiculo, excedió el tiempo de servicio, por la que se requiere un nuevo permiso. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3000 soles, él abrirá una tienda de abarrotes, para así generar más ingresos ecnómicos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Edwin is 32 and lives with Bernardina, also 32, with whom he has two children. They live in their own house which is located in the Pichari district. He is very dedicated, having provided a public transport service since he was very young. Thanks to his parents, who helped him buy a vehicle, he has spent seven years working in this field. The business has generated a good income for him since he puts all of his effort into his work. He gets up at 4am to attend to his first customers, some of whom are stallholders who need to get to the central market at this hour. The work that he does means that he is constantly moving, so for that reason he needs to take many precautions to avoid accidents. Since his vehicle service date has expired, he now needs a new roadworthy certificate.  

This is Edwin's first loan with MFP and he promises to make his repayments on time. With these 3000 soles he will open a general store to generate more income for his home.

loans.use: to buy products to set up a store

loans.name: Martir

texts.es:
Martir, es una persona responsable, opto por un nuevo prestamo ya que esta iniciando nuevamente el cultivo de maiz.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar herbicidas, abono y semilla para sembrar con el objetivo de que sus cosechas sean mejores este año y pueda venderlo y dejar una parte para el consumo de su familia.
El sueño de Mártir es seguir trabajando todos los años con la institución, y mejorar en sus ingresos ya que los prestamos le han permitido mejorar los cultivos.
texts.en: Mártir is a responsible person who opted for a new loan because he’s once again starting to plant corn.  He will use the loan to buy herbicides, manure and seeds to plant with the goal in mind of having better harvests this year to sell and have part left over for his family’s consumption.  Mártir’s dream is to continue working with the Institution every year and to improve his income since the loans have made improved crops possible.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
La señora Santa vive en un localidad muy bonita en donde celebran la fiesta del patrón san Antonio de Padua el 12 de junio, ella es divorciada y en total tuvo siete hijos quienes ya todos están casados.

     Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como son: azúcar, frijol, aceite, arroz, café, entre otros para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva practicando  dos años y le va bien ya que  ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos de su hogar.
      
      Para dedicarse a esta actividad lo animaron sus hijos quienes le dieron unos ahorritos para que ponga un negocio  en la que pueda dedicar su tiempo y es como se animo a trabajar.

 Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella  valla obteniendo mejores ingresos para seguir adelante hasta que Dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Santa lives in a very pretty location where the feast day of St. Anthony of Padua is celebrated on June 12th.  She’s divorced and had a total of seven children who are all now married.  She requested the loan to buy merchandise like: sugar, beans, oil, rice and coffee, among others to stock her grocery store where she’s been in business for two years and has done well having managed to increase household income.

Her children encouraged her to go into this business and gave her a few savings they had so that she could start a business that she could dedicate her time to; this is how she was motivated to work.  What she most hopes for is that from this small activity she will continue obtaining improved income to continue forward while God grants her life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Blanca Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Araceli vive en un lugar muy  bonita, ella vive en unión libre con el señor Emilio y con quien procreo dos hijos que un están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de la marca a von. 
   
    En donde  lleva practicando  ocho años y dos mese en la que  ella comenta que le va bien ya que ha logrado obtener buen resultado.
 
    Quien  lo inspiro en  esta actividad fue ella misma para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos  de  la casa así  juntos sacar adelante a su familia que es lo más importante para ella.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta peque actividad ella pueda ir incrementado mas sus ganancias así  con el tiempo ser distribuidora de cosméticos que es su más grande deseo.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Araceli lives in a very beautiful place. She is in a common-law relationship with Sr. Emilio and they have two children who are their responsibility.

She is a homemaker and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of Avon cosmetics. Blanca has been in this business for eight years and two months. She says that she has been doing well since she has obtained good results.

Sra. Blanca was inspired to be in this business so that she could support her husband with the household expenses. Together they are able to move their family forward, which is the most important thing to her.

What she wants most from her small business is to increase her earnings even more. Her greatest wish is to eventually become a cosmetics distributor.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín de 33 años de edad, soltero, vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Desde muy joven incursionó en el negocio, es por esta razón que ahora tiene una parcela de plantaciones de cacao, que en estos últimos años esta siendo bien cotizado el producto. Sin embargo sus tierras necesitan ser fertilizadas, para lograr obtener mejores cosechas, pero lamentablemente no existe negocio alguno que pueda proveer de estos materiales, por tanto, montó una tienda de venta de agroquímicos. Él ahora esta contento con este nuevo negocio por que le genera buenos ingresos, y con este dinero desea terminar sus estudios. Este será su primer crédito con MFP por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Efraín is 33 years old, single and lives in his own home located in the Llochegua district. He has been working from a young age, which is why he now has a plot of cocoa plantations which have been highly valued in the last few years. However, the soil needs fertiliser to produce a better harvest, but unfortunately there was no business which could provide these materials until Efrain set up a store selling agricultural chemicals. He is happy with this new business as it has generated a good source of income for him, which he would like to put towards finishing his studies. 

This will be Efrain's first loan with MFP and he promises to make his repayments on time. With this loan of 3,000 soles he will buy more fertiliser.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertiliser.

loans.name: María Manuela De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación, es de clima frió, su población en la mayoría se dedica a la agricultura o cría de animales, su gente es muy amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña María tiene 72 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Su esposo debido a su edad pasa en casa la misma que es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio del trabajo en su juventud.

La Señora María se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, tiene gallinas, vacas y cerdos, los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Ella tiene su propio terreno donde cría sus animalitos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus potreros y alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es de conservar su salud.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank "14 de Agosto" and lives in the community of Zhidmad. A place of abundant vegetation, Zhimad has a cold climate and its people mostly work in agriculture or raising animals. The people of Zhidmad are friendly, polite and maintain their culture and the traditions of their parents. 

María is 72, married and has had eight children who are all adults, married and independent. Because of his age, her husband stays at home which they own as a result of the sacrifice he made while working in his youth.  

María raises and sells animals. She has chickens, cows and pigs which she sells whenever they need the money. She has her own land where she raises her animals.  

This is the third loan she has taken out with the community bank and she will use it to buy fertiliser and animal feed.

Her goal is to keep in good health.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and animal feed

loans.name: Villamar

texts.es:
Don Villamar, vive en el barrio donde San Antonio es el santo del pueblo y le celebra el 24 de junio, el es  soltero  y vive con sus padres.

   El es agricultor y tambien tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, por ello solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y legumbres, con ésta actividad lleva cinco años y tres meses en la que está contento porque le va bien y a mejorado muchos sus ingresos pasos tener a su familia, así también vende verduras  que se dan en la mismas región.
 
    Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad fueron unos primos quienes también se dedican a lo mismo  y le comentaron que si quiere trabajar en la misma actividad  ya que ellos le surtirían con lo que le haga falta, se dedico y es como  hasta la fecha sigue practicando lo mismo.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir mejorando día con día  sus negocio y con el préstamo solicitado comparar mas frutas para tener surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Villamar lives in a neighborhood where St. Anthony is the village saint and whose festival is celebrated on June 24th. He is single and lives with his parents.

Villamar is a farmer, but he also has a business selling fruits and vegetables. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and legumes. Villamar has been in this business for five years and three months. He is pleased because he has done well and has greatly improved his income for his family. Villamar also sells vegetables from the same region.

Some of his cousins convinced him to start this business since they are also in the same line of work. They told him that if he decided to pursue this business, they would supply him with what he needed. To this day, he continues to be in the same business.

What he wants most from his small business is to improve day after day. With the loan he requested, he will buy more fruit to restock his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María del Rosario vive en unión libre con el señor Miguel Ángel y vive en una localidad muy bonita.

    Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra  de marranos para engordarlos y luego por kilo fuera y dentro de la localidad, en donde lleva practicando un año y tres meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que ha  mejorado sus ingresos de su hogar.

    Su inspiración por esta actividad, comenzó ya que también quiere apoyar su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y que  mejor con la crianza de marranos ya que deja buena ganancias, así lograran salir adelante como familia.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda ir teniendo sus propios a horros para comprar un terrenito y ampliar su casa y viva más cómoda.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria del Rosario is in a common-law relationship with Sr. Miguel Ángel. They live in a very beautiful town.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs for fattening so that she can sell them later by the kilo in areas outside of her town. Maria has been in this line of work for one year and three months. She says that she has done well and has been able to improve her household income.

Her motivation for starting this business was so that she could help her husband with the household income. By improving how she raises pigs, she has obtained good profits that have enabled her to move her family forward.

What she wants most from her small business is to have her own savings so that she can buy a small plot of land in order to expand her house and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening and eventual resale.

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación, es de clima frió, su población en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura o cría de animales, su gente es muy amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Silvia tiene 53 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, 2 de ellos son casados e independientes, y sus hijos solteros trabajan solo para sus gastos personales. Su esposo labora como aserrador (leñador), la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Silvia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a la agricultura que es solo para su consumo y también cría y vende animales, tiene ovejas, cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y ganado.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the 14 de Agosto Communal Bank.  She lives in the community of Zhidmad, a place that has abundant vegetation and a cold climate.  The majority of the people work in agriculture or raising animals.  The people there are very agreeable and kind, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

Silvia is 53 years old and married, and from this relationship has conceived five children, who are of legal age.  Two of her children are married and living on their own, and her single children work only to pay their personal expenses.  Her husband works as a sawyer (woodcutter).  

Silvia works in the home, in agriculture for her own consumption, and also raises and sells animals.  She has sheep, pigs, guinea pigs, chickens, and livestock.
 
This is her second loan from the communal bank and she's going to invest it in buying livestock.
 
Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add a room to the back of her house.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, es madre soltera vive con  tres hijos, ella se dedica a vender ropa: short, faldas, pantalones, blusas, para damas caballeros y niños y artículos del hogar como: adornos, hilos, vasos, cintas adesivas, todos los días vende en el mercado, su hija mayor le ayuda, desde hace ocho años se dedica a este oficio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio y comprar más ropa: camisas, blusas y de esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño de Ana es tener una mejor calidad de vida y que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y que en el futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother living with three children.  She sells clothes: shorts, skirts, pants and blouses for women, men and children and also articles for the home like: decorations, thread, drinking glasses, adhesive tape.  She sells daily in the market and her oldest daughter helps her.  She’s been in this occupation for the last 8 years.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business and buy more clothes like blouses and shirts to increase profits because she’ll have a wider variety to offer her customers.

Ana’s dream is to have better quality of life and that her children stay in school so that they will be professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Norma es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación, es de clima frió, su población en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura o cría de animales, es gente muy amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Norma tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad, trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija también estudia en la universidad. Su esposo labora como ebanista, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora Norma labora como auxiliar de servicios de limpieza, esta actividad  la realiza hace 13 años y trabaja todo el día. En casa se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, ella tiene cuyes, cerdos y ganado.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos ya que va a comenzar a críar estos animalitros tambien.

Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the community bank "14 de Agosto" and lives in the community of Zhidmad. A place of abundant vegetation, Zhidmad has a cold climate and most of its people work in agriculture or raising animals. The people of Zhidmad are friendly, polite and maintain the culture and traditions of their parents. 

Norma is 40, married and has three children of 20, 18 and 3 years of age. Her eldest daughter studies at univeristy, works and helps her out financially. Her second daughter also studies at university. Her husband works as a cabinet maker and the house they live in is their own. 

Norma has been working as an assistant cleaner for thirteen years and works all day. At home she works raising and selling guinea pigs, pigs and cattle. 

She has been a member of a community bank for two years and her new loan will be put towards buying chickens and chicken feed for them, since she has also begun to raise chickens as well. 

Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wrenches, exhaust pipes and radiators.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Valientas Y Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Doña  Ana es la Presidenta de Banco Mujer Valientas y Luchadoras, es una mujer muy trabajadora y lidereza comunitaria, con 40 años de edad madre de 4 hijos, todos estudiantes, con quiénes vive, junto a su esposo.
Se enteró de los servicios de Fundación Mujer por medio de una vecina de la comunidad, está es la primera solicitud de crédito de este grupo, ella se dedica a actividades agropecuarias como cria de animales y siembra de algunos cultivos,  va a invertir el crédito en la compra de pollos, concentrados, alimentos y vitaminas para estos animales; Tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de campo, y cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia.
Los principales obstáculos que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de dinero para comprar materia prima, la falta  un mercado fijo para comercializar sus productos y el bajo precio que se ve obligada a vender dichos productos. 
El día de Doña Ana debe empezar muy temprano, para poder atender sus labores domésticas, preparar la comida para sus hijos que se van a estudiar, y luego junto con su esposo trabajar todo el resto del día en las labores del campo. 
Ana y sus compañeras tiene muchos sueños y metas por cumplir; entre las más importantes está la superación personal, mejorar la condición económica de sus familias, ampliar sus microempresas, y su gran sueño es crear una cooperativa que les reciba todo lo que ellas producen y lo vendan en grandes cantidades a mejores precios.  El crédito va ser de gran ayuda para ella y sus 8 compañeras del grupo que van a invertir en actividades como avicultura y porcicultura.
texts.en:
Ana is the president of communal bank "Mujer Valientas Y Luchadoras". She is a very hardworking woman and she is a community leader. She is 40 years old and the mother of 4 children, all of whom are attending school. She lives together with them and her husband.

She found out about the services provided by Fundacion Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) through a neighbor in her community. This is the first loan which she requests from this group. She is dedicated to agricultural activities, such as raising livestock and planting some cultivations. She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of poultry, concentrated food, feed, and vitamins for them. She has a great deal of farm experience and she has the support of her entire family.

The primary obstacle she has had to face is the lack of funds to purchase raw materials. She does not have a stable market to sell her products and the drop in prices at which she is forced to sell these products.

Ana needs to start her days very early in order to attend to the household work, such preparing food for her children who attend school. Later on she works alongside her husband all day taking care of the farm work. 

Ana and her colleagues have many dreams and goals to attain. Among the most important is the dream of self-improvement, improving the financial condition of their families, and to expand their small businesses. A great dream is to create a cooperative that will accept all that they produce to sell in large quantities and at better prices. The loan will be a great help for her and 8 group-mates. They will invest in their businesses, such as poultry farming and pig farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, concetrated feed, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Nanci Violeta De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Nanci es socia del banco comunal Pan de Azúcar, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, por su calidez y gentileza de su gente, esta ciudad cautiva con su  variada gastronomía.

La Señora. Nanci tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo es mecánico de profesión y labora en un taller de su propiedad, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Nanci labora en diferentes actividades, trabaja en una fábrica donde confeccionan ropa, lleva 14 años en este trabajo y es en turnos rotativos. En sus tiempos libres vende ropa y cosméticos de la marca Avon y Yanbal.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños para surtir su negocio. 

Su meta es tener su taller propio de costura.
texts.en:
Nanci is a member of the communal bank "Pan de Azucar". She lives in a beautiful sector of the city of Cuenca. It is a city that is renowned for its architectural beauty, and for the warmth and kindness of the people. It is a captivating city for its diverse gastronomy. 

Nanci is 49 years old, married, and from her marriage she has conceived 2 children, both of whom are grown, working, and contribute financially. Her husband is a mechanic by profession and he works from a workshop on their property. The house in which they live is their own property.

Nanci works in different activities. She works at a production plant where they make clothing. She has been employed for 14 years and they use rotation cycles. During her spare time she sells Avon and Yanbal brand clothing and cosmetics. 

She has been a member of her communal bank for 2 years and this new loan will be invested in the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing to supply her business.

Her goal is to have her own seamstress workshop.

loans.use: to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ever Omar

texts.es:
Ever, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón,vive con su esposa y tres hijos desde hace diez años y junto con su madre, esta todos los días de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm atendiendo clientes.
El préstamo lo utilizara para reparación de su vivienda y necesita: hierro, cemento, ladrillos, arena, de esa forma tendrá más seguridad para él y su familia.
El sueño de Ever es tener la casa en buen estado y que su familia viva feliz y sobre todo que no les falte nada, teniendo siempre su negocio estable.
texts.en:
Ever runs a grocery store.  He sells basic need items like: beans, rice, sugar and soap.  He has lived with his wife and three children and with his mother for the last ten years.  He tends to customers every day from 6am until 7pm.

He will use the loan to do some home improvements.  He needs iron rods, cement, bricks and sand.  This will provide his family and himself with more security.

Ever’s dream is to have his house in good shape so that his family can life happy and, above all, that they have no unmet needs always having a stable business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jenny Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señorita. Jenny es socia del banco comunal Pan de Azúcar, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, por su calidez y gentileza de su gente,  esta ciudad cautiva con su variada gastronomía.

La Señorita Jenny tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres a quienes ayuda con los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Ella hace poco tiempo se ha puesto su propio negocio que es un soda bar, en el cual labora de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. También se dedica a la venta de ropa hace 5 años.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y este nuevo crédito es para la compra de sillas y mesas para su local. 

Su meta es agrandar su soda bar.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Pan de Azúcar (Sugar Loaf) Communal Bank.  She lives in a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its beautiful architecture, its warm and friendly people, and its captivating and varied gastronomy.

Jenny is 27 years old and single.  She lives with her parents and helps with the household expenses.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in her relative’s house.

A little while ago she set up her own business, a snack bar.  She works there from Monday through Friday from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has also been selling clothes for five years.

She has been a member of the communal bank for one year.  This new loan is to buy tables and chairs for her place.

Her goal is to expand her snack bar.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Nolberto

texts.es:
Nolberto tiene 42 años, es divorciado, pero tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre decidido, él es agricultor, pero vio la oportunidad de ganar más dinero montando una tienda, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad, ya que en el barrio por donde vive, muchos de sus vecinos tienen que caminar cuadras y cuadras para poder comprar algún producto. 
Al principio sus ventas eran mínimas, porque su tienda no era aún tan conocida, pero con el pasar de los años logró posicionarse muy bien, y esto se debe a la variedad de productos como la amabilidad que trata a los clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Nolberto, age 42, is divorced and has two children.  They live together in his own house in the Pichari district.  He is known for being a determined man.  

He is a farmer, but he saw the opportunity to earn more money by setting up a store.  He sells basic needs products there.  In the neighborhood where he lives a lot of his neighbors have to walk several blocks to be able to buy a product.

In the beginning his sales were minimal because his store was not yet well-known.  However, as time passed he managed to establish himself very well.  This is due to the variety of products and the kind way he treats his customers.

This is his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to make his payments on time.  He will use the requested 3,000 sole to buy more products in order to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store.

loans.name: Ligia Irene

texts.es:
La Señora. Ligia es socia del banco comunal Pan de Azúcar, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, por la calidez y gentileza de su gente, esta ciudad cautiva con su variada  gastronomía.

Doña Ligia tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 19 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión vendedor, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Ligia es de profesión costurera y labora en esta actividad 25 años, trabaja en su taller de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales de costura para su negocio, también va a comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos.

Su meta es comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Ligia is a member of the Pan de Azúcar (Sugar Loaf) Communal Bank. She lives in a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its beautiful architecture, its warm and friendly people, and its captivating and varied gastronomy.

Ligia, age 40, is married and has two children, ages 19 and 8.  Her first child is in high school, and her second child goes to a school in the city.  Her husband is a salesman.  They do not have their own house; they rent where they live.

Ligia is a seamstress and has been working in this profession for 25 years.  She works in her seamstress shop from Monday through Saturday.  She does not have a fixed schedule.

This is her second loan in the communal bank.  She will use it to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies for her business.  She will also buy school supplies for her children.

Her goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and blessed with three children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through vegetable production and sale. She earns about PHP500 each week doing this type of business. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs sufficiently and to save for the future of her children.

At this time, she has planted more vegetables expecting to increase her production next season, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP7,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. She believes that the loan will help her increase her yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production.

loans.name: Heam

texts.en:
Mrs. Heam is a 37-year-old woman who resides in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. Mrs. Heam has operated her business as a coffee seller in front of her house since 2009. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a local cultivator. They’ve given birth to six children. All of their children are single and, aside from their classes, they always help Mrs. Heam in selling her products to the people. 

Mrs. Heam can generate an average of $1.50 USD per day. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Mrs. Heam and her husband don’t have capital yet to use on their farm. So, Mrs Heam is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers so her crop grows well. In the future, Mrs. Heam hopes to send her children to the highest level of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. Her husband sells CDs and DVDs and copies keys at the local market. Her son is a high school student. 

She started her business in 2000 by selling CDs and DVDs and copying keys at the local market. Her sales go up when the school year starts. Her key copying business brings constant income. She has many years of work experience. She plans to expand her business in the future. 

She is a diligent woman who says, "Due to the distance between work and home, we certainly need a car. I will make sure that I pay back my loan on time." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy a car with 1,500,000 MNT and buy products for resale with the rest of the money.

loans.use: to buy a car and more products for resale.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 56 years old and married. She is thankful because she has been blessed with two children. Linda has managed her business for 10 years now. She sells vegetables and peanuts to earn income. In her business, she gets about P1,500 weekly income. She is requesting a loan of P13,000 to purchase vegetables such as string beans, squash and boiled peanuts to resell. 

Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income that will allow her to support her family and her granddaughter, too.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as string beans, squash and peanuts to resell.

loans.name: Sersmaa

texts.en:
Sersmaa is a 54-year-old widow woman who lives with her children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. Her three children are college students. She started her business with her friend in 2008 by selling meat at the local market. Now she and her partner own two big refrigerators to store the goods. Few people sell meat at that particular market and so she has many clients who purchase the products. 

She is tidy person and thus keeps her products in clean and good condition. She is planning to expand her business. She is a diligent and open minded woman who says, "With the bank loans, I did many things such as paying the college tuition fees of my children. Now they all have jobs. My son also bought a car for himself with a loan from XacBank. I think my children and I are benefiting from the bank loans." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy a wedding gift for her son and to prepare for the wedding.

loans.use: to buy a wedding gift.

loans.name: Junnie

texts.en:
Junnie is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Junnie has operated her rolling store business for 10 years. She also earns an income from vegetable and fish selling. She earns about P500 daily by patiently operating her business.

Junnie wanted to expand her venture, and that’s why she is taking out this loan amounting to P13,000 to purchase vegetables such as eggplant, string beans, squash, bananas and native foods to resell. She hopes to further grow her business to secure her family's future. She is also aiming to give her children a better education so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, she strives hard to earn and save for family progress.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as eggplant, string beans, squash, bananas and native foods to resell.

loans.name: Bumtsend

texts.en: Bumtsend is 61 years old lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. His two children are high school students. His wife helps him to manage the family business. He started his business three years ago by selling wood and coal at the local market. He buys a truckload of coal at the price of 280,000 MNT. Then he packs the coal into smaller bags, and each bag costs 850 MNT. Aside from the coal, he also sells wood. On average, 5 truckloads of coal are sold each month. During the winter he sells coal and wood, and in summer he makes bricks. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I want to expand my business and I have a plan to buy a truck for my business." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy coal.

loans.use: To buy more coal for resale.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is requesting the amount of PHP13,000 to buy feed and medicine for her pig raising business. She looks forward to having a bigger piggery business in the future. 

She is 54 years old and married with four adult-aged children. Her husband works as a farmer in the village where they are living. They work hard together to attain their goal of providing a good quality of life for their children. She believes that one way of doing this is to work harder and always be optimistic in battling through life's difficulties.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Purevlhagva

texts.en:
Purevlhagva is 40 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife sells Mongolian socks at the local market and his two children are high school students. He started his business in 2000 by driving a motorcycle for a taxi service. In 2007 he bought a car for taxi service. He has eleven years of work and business experience. 

Starting in 2011, he took three loans from XacBank and successfully expanded his business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says: "I have many regular clients who ask for a taxi on a demand basis. My business is going well but I want to expand it and buy a truck for domestic transportation." He is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy gas and to increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: to buy gas.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mr. Heng, age 26, lives in the Ornlong Veng district of the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. He is married but he and his wife, Mrs. York, don’t have any children. Mr. Heng works as a local farmer. Presently, Mr. Heng owns a rice-hulling machine inside his home and he provides a rice-milling service to his neighbors for income. He typically earns $4.50 (USD) per day to cover his family’s needs. Mr. Heng has discussed with his wife how to increase income for the family besides their existing work. So, he decided to request a loan fR. Kiva in order to buy some pigs for feeding and for future selling. Mr. Heng hopes that with the increased income, he will be able to buy a bigger rice-hulling machine.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for feeding.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melani, 31 years old, lives with her husband and child in their village and is generating income through her hog-raising business. She also sells feed in their village to earn extra income for daily meals. She aims to save for the future education of her child.
