Melanie is now requesting a loan of P13,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy pigs to raise and sell in the future. She believes that the loan will enhance her business, leading to a higher income upon sale of the hogs that will help to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, a 41-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a security guard, and mother of three children, two of whom are studying, while one is still at home. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

The operator of a rug-making business, Rowena mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers sell. Rugs, a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, are some of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from peddler selling from the side of the highway. Rowena also earns additional income from the direct-selling of products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of Php300 in sales everyday.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php9, 000 loan to buy more raw materials such as fabrics, threads, etc. for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Rowena hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving all her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia, who describes herself as a patient and industrious person, works hard to sustain her family's daily needs. She is 58 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom have their own families now and live separately from them.

Clemencia has been managing her hog-raising enterprise for a year now, the business serving as a source of income that helps her provide for the family's daily needs. Now, she is requesting a loan of P7,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy feed to maintain the growth of her livestock. In order to earn a higher income and save some for future emergencies in her family, Clemencia is doing her best to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed to maintain the growth of her livestock.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
To share the financial burden with her husband, Razia, a mother of five children who are all attending school, is a seamstress who sews clothes with perfect measurement, and her clients admire her for her quality of work. Her husband has a salt-selling business and also offers spice-grinding services to his customers, most of whom are grocery shop owners whose spices he grinds to meet the needs of their customers. Razia supports her husband in her spare time by operating the grinding machine.

Razia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy both another grinding machine and salt to provide better services to his customers and increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past five years, and Razia is confident that the loan investment will improve it further.

loans.use: to buy a grinding machine and salt.

loans.name: Tsedevdorj

texts.en:
Tsedevdorj is 25 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. His older son is 8 years old, a elementary school student and other son is 3 years old. His wife runs a small shop. 

He started his business in 2006 by driving a taxi. He purchased his car by paying 16,000 MNT per day from April 2010 to March 2011. He is planning to expand his business. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says "I took a loan of 1,200,000 MNT and used it for the right purpose." He knows how to manage the loan and pay on time. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials to build a garage at his home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mouth

texts.en:
Mouth is a 66-year-old villager who comes from a low-income family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. This hard-working man has spent most of his life cultivating rice crops on his farmland. Mouth is married and has four children, one of whom is single and the other three, married and living independently. 

Mouth can earn an income around 2.3 USD per day. During the rainy season of this year, his rice crop has been growing well. However, Mouth doesn’t have capital yet to use on his farm. So Mouth is seeking funding from Kiva to purchase some bags of fertilizer and hire some local laborers to plant the next crop of rice. In the future, Mouth hopes that he can buy extra farmland for growing crops.

loans.use: to purchase some bags of fertilizer and hire some local laborers to plant the rice.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old, married and thankful for having three children. 

Her family is her motivational guide, and she works hard to give them a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income and will allow her to support her children and extended family.

She has had a retail store based in their home for four years. The daily net profit of 500 PHP is just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. Thus she is thankful for having other sources of income aside from retailing: She also has raised pigs for 10 years.
 
To improve her income in the store, Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients. She will also buy feed and vaccine for her pigs. Gloria says the loan will be very helpful in the success of her businesses.

loans.use: to buy stock such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients and also feed and vaccine for the  pigs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old, married and has eight adult children. Her spouse worked as a farmer in the village of Lapas, Cabatuan, Isabela. 

She enjoys the daily activities in her hog-raising business. She devotes herself full time to maintaining her business, which is the only source of income she has for her family. After taking care of the pigs for four months, she sells them, earning PHP 4,000 per head.

Carmelita wants to buy baby livestock but she has insufficient capital. That’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and at least one additional pig to raise.

loans.use: to buy one pig and feed.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 12 years. Agripina sells items like canned goods, packed noodles and vinegar to the people in her community. Agripina also grows vegetables in her garden. Her husband is a farmer and she also helps grow rice crops when she can.

Agripina has requested this loan to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles and spices. She hopes for their businesses to grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Maqboolan's Group

texts.en:
Maqboolan is a well-known personality among her neighbors due to her good behavior. She is married and her husband operates a grocery store. Through his store, he sells different grocery items such as spices, sugar, cooking oil, etc, at reasonable rates.
 
Maqboolan is a housewife, and she prefers staying at her home and managing her household responsibilities.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will put a larger quantity of groceries into his store that will allow him to fulfill the orders of his customers on time and increase his profits.
 
He is very experienced in his business and Maqboolan is hopeful that an investment will be more productive for him and make her family life easier as a  result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Maqboolan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for the grocery store business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She has been engaged in the poultry raising business for five years. After feeding her chickens and ducks, she sells some of her grown-up native chickens for at about 150 PHP per kilo to have income for the family's daily meals. 

Marites is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy and sell native chickens and ducks in the market. She hopes to expand her poultry business to save for future emergencies and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase and sell native chicken and ducks in the market.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 41 years old and blessed with four children. She lives with her family in a village. She generates income through vegetable production and sales. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and save for the future of her children.

She planted different vegetables to have various kinds to sell and to increase her production. But due to inadequate capital, maintenance of the business is not possible, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to apply so that her plants will grow healthy and will bear more fruit to harvest. She believes that the loan will help her increase her yields and bring a more prosperous living for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has been running her sari-sari (variety) store for four years. From this type of business, she is able to earn about PHP 300 daily. She is grateful that her income allows her to help meet the daily needs of her children.

She is 33 year of age, married and blessed with three children. Her husband works as a farmer in their village, where farming is most common source of income. 

She would like to increase her income because the profit she generates is not enough. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 in order to allow her to purchase stock of groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, milk, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, milk, and sugar for her retail business.

loans.name: Laili

texts.en:
Laili is a resident of Gulcho, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 48 and married to a woodworker. Laili has five children: four daughters and a son. Two older daughters work in the sewing workshop and the other children study at school. 

Eleven years ago Laili got livestock as a present from her parents and since that time she has been engaged in livestock breeding. If the family needs money to meet their needs, she can sell some livestock. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase three farm animals for breeding. In the future Laili wishes to see her children married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
To make a living, Jocelyn has operated her general store for more than four years. She earns P300 each day in the business, which is being rolled into revolving capital to maintain the business. She is 41 years old and is married with three school-aged children. 

To expand her retailing, she is taking out this loan amounting to P10,000 to purchase stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo and spices to sell.

Jocelyn hopes to further grow her general store and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo and spices to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz Estelita

texts.en:
Beatriz Estelita is a 45-year-old married woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. She started raising hogs a year ago. Beatriz is able to buy their basic needs through her earning from her business.

Beatriz Estelita has requested a loan that she plans to use to purchase piglets, feed and cement for piggery construction. She hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to maintain a good relationship with her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and cement for piggery construction.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and blessed with two children.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for fattening her pigs to ensure good nutrition. Livestock with good nutrition can be offered at a higher price when it's ready for disposal. The business has been operating for just a year and for Yolanda, a net profit of PHP 7,000 is raised for each pig she is able to dispose. The business is quite good for the needs of her family so she wants to maintain it well.

With the help of this loan, in the future, she would like to strengthen her pig-selling business to earn and save enough money to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for fattening her pigs.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum, a 28-year-old married woman, resides in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Mrs. Chum has a life partner in her husband who works as a security guard for a company. They have two children who are attending a local state school. 

Mrs. Chum has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Chum and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise. With the remaining funds, Mrs. Chum will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. 

In the future, she hopes that the increased income will allow her to build a small store in front of her house to sell things for extra profit and support her children to finish a university degree.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets to raise and to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice.

loans.name: Kymbat

texts.en:
Kymbat, 21, is a resident of Ananievo, a small village near to Isykul Lake in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  Two years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, she purchased eggs and began to resell them in another village.  At the moment she rents a café and works there together with her mom and older sister.  The monthly profit from this business is about 10,000 soms. With money received from the loan, Kymbat wants to purchase a sheep, flour and oil.  In the future she wishes to open her own café in Ananievo.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep, flour and oil.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She has been running her food sales business for 20 years. She is also engaged in the hog raising business for additional income. 

Celia is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase different kinds of  fish such as milk fish, tilapia, and big head to sell in her village. With this loan, she hopes to expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish such as milk fish, tilapia, and big head to sell.

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.ru: Мухидин житель района Шахринав. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Сам он развозит людей по маршруту Шахринав – Турсунзаде. Кроме того он занимается перевозками на своем автомобиле. В этой области он восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения запчастей автомобиля.
texts.en: Muhidin lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 39 years old. He is married and has three children. His children go to secondary school. He transports people via the route Shahrinav - Tursun-Zode. He also provides freight services on his car. He has been in this business for eight years. He is taking out the loan to buy spare parts for the car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Kubanychbek

texts.en:
Kubanychbek is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a resident of Ananievo, a small village near to Isykul Lake in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  

In order to earn money, Kubanychbek cultivates agricultural products. He started this activity five years ago with an initial investment of 7,000 soms. With that money, he purchased potato seeds and wheat for cultivation. Selling some part of the harvest, he earns about 6,800 soms to meet the family's needs. 

Kubanychbek is requesting a loan because he needs money to purchase 100 liters of fuel and 100 packs of hay and to pay for tractor driver services. In the future, he  wants to provide his sons with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and potato seeds and to pay for tractor driver services.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators. One of them is Mr. Soun, who has been working in this sector in Ornlong Veng District in Siem Reap Province since he was single. He and his wife plant various crops on their own farmland, which they inherited from their grandparents. From this business, they can generate an income of around $7.50 USD per day. This humble couple has one single child who is a student. 

Mr. Soun has planted a potato crop, which he will harvest when the potatoes are mature. But his crop is not growing well because it is ravaged by insects and lawn. Because of that obstacle, Mr. Soun has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide, which he will use to protect his crop, and hire some local laborers to cut down lawn. In the future, Mr. Soun wishes to expand his business activities by feeding animals for extra profit.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and hire some local laborers to cut down lawn

loans.name: Sunahvar

texts.ru: Сунахвар проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 41 год. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Ее дочь учится в Вузе а сын учится в средней школе. Сама Сунахвар занимается торговлей. Она у себя дома открыла продуктовый магазин. В этой области она 16 лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения продуктов, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара.
texts.en: Sunahvar lives in the Dangara region. She is 41 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Her daughter is now studying in the university and her son is going to a secondary school. Sunahvar is in retail business. She has opened a food market in her home. She has been in this business for sixteen years. She is taking out the loan to purchase food products to increase the variety of her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida is the leader of this group. She is 33, and together with her husband she is bringing up three children, all of whom are preschool age. Aida and her husband work as a team hosting weddings. They started this activity 13 years ago, and these days they earn about 20,000 Kyrgyz soms (KGS) per month. This profit made it possible to purchase a used car, a Volkswagen Jetta, for the family. Aida applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase two microphones that are needed for hosting a wedding. In the future, the family wishes to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek to build a house. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two microphones

loans.name: Kholnazar

texts.ru: Холназар житель района Дангара. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Холназар более шести лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Kholnazar lives in the Dangara region. He is 57 years old. He is married and has four children. Kholnazar has been in the animal husbandry business for more than six years. He mainly feeds and sells cattle. He is taking out the loan to buy several heads of large horned cattle.

loans.use: to purchase several heads of large horned cattle.

loans.name: Medetkan

texts.ru: Медекану 58 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Медекан всю жизнь занимался фермерством  - животноводством и полеводством, и имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере.  С 2010 года, Медеткан занялся разведением и перепродажей скота, использовав при этом свой стартовый капитал в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, его хозяйство, насчитывающее 10 коров, 7 лошадей,  10 коз, дает прибыль около 8,000 сом в месяц. Дополнительно, Медеткан предоставляет услуги тракториста местному населению в период полевых работ, что служит неплохим источником дохода для его семьи. Для дальнейшего развития всего бизнеса, Медекан обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. С помощью доходов от кредита, он планирует завершить строительство дома, а в будущем – купить трактор.
texts.en: Medetkan is 58 years old, married and has four children.  He has been involved in farm work - animal husbandry and farming - all of his life and has a rich experience in this field.  Using a capital of 20,000 som (KGS), Medetkan became involved in breeding and reselling livestock in 2010.  Today, his farm, containing 10 cows, 7 horses and 10 goats, yield a profit of about 8,000 som per month.  In addition, Medetkan provides a tractor driving service to the local residents during the period of farm work, and this activity serves as a not-so-bad source of income for his family.  In order to further develop his business, Medetkan requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  He plans to complete the construction of his house with the help of this loan and buy a tractor in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is from the village of Gumbauan, Echague, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Lucena is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a business managing food production and sales. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish and bananas to the community. Aside from that, she also manages vegetable production to earn additional income. She has been engaged in her businesses for more than 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.
	
Lucena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan amounting to 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase dried fish, bananas, and candles to sell in her village. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to cover her household's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, bananas, and candles to sell

loans.name: Ozuipa

texts.en:
Ozuipa is a resident of Ananievo. She is 41 and married to a driver. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and a son. Her daughters are married and live separately with their families and the son has just graduated from school. Two years ago with an initial investment of 1,500 soms, Ozuipa purchased 10kg of meat and started to prepare pelmeni (a meat-filled boiled dumpling) at home. Selling pelmeni, she earns about 5,000 soms to meet the family needs. This profit made it possible to purchase a fridge for her home to improve their living conditions. With money received from the loan, Ozuipa wants to purchase a sheep to slaughter. In the future, she wants to see her son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора проживает в районе Дангара. Она замужем. Ей 26 лет. У нее трое детей. Ее дети маленькие. Гулнора имеет среднее образование. Она уже два года как занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кредит берет для покупки тканей. Она намерена сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Gulnora lives in the Dangara district.  She is 26 years old, married and has three children.  Her children are small.  Gulnora has a secondary education.  She has been involved in sewing national dresses for two years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.  She intends to sew dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school, and she has one additional family member. Ruth operates a stall at the market selling fruits and vegetables on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last seven years.  

Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more fruits and vegetables like mangoes, pinapples, and watermelons. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Ruth's goal of aspiration is to educate her children to university level and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like mangoes, pineapples and water melons

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells matooke (a Ugandan stew made with plantain, beef and fish) from home on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last nine years. She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van and to build rental houses and educate her children to the university level. She lives in a rented house and her family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Olimchon

texts.ru: Олимчон проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст,  33 года. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Жена его домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу. Он покупает стекла большого размера, нарезает и продает. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки стекол.
texts.en: Olimchon lives in the Dangara district.  He is 33 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He provides a service.  Olimchon buys large-size glass, cuts it and sells it.  He has been involved in this business for 8 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of glass.

loans.use: to purchase glass

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She has a retail store based in her home where she earns about 2,000 PHP a week.

Teresita is also engaged to the piggery business, which she has been doing for two years.  She earns about 8,000 PHP for each pig she is able to sell. 

Teresita is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase groceries item such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients as well as buy feed and vaccine for her hogs to ensure good nutrition. 

Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase groceries item such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients and feed and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Mailka's Group

texts.en:
Mailka is the leader of this group. She is 54 year old widow. She has raised three sons and a daughter; the sons work in Russia and the daughter is married and lives separately with her family. In order to earn money, Malika breeds and fattens livestock and then resells it at a higher price. She earns about 2000 soms per month for her business. Mailka applied for a loan because she needs additional funds to purchase 1.5 tons of cement for house construction. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she plans to finish the construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cement for house construction.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru: Насим проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него высшее экономическое образование. По профессии он экономист. В этой области он не работает. На сегодняшний день Насим занимается бизнесом. Он закупает автомашины и микроавтобусы  оптом и дает в аренду. Сейчас у него имеется несколько микроавтобусов. Недавно он купил еще две автомашины. Он берет кредит для доплаты за автомашину.
texts.en: Nasim lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 31 years old and married.  He has a higher education and is an economist, but does not work in this field.  Today, Nasim is involved in business.  He buys cars and minivans wholesale and leases them out.  Currently, he has several minivans.  He recently bought two more cars.  Nasim is requesting this loan to pay for his car.

loans.use: to pay for his car

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, all of whom go to school, and has one additional family member. Hadjah operates a retail shop which she rents. She works seven days a week and has been in business for the last 10 years. Hadjah has requested a loan of USh800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, flour, soap and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Hadjah's goals and aspirations are to expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop and to educate her children to the university level. She lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, maize flour, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 57 years old, married and blessed with three children. She has a retail store based in her home. She has been running her sari-sari (variety) store business, where she also sells cooked food, for 15 years earning about PHP 3,000 a day. Her family is her motivational guide for improving her business: she works hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that provides additional income and allows her to support her family needs. She hopes that she can get the loan amount she has requested to further develop her business. Juanita is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase groceries such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, meat and vegetables to cook and sell in the village. Juanita is thankful because her income has been increasing.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, meat and vegetables to cook and sell.

loans.name: Barchynai's Group

texts.en:
Barchynai is the leader of this group. She is 61, married, and has four adult children. In order to earn money to meet her and her husband's daily needs, Barchynai breeds cattle. Selling the dairy products, she earns about 2,000 soms per month. Barchynais has saved some money, but she is requesting a loan to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future, she wants to expand her business to leave a good inheritance to her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is 30 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. Her husband is a police officer. 

Nema has a business of selling simsim (sesame seeds), ground nuts, and sugar in Jigomoni, Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Nema is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase more ground nuts and simsim. She will use the profits to buy goats and chickens in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more simsim, ground nuts, and sugar.

loans.name: Kholmurod

texts.ru: Холмурод проживает в городе Душанбе. Он женат. Ему 60 лет. У него один ребенок. Его сын предоставляет услугу, такси. Сам он работает в ООО "Спецтехника". Он берет кредит для продвижения деятельности сына. В основном для ремонта его машины.
texts.en: Kholmurod lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 60 years old, married and has one child.  His son provides a taxi service.  Kholmurod works for a a company called "Spetstekhnika" LLC.  He is requesting this loan for his son's business, primarily for repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old, married, and has four children two of whom attend school. She has a business selling rice,cooking oil, and tomatoes in Jigomoni, Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Jane is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to build a shop for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house, but the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

For the last 10 years, Catherine has been selling charcoal at the market seven days a week. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Now requesting a loan of 1000000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal, her goals are to expand her charcoal business so that she can sell on a wholesale basis and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mwaffaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married, and lives with his wife and his two children.

Mwaffaa has been an owner of a bookshop since 2009. He sells books, stationery, cards, magazines, gifts, games and toys. He has more than two years of experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He has decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to redecorate and renovate his shop.  He is aiming to gain more profit to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Kukutia

texts.en:
Kukutia, a 37-year-old widow blessed with three children, is a livestock trader who has been in business for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES.4,000.

Kukutia, who was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member, is applying for her first loan of KES.30,000 to purchase goats for sale. She will use the extra profit to start a butchery. Very hardworking and visionary, Kukutia also hopes to start a diary farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries to offer for sale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 59 years old and blessed with one child, works hard to attain her goal of a good quality of life. Engaged in her hog-raising business since her spouse died, she believes it is the best way to provide for her family. Gloria is requesting a loan of P7,000 (Philippine peso) to buy feed and medicine for her pigs, and looks forward to expanding her business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Abdel Mottaleb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children.

Abdel Mottaleb has had a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to expand his business and to add more foodstuffs. He aims to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To expand his business and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Soadat

texts.ru: Соадат жительница района Шахритус. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама она занимается посевом овощей и бахчевых культур. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 12 лет. Так как сейчас сезон посева лука, она берет кредит для закупа семян и топлива.
texts.en: Soadat lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 42 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  Soadat is involved in sowing vegetables and melons.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  Because now is the season to sow onions, she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is a single mother of seven children, all of whom go to school. She has one additional family member. She lives in a house that she rents, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Cissy, who operates a rented retail shop selling home products, works seven days a week and has been in business for over 10 years. She has requested a loan of 1000000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and jerrycans of cooking oil. Her other source of income is a restaurant.

Cissy's major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to expand her retail shop into a wholesale operation and to build her own house.

loans.use: To  buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business selling beans and groundnuts in Jigomoni branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income to pay for her child to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
This is Arcelita, 44, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Renato, an overseas contract worker. She is a mother to her three children. Two are already studying in elementary school and one is still staying at home. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arcelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she sells mineral water for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arcelita hopes her business will be stable and dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 38 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged children. She has been engaged in her restaurant for three years. 

At first, she struggled to promote her restaurant because she was new in the business. But as time passed, she learned more about the business and how to attract customers. She earns PHP 3,000 every day and usually uses it for the education of her two children. 

To increase sales, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 (Philippine peso) to buy meat and vegetables to cook, and to buy dishes, glasses, and pottery to use in her restaurant. She hopes it will contribute to a better income in order to save for emergency and educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, dishes, glasses and pottery

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein, a borrower from Iraq, is 53 years old, married, and a father of four children, two of whom work. In 2005, he opened a workshop for car and air conditioning repair and installation. Having worked in this field for more than 15 years, he is well-experienced and enjoys a good reputation in the area.

Now requesting a $2000 loan in order to add more inventory and purchase new tools and materials for his business, Hussein is aiming to gain more profit in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to add more inventory and to purchase new tools and materials for his business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 28 years old and single. He is a livestock trader, and  most of his clients are male. He has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES 8,000 per month.


Emmanuel was introduced to KADET LTD by a client of KADET. He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD which whole amount he plans to use to purchase more livestock. He will use the extra profit to start a dairy farm.


Emmanuel hopes to be the largest livestock keeper in town. He is very hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Chiriku Group

texts.en:
Winfrida, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who goes to school.  She has been running a grocery store since 2006. She works from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. (she works only in the evenings).

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to increase her grocery stock. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Chiriku" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in  paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and the father of two children.

In 2005 Mohamad opened a food market selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field.

His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

Mohamad decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to purchase two fridges for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two fridges for his market.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 24 years old and single. He operates a retail shop where he supplies things like sugar, cooking oil, flour, tea leaves, bread, soap and many others. He has been in this business for the last five years and gets an income of KES.10,000 per month.


Gideon has got a good credit history in KADET and he is applying for his second loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil, flour, tea leaves, breads, and soap. He will use the anticipated profit to diversify his business to open a hotel.


Gideon hopes to own a wholesale shop. He is very hard-working.

loans.use: To buy items  like sugar, cooking oil, flour, and tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Khudoynazar

texts.ru: Худойназар житель района Кубодиён. Возраст, 57 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Худойназар более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает рис. Кредит берет для приобретения разных сортов риса.
texts.en: Khudoynazar lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 57 years old, married and has six children.  Khudoynazar has been involved in retail sales at the market for over 10 years.  He leases a retail outlet, where he sells rice.  He is requesting this loan to buy different varieties of rice.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of rice

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 28 years old and a married woman with three children. None of them are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Jigomoni in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chemicals.

loans.name: Caroline Kadide

texts.en: Caroline is twenty nine years old, married and they have two children aged eleven years and two years old. She operates a beauty salon business at the busy Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa,Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. She has been running her salon business for ten years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy hair relaxers, treatments, weaves and other hair additions. She hopes to grow her business and also educate her children to the university level in future. She describes herself as talkative, friendly and convenient.

loans.use: Hair relaxers, treatments, weaves and other hair additions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children who attend school.  Jennifer and her family live in a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills. 

She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis and works seven days a week.  Jennifer has been in business for 7 years. 

Jennifer requests a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspiration are to build rental houses and educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ndula

texts.en:
Ndula is 26 years old and married to Mulanja. Together they are blessed with one child. Ndula is a livestock trader in the busy market of Bissil where most of his clients are males. He has been in this business for the last seven years and gets an income of KES 5,000 per month.


Ndula was introduced to KADET by client of KADET. He has got a good credit history in KADET  and he is applying for his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to buy goats and sheep to rear and sell later at a profit.

He will use the anticipated profit to pay the school fees of his son. He  hopes to start a ranch. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock with the whole amount.

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en:
Rejina is a married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has a business selling sugar, rice and cooking oil in Jigomoni in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Rejina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more sugar, rice, and cooking oil for sale. She will use the profit to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. She has managed a business raising hogs for 24 years. Her husband works as a farmer in the village where they are living. They work hard to help each other to attain their goal of providing a good quality of life for their children. She believes that one way of doing this is to provide for their needs and to be able to send their children to school. Visitacion believes that education is the key to success. 


Now, she is requesting a 6,000 PHP a loan to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs. She looks forward to the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is known as a woman of faith and courage. She is now 49 years old and has six school-aged children. Despite being a widow, she has the strong determination to educate her children and give them a better life. She endures hardships and difficulties for she wants to continue sending her children to school. 

The main sources of her income is hog-raising, managing a variety store, and direct selling of AVON, Natasha and Boardwalk products. She has been in this business for almost 26 years and usually earns a profit of P8,000 a month which she utilizes for their daily expenses and allowances for the children. 

She aims to improve her business and make it a viable source of income but due to financial constraints, she wants to ask for an additional capital of P30,000 to buy additional stock of soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages, breads, seasonings, lotions, body sprays and jewelry to sell in her variety store. 

Leonida mentioned that through this loan, she can increase her product offering and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continues to work hard and strive to do well.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, beverages, breads, seasonings, lotions, body sprays and jewelry to sell in her variety store.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 55 years old, married with three children. Her spouse works as a farmer in the village of Guayabal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She enjoys daily activities in her hog raising business. She devotes herself full-time to maintaining her business which is the only source of income for her family. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them earning P5,500 (Philippine pesos) per head.

She wants to purchase baby livestock but she has insufficient capital, that’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional piglets and feed to sustain her hog-raising business. She hopes to grow her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and feed to sustain her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Mikala

texts.en:
Mikala is 30 years old, a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Makala requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her child to go to school and hopes to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en: Batmunkh drives a taxi besides his raw materials business. His wife stays at home to look after their daughter, aged 5. Batmunkh is a very hardworking and diligent person who always wants to increase his earnings. His living conditions are not very comfortable and the Mongolian tent is cold during winter. He requested a loan to increase his working capital to buy more raw materials which will raise his income considerably.

loans.use: To increase his working capital to buy more raw materials which will raise his income considerably.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Her main source of income comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been involved in her business for over one year and earns approximately 200 PHP daily from these activities.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seafood products, including fish and shrimp to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seafood products, including fish and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Mersal

texts.en:
Mersal is a 37-year-old married man who has been working selling curtains and cloth for 13 years. He is well-known in the region with his good quality products and special prices.

Mersal also works at tailoring curtains and home decorations. He works hard to improve his business more and more in the region, and that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new cloth collections at affordable prices.

Mersal is a man with a good reputation who hopes he can expand his business more and more in the future to start a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy new cloth collections.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of life, Magdalena wants to improve their standard of living to give their children a better life. She is now 51 years old and has four adult children. They live happily in a village planting and and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. She is also engages in duck raising to generate additional income.  They work hard and endure hardships for they want their children to finish their studies and earn a degree. As a fruit of their patience and hard work, most of their children have become professionals and have a good job. 

Despite of this, Magdalena wants to continue her duck raising business to earn and save for their future. Due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed and additional ducks to raise in their village. She hopes that through this loan, she will be able to raise more ducks that lay eggs for sale.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional ducks to raise in their village.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 30-year-old married woman who has six children. Three of her children attend school. Betty has a business selling clothes in Kaya Road in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Michi

texts.en:
Michi is 38 years old. He is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Michi provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged to his business for more than two years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily.

Michi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase equipment to improve his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 47 years old and married to Naomi. They have been blessed with two children who are in secondary school. He operates a hardware shop where he sells construction materials to constructors and builders. He has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of 15,000 KES per month.

Stephen was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. He is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more timber and other materials. He will use the anticipated profit to purchase a pick-up for delivery.

Stephen hopes to have a big hardware store with a pick-up for delivery. He is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase timber and other materials.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
At the age of 47, Josefina still works hard to acquire profits from her business selling food. After doing her household chores, she goes down to the market and purchases eggs, fish balls, and bananas to cook in the afternoon. She cooks and sells banana que (a popular Filipino street food, it is skewered fried banana with a caramelized brown sugar coating), fish balls, and boiled eggs, which are all ideal snacks for the people in her village. Minimal income derived from her business was just enough for the daily needs of her children. She has three children who attend school.

She needs to buy more ingredients and food items to increase her sales. She had insufficient funds, which is why she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy sugar, coconut, flour, hotdogs, and fish balls to cook and sell.

Josefina would like to continue growing as an entrepreneur. Someday, she also wants to establish a food stall in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut, flour, hotdogs, and fish balls to sell

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo is 51 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He lives with his family in a village and generates his income by selling vegetables. He aims to earn more income to provide for his family's needs and to save for the future of his children.

At this time, he plans to plant more vegetables so he can increase his production. But due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain his vegetable production. He believes that the loan will help him to increase his yields. He is hoping that he is going to harvest a large number of vegetables and earn a higher income to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for vegetable production

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 40 years old. She is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Joice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Svey

texts.en:
Svey, 43, is a married woman who has been living in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province.  She has spent her life cultivating various kinds of crops such as rice, potatoes and soy beans. She is married to Mr. Lim who also works in the same business. They have given birth to three children, all of whom are attending school. Their children also assist Svey on the farm when they are free from studying. This humble couple typically make a profit of around $7.50 USD,  which they use to help meet  the family’s needs. 

The coming rainfall is good for her crops; therefore, Svey would like to request a loan to buy some fertilizers to put on the farmland and to fix her broken threshing machine. In the future, she wishes to expand her existing farmland and see her children through to a high level of education.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizers to put on the farmland and to fix her broken threshing machine

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her early twenties, is married with one small child.  She has been running a fruit and vegetable business for one year now.  She works from 5 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Elizabeth’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Limited. She used the previous loan, which she paid back successfully, to buy items she was lacking and for household expenses.  She wants a new loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Blue", which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nargizahon's Group

texts.en:
Nargizahon, 24, is the leader of this group. Her husband works in Russia, and each month he sends her about 4000 soms to meet their family’s daily needs. Nargizahon is raising a son who is just one year old. In order to earn additional money for the family she cultivates cotton.  Selling part of the harvest, she earns about 2000 soms per month. This profit has made it possible for her to save money to purchase furniture for their home. At the moment Nargizahon is applying for a loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers. In the future she wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to its customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 7 children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (sister-in- law). She sells charcoal at her home counter at the shop that she rents. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the past 10 years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and ever-increasing prices of charcoal. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her retail charcoal business into a wholesale one. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a jolly and optimistic person. Though her life is less fortunate, she still works hard and hopes for a better quality of life for her family someday. Instead of lazing at home, she established a business of raising hogs to fatten and sell in the future to the butchers who came into their village. Mercedes had been in this business for almost three years. She usually generates an income of P3,000 per each hog sold.

She is now 33 years old and has three children to educate. She is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy an additional hog to raise and to purchase feed and vitamins to ensure proper growth and nutrition. 

She wants to continuously provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy an additional hog to raise and to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
With a desire to improve her retail store, Luz spends most of her time in her business. She buys rice and fish to sell to the local community. Her net profits are just enough to cover their daily expenses. 

Luz is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stock items such as fish and rice to sell. She wants to expand her business to secure her family's living situation. She hopes that ASKI would give her financial assistance so that she could improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock items such as fish and rice to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling fish in the town of Jigomoni, Yei county, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more fish for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Jainasyn's Group

texts.en:
Jainasyn is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a farmer. Jainasyn is a heroic mother. Together with her husband, she is raising four daughters and a son. All the children except the youngest son go to school.  Jainasyn works as a teacher at a school. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. She started to breed cattle seven years ago with an initial investment of 30,000 soms. With that money she was able to purchase a cow. With money received from the loan, Jainasyn wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future, she wishes to buy a vehicle for her husband.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Chanika One Group

texts.en:
Florence, who is in her mid 20s is single.  She has been running a charcoal business for one year now. She works from 6 a.m  to  9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania,  which she wants to use for purchasing more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to be able to build her own house one day.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Chanika One" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old, married, and blessed with a child. Her spouse works as a local farmer and Maricel is involved in plastic sales. She sells kitchen wares such as kettles, frying pans, pails, and basins. She offers them door-to-door. Though it is tiresome to be engaged in this field of work, she still enjoys selling items in her neighborhood in order to generate some income instead of lazing at home. She has been engaed in this business for three years now.

Maricel's goal is to diversify her business. That is why she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy basins, hangers, kettles, and plates to sell. This will increase the volume of sales from her business.

In the future, she wants to make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy basins, hangers, kettles, and plates to sell

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 23 year old married woman who has no children. She has a business of selling charcoal in Jigomoni branch, in Yei, south Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Viola requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Victoria John

texts.en:
Victoria is a lady who has four grown up children. Her business is located at Digo Road, in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

Victoria runs a hotel business where she sells food and provides accommodation services. She has been in this business for six years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is competition. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy food and drinks to sell to her customers. She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, venture into the real estate business. She describes herself as God fearing.

loans.use: to buy food items and drinks.

loans.name: C5664 Umucyo Group

texts.en: Thomas is 27 years old and he is single. He owns a business for selling soap and cooking oil. Thomas is the leader of this group, which is called "Umucyo" in the local language. He is the first person on the left side. Thomas has been in this business for about one year and his business is open from 6 am until 6 pm every day. He employees one person to help him. Thomas and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their quantities of soap and cooking oil to sell. Thomas and his team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Floyd

texts.en:
Floyd is from the village of Sillawit, Cauauyan City, Isabela. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Floyd has been operating her general store for almost three years. She earned about PHP 2,500 a month.

Floyd wants to expand her family business, that’s why she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase additional inventory such as soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits and other ingredients to sell.

Floyd hopes to grow and expand her general store to secure her family's future and she aims to educate all her children so that they will become professional someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for educational purposes.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory such as soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta's primary source of income comes from raising hogs to fatten and merchandise. With three years in this business, she usually earns a profit of PHP3,000 with each disposed hog. Profits have been used to sustain the family's daily meals, allowances of the children and the monthly electric bills. 

Julieta is now 42 years old and has been widowed for ten years. She has two children attending school. She has insufficient funds to sustain the needs of her hogs. This is why she is asking for a loan of PHP4,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines to ensure good nutrition.

In the future, she wants to strengthen her hog selling business to earn more income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Bosco is 31 years old and has 2 children, aged 4 and 3. He works with his wife, mixing different paints and selling them. He has done this business for the last 8 years. From the profits, he has managed to build a family house. He would like a loan to buy more tins of paint in order to increase his capital. He would then like to buy another piece of land and continue to support his family.

loans.use: to buy more tins of colored paints to sell.
