loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Mrs. Hean is a 27-year old married woman who has been living in Steung Sen district of Kompong Thom province. Mrs. Hean earns a living by cultivating rice crop and raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for slaughter and offspring. Mrs. Hean is married with a single child who is attending in a local public school. Mrs. Hean generally earns an average of $3.75USD per day. She also relies on income from her husband, who works in the construction field. Now Mrs. Hean is looking for a loan from Kiva to buy extra farmland for growing the rice crop. With the increase in income, she will sustain her business growth and send her child to study for a university degree.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 45 лет, замужем и воспитывает двух детей. Супруг Эльмиры работает таксистом. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, Эльмира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве еще  1991 году,   использовав для этого стартовую сумму 35,000 сом (KGS). Успешно работая в сфере животноводства и имея доход от продажи молочных продуктов, Эльмира также выращивает кормовые культуры на участке в 1,16 га, что позволяет ей обеспечивать кормами свой скот и иметь дополнительный доход от продажи кормов. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. На прибыль от кредита Эльмира планирует закупить стройматериалы для постройки своего дома.
texts.en: Elmira is 45 years old, married and is raising two children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  In order to find a financial support source for her family, Elmira started her own animal husbandry business in 1991, using a starting capital of 35,000 som (KGS).  Successfully working in the animal husbandry field and having an income from sales of milk products, Elmira also grows cereal crops on a 1.16 hectare plot of land, which allows her to provide fodder for her livestock and have an additional income from the sale of fodder.  In order to further develop her business, Elmira requested a loan in the sum of 55,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls.  She plans to use the resulting profit from the loan to buy construction materials for building her own house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, 4 of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. 

Rose operates a retail shop on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 5 years. Her other source of income is tailoring. She has requested for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil. Her major business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. Her aspiration is to educate her children to university level and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house. The family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita and her husband aim to improve their status of living and to educate their children. She is now 38 years old and has four school-aged children. They live in a rural community planting and harvesting rice for sale. They also own and operates a rice milling business (rice processing)  in their village to generate additional income. Sometimes, they experience financial difficulty due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, but they work hard and strive harder to satisfy their needs and to support the education of their children. 

They aimed to continue operating their rice milling business to earn additional income but, due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask a for loan of PHP22,000 to buy rubber roll, diesel oil and a fan belt for their rice mill business. She believes that, through this loan, they will strengthen the business and makes it a viable source of income. They hope that, in the future, they will become financially stable and their children will earn degrees.

loans.use: to buy Rubber roll, diesel, oil and a fan belt for their rice mill business.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years of age, married and has three children. To improve her family's household income, Gemma sells frozen foods in their communities. She earns about 500 PHP a week.

Gemma plans to use this loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more frozen foods such as hot dogs, chicken, and "tocino" to sell in their village. She wants to generate more income so she will be able to save for her family's needs.

In the future, she dreams to open her own frozen foods shop in their village to make her more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods such as hot dogs, chicken, and tocino.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for the shop

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a farmer. Damira is a heroic mother. Together with her husband, she brings up nine children. The older children are employed, the two younger daughters are preschool age and the other children study at school. Seven years ago with an initial investment of 3000 soms, the family started to cultivate agricultural products. By selling some part of the harvest, the family earns about 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Damira wants to purchase 35 liters of fuel to use in collecting potatoes and to pay for the services of a tractor driver. In the future with the profits gained, Damira plans to purchase furniture to improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and to pay for tractor driver's services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, coffee, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Prima has been working hard to manage her grocery store, where she sells food to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Prima has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food to stock her shelves, and will help Prima to generate greater profits and provide for her daily needs. Prima hopes that in the future she will be able to own a supermarket. 

Prima is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Prima who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food to stock her shelves,

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma wants to expand her family business so she is taking out a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional items such as canned goods, biscuits and noodles to sell. She has operated her general store for over two years and earned about PHP 200 every day.

She is 36 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged children. Vilma hopes to grow her general store to secure her family's future and aims to educate her children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving to earn and save for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as canned goods, biscuits and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Saidaati

texts.en:
Saidaati is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married with five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 14 years, Saidaati has been working hard to manage her small shop, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Saidaati has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Saidaati to generate greater profits and provide for her daily needs. Saidaati hopes that in the future she will be able to own a boutique. 

Saidaati is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Saidaati who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mejana

texts.en:
Mejana lives in Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She operates a variety store in the village where she lives together with her family. She has eight children. Two of them are going to school while the rest have their own family. In her variety store, Mejana sells soap, shampoo, biscuits, sugar and coffee. She usually makes a profit of P200 per day. She spends her income on food and for capital to buy both food and daily use products to sell to people in her village.

She is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and biscuits to sell in her store. 

In the future, she wants to grow as an entrepreneur, improve her sales, and boost her profits to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and biscuits to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nanita

texts.en:
Nanita is a hard-working mother who owns and manages a variety store in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is 43 years old and has three school-age children. They aim to improve their sources of income to continue sending their children to school and satisfy their basic needs. Despite the hardships of life, they have a strong determination to achieve their goals someday. 

Nanita is asking for a loan of P23,000 to buy additional stock of snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, soap, beverages and seasonings to sell in her village. She believes that, through this loan, she can increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that in the future, she can grow her business and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of snack food, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, soap, beverages and seasonings to sell in her village

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 60 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Regina who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 27 and 25 years old. He has been a farmer for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET. He was introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer. Joseph will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will venture into poultry farming. His hopes and dreams are to concentrate more on poultry which will help improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the timber business for one year. She started with 3,000,000 and now has 4,500,000 shillings as her working capital. Her challenge is her lack of capital and her vision is building a big timber store and educating her children. Jane needs the money to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Nassulu

texts.en:
Nassulu is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past six years, Nassulu has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand his business, Nassulu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food and other items to stock his shelves, and will help Nassulu to generate greater profits, expand the size of his shop, and improve his family's welfare. Nassulu hopes that in the future he will be able to start a supermarket in Kabwohe town. 

Nassulu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nassulu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his store inventory.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna Guitang is from the village of Villa Luna, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 55 years old, and married with 13 children. To make a living, Myrna raises hogs and operates a food production business. She has been engaged in her business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP daily.

Myrna is requesting a loan to 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed for her pigs and additional stocks of Ilocos vinegar, bananas and blankets to sell in the community. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs and additional stocks of Ilocos vinegar, bananas and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 52-years-old and has been in the farming business for 25 years in his home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is married with four children, all adults save for the last born. He employs two farmhands and produces coffee,milk and peas which he sells to the local market. He is an employee of the government working as a veterinary officer.

Silas has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy a dairy cow. He says the income will enable him educate his child and expand his farming business. He is optimistic about the dairy business and reiterates it will grow owing to his experience as a veterinary officer. He aspires to own at least five dairy cows

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Chhorn is a 24-year-old young man who currently lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Ream province. Chhorn makes a living by cultivating various crops on his farmland that he inherited from his grandparents. He is married with a single child. Chhorn and his wife work in the same business and they make a profit of about $6.50 USD per day to meet the family’s financial expenses. After the rains fall and the land is suitable for production, Chhorn will take out a loan to purchase potato seeds to sow on his existing farmland and to buy insecticides, which he will use to protect his crops. Chhorn hopes that with the increase in income, he will be able to buy extra farmland and buy a plowing machine to use in his business as well.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and buy insecticides.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her family's needs. Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business.

Maria is 52-years-old and married to a responsible man. The couple has been blessed with nine children. She has been running her hog raising business for two years and earned about PHP 2,500 per piglet. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional stocks of feed and vaccine to sustain her hog-raising business. Maria is thankful because her income has been increasing.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of feed and vaccine for her hogs.

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
Salamat is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she has raised eight children: three daughters and five sons. The older children are married and live separately with their families and the younger children study at school. In order to earn additional money to meet the daily needs Salamat breeds livestock and cultivates agricultural products. She has applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wishes to build a big nice house for her sons. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40, married and has three school-age children. Her husband is a farmer who manages their rice farming business. They aim to improve their business in order to earn and save to support the education of their children. Despite the problems and difficulties they encountered in life, they still have the faith and determination to be successful someday if they continue to work and strive harder. 

To improve their business, Rowena is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, fruits and vegetables to sell in their village. She mentioned that she can able to improve the business and make it viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, fruits and vegetables  to sell in the village.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas for brewing alcohol.

loans.name: Kaycee

texts.en:
Kaycee is 23 years of age, single and lived with her family.  

She raises hogs and has been doing so for one year. She earns about PHP 7,000 per head. 

Kaycee is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for her hogs.  She would like to continue to raise hogs and save enough money for her future.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine of her hogs.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is 58 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger (traditional tent like structure), in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

His sons are taxi drivers. His wife sells vegetables at the local market. He started his taxi business in 2004.  Now he and his two sons earn a daily profit.   Their daily income is about 100,000 MNT. 

"Starting next year, my sons will marry and I need to prepare for their weddings and other things," says Batjargal.  

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to redecorate his apartment and to buy a storage house.

loans.use: to redecorate his apartment and buy a storage house.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 29 years old married woman, with one child who is in school.

She has a business selling beans, rice and tomatoes in bulk in South Sudan.  Betty has been in business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC with the hopes of expanding her business.  She says the extra income will be used to open a nursery school.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхон более 4 лет работает водителем такси. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он очень старательный и трудолюбивый человек. Амирхон любить свою семью и хочет содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Чтобы получить дополнительный доход он дома занимается откормом скота и имеет хорошую условию для них. Амирхон хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Амирхон хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота и ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en: Amirkhon works as a taxi driver for more than four years. He is married and is a loving father of three children. He is very diligent and hardworking man. Amirkhon loves his family and wants to support them in good living conditions. To receive additional income he does animal husbandry at home and has good conditions for this. Amirkhon wants to expand his business and maximize his profit. He wants to get a loan in the amount of $1000 USD to buy cattle and repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy cattle and repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is married and she is an active housewife who performs her tasks very efficiently.
 
Her husband is a computer technician who runs a repair and maintenance shop.  He also sells CDs and DVDs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her husband’s business.  With the loan, he will buy computer spare parts, CDs, DVDs and repairing tools to make his business more profitable.
  
He recently started his business and Saima hopes that a loan will make it profitable.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: to buy computer spare parts, CDs and DVDs for husband's business.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is widowed with six school-age children.  She also takes care of her late brother's children. 

Winnie operates a retail shop in Mulago and sells to all kinds of people.  She has applied for a loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. 

She rents her shop.  Winnie has been in business for six years and works seven days a week.  Her sales are her sole source of income.  

Winnie’s business challenges include seasonality and increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  This affects the consumption rate of customers. 

She aspires to own a wholesale shop that generates enough profits to build her own house.   Winnie's current home home has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent, feeding her family and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap

loans.name: Mariyahan's Group

texts.en:
Mariyahan is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married to a farmer. Together they raised four sons and a daughter.  Their older son works in Russia, and the other children study at school. 

Eight years ago with an initial investment of 6000 Soms, Mariyahan started to bake bread for sale.  At the moment her business runs well.  She earns about 23000 soms per month. Her profit made it possible for her to purchase a piece of land, where she built a house. 

With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase flour and coal.  In the future she wishes to see her children get wed.



--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 40 years old and has two school-age children. Her husband is a farmer who manages their rice farming business. 

Due to financial difficulties, they need to earn more income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children. 

Zosima wants to improve her variety store's product offerings to increase her sales and profits.  But due to a lack of funds, she is seeking a loan of P10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, seasonings, breads, soft drinks, rice and gasoline to sell in their village. 

She says the loan will be used to satisfy her customers' needs.  Zosima hopes that through patience and sacrifices, she will increase her income and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, seasonings, breads, soft drinks, rice and gasoline to sell in their village.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 44 years old, single and lives with his family.  To make a living, he has managed a home-based barber shop, for many years. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase materials for his barber shop.  He hopes to expand and improve his business through the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase needed materials to his barber shop

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 30-year-old divorced woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling food in a restaurant in the town of Buluk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Joice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase flour, beans, and rice for her restaurant with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that with the extra income from this loan she will build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, beans, and rice for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jay-Ar

texts.en:
Jay-Ar is 25 years old and is single. He runs a hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. He dreams that his business will grow so he can extend his financial support to his parents before he builds his own family. He continues working hard to be able to attain his goal.

Jay-Ar has 3 sows and 14 piglets. He has been experiencing difficulties sustaining his pigs because feed is costly now.  He therefore decided to request a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed for his pigs. He hopes to maintain his business until he gets married and builds his own family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.ru: Шарафнисо жительница города. Худжанд. Ей 35 лет. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Она имеет среднее образование. Шарафнисо уже четыре года как занимается торговлей. Она открыла магазин, где продает женскую одежду и бижутерию. Кредит берет для приобретения осеней одежды, то есть сезонного товара.
texts.en: Sharafniso lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 35 years old, divorced and has one child.  She has a secondary education.  Sharafniso has been involved in retail sales for four years.  She opened a store, where she sells women's clothing and jewelry.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of autumn clothing, i.e. seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy autumn clothing

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old and married with five school-aged children. With her desire to improve their daily lives, she spends most of her time in her hog-raising business. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them, earning a profit of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), just enough to cover their daily expenses.

She is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She hopes to be able to send her children to school so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the treasurer of this group. She is 44.  She and her husband, who works in the glass factory, are raising two daughters and a son. The son graduated from school this year, the older daughter is studying, and the younger daughter is preschool age (under seven).

In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Gulmira breeds livestock and resells it at a higher price after fattening. She started this business two years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). She plans to use the money received from the loan to purchase sheep to increase her number of livestock. In the future, she wants to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a hardworking businesswoman who is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 children who are still in school. For the last 5 years, she has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. She also engages in horticulture and dairy farming. In the next 5 years, she hopes to become successful in her business. With the loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a responsible housewife who sells fruits and vegetables in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is now 35 years old and has 2 school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, she and her husband want to improve their sources of income to support their family and finance the education of their children. 

Due to inadequate capital, Luzviminda is asking for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her village. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her village

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is is 25-year-old married woman with one child, who is in school.

She has a business selling soft drinks in Buluk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Tereza requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income to build a shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for cooling her soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is 56 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she has been running her hog-raising business for more than five years. 

She is requesting loan of 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feed and vaccines. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Marilou enjoys daily activities in her hog raising business. She devotes herself full-time to maintaining her business, which is the only source of income for her family. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them, earning P7,000 (Philippine pesos) per head.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pose, leader du groupe d’affaire «Etoile», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 36  ans, femme vivant seule, mère de deux enfants. L’ainé a 22 ans et le cadet a 10 ans, malheureusement tous n’étudient pas faute de moyens. Elle est  vendeuse des tomates, oignons, huile Rina, légumes, pommes de terre . Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre, il ya 6 ans. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut de 5$ reçu de son petit frère, ainsi, elle commença par la vente de maïs grillé au long de la route. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 paniers des tomates, 1 sac de pommes de terre,  et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Pose is the leader of the "Etoile" business group. She is a 36-year-old entrepreneur and the single mother of 2 children aged 10 and 22. Sadly, due to a lack of funds, neither of the children go to school. Pose has been selling food including Rina cooking oil, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other vegetables for 6 years. Her initial funding of $5 was given to her by her little brother and she used it to start a business selling grilled corn on the side of the road. She has since successfully completed 5 loan cycles with Hekima and will use this new loan to buy 3 baskets of tomatoes and a sac of potatoes, and to finance other small family projects. Pose would also like to watch her children grow up comfortably and expand her business. She would like to thank Hekima for helping disadvantaged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 3 baskets of tomatoes, 1 sac of potatoes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 56 years old and married. She is thankful because she has been blessed with six children. She has a retail store based in her home, and she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell. She has been running her business for 14 years, and she is thankful because her income has been increasing.

Her family is her motivation for improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children. She hopes that she can get the loan amount she requested.

loans.use: to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 37-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling bread in Buluk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Diana requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit of this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for sale

loans.name: Mycel

texts.en:
Mycel is 35 years old and has an infant. She is a single parent separated from her husband due to conflicts and unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, she has the strong determination to support her child and give her a better life. Through the help and guidance of her parents, she is able to manage her own family. 

To earn income, she engages in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products within their village. She wants to sell more of the said products to increase her income, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P9,000 to buy lotions, body sprays, facial wash, creams, underwear and footwear to sell. She believes this loan will help her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body sprays, facial wash, creams, underwear and footwear to sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Âgée de 37 ans Madame Salimata est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui réside avec son époux et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Salimata, après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho, etc.) depuis plus de sept ans. Elle dispose son propre magasin à Kaboïla I. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ six ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Kotognogontala de Banconi),  elle est actuellement à son 8 ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce 8ème prêt,  25 sacs de maïs, 15 sacs de sorgho et 15 sacs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre soit en gros ou en détail, à une clientèle composée généralement de chefs de famille.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in a large traditional family in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Having attempted several activities without success, Salimata became involved in the storage and sale of grain (maize, millet, sorghum, etc.) over seven years ago. She has her own shop in Kaboïla I.

Eager to better serve her growing customer base, she joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about six years ago. After five group loans in collaboration with a local women’s group (the Kotognogontala Association of Banconi), she is now seeking her eighth individual loan. All previous loans were repaid without problems. 

With this new loan, she plans to purchase 25 sacks of maize, 15 sacks of millet and 15 sacks of sorghum. She buys her stock in various communities surrounding Sikasso, and then sells the merchandise wholesale or at retail to a clientele consisting mostly of household heads.

She hopes that this loan will help her earn a monthly profit of 275,000 FCFA, which she will use primarily to increase her working capital, help with the household expenses, and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to stock up on grain for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is hard working. She wants to expand her business, but she lacks the necessary capital. That's why she is requesting this loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase groceries such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell in their village.

She is 36 years old, married and blessed with three school-aged children. She has been running her general store for a year. Her husband works as a farmer in the village where they live. 

She wants to expand her business and repair the store. She hopes to grow her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and blessed with four school-aged children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through growing vegetables. She wants to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and save for the future of her children.

At this time, she has tried to plant more vegetables to increase her production. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P7,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. She believes that the loan will help her increase her yields. She is hoping to harvest a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 22-year-old married woman with one child who is still too young to go to school. She has a business selling soft drinks such as mango juice and soda in Buluk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Victoria requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She wants to build a house with the extra income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more soda and mango juice for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Yervand

texts.ru:
Ерванду 44 года. Он проживает в деревне Тсовагюх (Tsovagyugh), Севанского региона, со своей женой и 14 летним сыном.  
Ерванд окончил Ереванский сельско-хозяйственный институт. После получения диплома экономиста, он 8 лет проработал экономистом в Севанском филиале одного из Ереванских банков. С 1998 года Ерванд работает спасателем в МЧС. 
Параллельно со своей работой Ерванд разводит коров, кур и пчел. У Ерванда на ферме есть одна корова, 2 быка, один теленок, 30 кур и 14 ульев. Он производит мед на продажу. Благодаря прибыли от пчеловодства и своей зарплате, Ерванд содержит свою семью.     
Ерванд получал кредит от организации Нор Оризон 5 раз и всегда выплачивал  кредит своевременно. Сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 700.000 драм для приобретения нескольких новых ульев и обязательных лекарственных препаратов для своих пчел.
texts.en: Yervand is 44 years old.  He lives in the Tsovagyugh village in the Sevan district with his wife and a 14-year-old son.  Yervand graduated from the Yerevan agricultural institute.  After receiving his economist diploma, he spent 8 years working as an economist at the Sevan office of one of Yerevan's banks.  Since 1998, Yervand has been working as a rescuer for the Emercom of Russia.  Parallel to his work, Yervand breeds cattle, chickens and bees.  He has one cow, two bulls, one calf, 30 chickens and 14 beehives at his farm.  He produces honey for sale.  Thanks to the profit from beekeeping and his salary, Yervand supports his family.  He received five loans from the Nor Horizon organization and always repaid them on-time.  Currently, he needs a loan in the sum of 700,000 dram to buy several new beehives and necessary medicine for his bees.

loans.use: to buy several new beehives and necessary medicine for his bees

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 36 years old and married with four children. To make a living, Janeth has operated her general store for more than four years.  She earns about PHP 500 everyday.

She wants to expand her family business; that’s why she is taking out this loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell.

Janeth hopes to grow and expand her general store to secure her family's future and wants to educate her children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for education purposes.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Né à Sikasso il y’a 32 ans, Monsieur Ibrahima est un célibataire vivant chez ses parents dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, il s’est très vite initié à cette activité de coiffure des hommes depuis plus de six ans. Nanti de ces années d’expériences dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes de matériels de salon de coiffure et divers, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces demandes fait défaut; ainsi il décida alors d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est actuellement à son quatrième prêt individuel, après des remboursements corrects des prêts précédents. 
Ainsi, ce quatrième prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  6 nouvelles tondeuses, 8 paires de peignes  et brosses, 6 bidons d’eau de Javel, 6 bouteilles d’alcool de 90°, 6 cartons de déodorants, 15 cartons de savons Pharmapure, deux douzaines de parfums de différentes qualités et 2 cartons d’insecticide Timor. Les articles sont achetés à Bamako (la capitale du Mali) essentiellement utilisés pour son salon de coiffure  situé au bord de la route R.N.7 avec une clientèle composée  essentiellement de jeunes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 240 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is 32 years old, and was born in Sikasso. He is single and lives with his parents in a large, traditional extended family in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Because he didn't have the opportunity to continue his schooling, Ibrahima quickly started working as a barber over six years ago. Because of his long experience, he has an excellent reputation and orders plenty of salon and other supplies, but he doesn't have the resources necessary to meet demand. For this reason, he decided to join micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is currently on his fourth individual loan, the previous loans have all been fully repaid. 

This fourth loan will allow him to buy 6 new clippers, 8 sets of brushes and combs, 6 barrels of bleach, 6 bottles of 90° alcohol, 6 boxes of deodorants, 15 boxes of Pharmapure soap, 2 dozen assorted perfumes and 2 boxes of Timor  insecticide. Ibrahima buys his supplies in Bamako (Mali's capital) for use in his salon located along the R.N. 7 main road. His customers are mostly young people.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 240,000 CFA francs. With the  profit he makes, he plans to be able to meet most of his own and his family's expenses, pay the interest on the loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his salon.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 43 years old and lives in the airport community. She is married and has eight children between 14 and 23 years old. For the past five years, she has been selling rice. She has more customers since she is the only one who sells rice in her community and she has a very good location. She learned it from her friends. Presently she has less capital because of the rate at which her customers meet up. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. Her plan is to buy land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar est âgé de 39 ans et est père de 5 enfants.Il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à LOULOUNI.
Oumar mène cette activité de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 4 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs et du sorgho. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il  décida de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après un premier prêt correctement remboursé,  il est à son deuxième prêt qu’il  compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de sorgho. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de LOULOUNI. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de SIKASSO et de BAMAKO et souvent il les transporte à SIKASSO au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumar is 39 years old and is the father of five children. He lives in a traditional family in Loulouni.

Oumar has been practicing his trade, selling cereals, for the last four years. His experience in this field earned him a good reputation and he receives cereals orders in particular for corn and sorghum. 

In order to have the required resources to meet his customers demand he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yirwaso. After a first loan that was fully reimbursed, he is planning on using his second loan to buy 2 tons of corn and 1 ton of sorghum. He gets his supplies in the villages neighboring Loulouni. The cereals are stored in his shop. He sells them for cash to his customers who are men or women coming from Sikasso and Bamako. If need be he will deliver them to Sikasso.

With this loan he is planning on making a monthly profit of 150 000 Francs CFA. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Marceli Rose

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Marceli Rose is engaged in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products to generate additional income. She is now 38 years old and has four school-age children. They aim to earn more income to satisfy their basic needs and support the education of their children. 

In this regard, Marceli wants to ask for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy lotions, perfumes, roll-ons, footwear, jewelry and bags to sell. She is hoping that through this loan, she can sell more products and earn a higher income to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes, roll-ons, footwear, jewelry and bags to sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Twivane Mubukene A /gr Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice  fait partie du groupe Twivane Mubukene A. Le nom du groupe signifie « Luttons contre la pauvreté  ». Elle a 44 ans et elle est mariée avec 8 enfant de 2 à 20 ans, dont 6 scolarisés.

Béatrice est agricultrice. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 200kgs des pommes de terre, 50kgs d’engrais, 1 pompe, 60l d’eau et paiement main d’œuvre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter la capacité et d’acheter d’autres terrains de champs afin d’augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Béatrice voudrait être parmi les grandes agricultrices dans ce district. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice is part of the group Twivane Mubukene A. The group's name means "Let's Beat Poverty". She is 44 years old and married, and she has eight children, aged 2 to 20 years old. Six of the children are in school. 

Béatrice is a farmer. This loan cycle is her first one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 200 kg of potatoes, 50 kg of manure, a pump, and 60 liters of water, and to pay for labor. 

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to increase her capacity and to buy more land for crops, so as to increase production. In the next few years, Béatrice would like to be one of the major farmers in her district. With the profits, she plans on improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 200 kg of potatoes, 50 kg of manure, a pump, and 60 liters of water, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии она проработала 19 лет. На сегодняшний день Дилафруз занимается торговлей в торговом центре. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает женскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности она занимается два года. Кредит берет для покупки женской осеней обуви.
texts.en: Dilafruz lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 38 years old, married and has two children.  She has a higher pedagogical education.  She worked in that field for 19 years.  Today, Dilafruz is involved in retail sales at a shopping center.  She has a store, where she sells women's clothing and shoes.  She has been in this business for two years.  Dilafruz is requesting this loan for the purchase of women's autumn shoes.

loans.use: to buy women's autumn shoes

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes decided to engage in a direct-selling business. She learned about the business through some friends and she has been in the business for one year.

She is 46 years of age. She lives with her five children. Lourdes separated from her husband eight years ago. Despite this, Lourdes wants to improve her family's living situation through her business. 

Lourdes is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase eyeliner, lipstick, eyebrow pencil and lotions to sell to her customers. This loan will help her improve the inventory that she offers to customers. Her only difficulty is that she sells on credit, and her customers don't pay for their purchases on time.

loans.use: to purchase eyeliner, lipstick, eyebrow pencil and lotions to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 23 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She has a business selling beans and maize in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Jennifer requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, maize and rice to sell

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly has five children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business making brushes. She has been in this business for the last 30 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more raw materials for making brushes.  Besides this brush-making business, she generates additional income from part-time teaching. She works six days in every week. Milly’s business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of raw materials. Her goals and aspirations include building a house for her children and employing two men to help in brush making. She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest charged. She resides in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making brushes

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en: Dorah is divorced with one child and that child goes to school. She has a beauty salon and she has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a bridal salon. She resides in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, medication and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo lives in an airport community. She is married and her husband works as a teacher. They have three children between 7 and 22 years old, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past three years Korpo has been selling oil, rice, pepper and bitter ball (a pea-sized vegetable used for flavoring). She likes the activity of her customers buying. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, and bitter ball for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and bitter ball for her business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 50 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still studying. Her oldest child sacrificed by working abroad to obtain a good quality of life. Estrella has been managing her hog raising business for three years. She describes herself as patient and industrious.

Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps her provide their daily needs. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy feed for raising her piglets. She wants to develop her business, to earn a higher income, and to save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for raising her piglets.

loans.name: C2945 Tumenyane Group

texts.en:
Lucie is 37 years old and is married. She has six children between the ages of 4 and 16 years. She is the president of a group called “Tumenyane.” She is in the middle on the right side. Lucie sells clothes. She employs one person to help her and has been working for two years. 

Lucie and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes like skirts, pants, shirts, etc. to resell. With the profits from the loan, Lucie and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses and start saving for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Fatullo

texts.ru: Фатулло занимается выпечкой национальных лепешек. В день он выпекает около 350-500 шт. лепешек.  В своей улице он единственный кто имеет лепешечный цех. Потребители является его соседи и жители, которые живет в этом территории. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и любящий отец 4 детей. Кроме того он также занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает фасоль и кукурузу. Его жена и дети помогает ему в бизнесе. Он получает стабильный доход от своего бизнеса и с прибылью недавно построил новый дом для своего сына. Фатулло хотел бы получить займ для покупки муки с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Fatullo is involved in baking national flatbread.  He bakes about 350-500 flatbread per day.  He is the only person on his street, who has a bakery.  Fatullo's customers are his neighbors and residents, who live in this area.  He is a very hard-working person and a loving father of four children.  Besides this business, he is also involved in growing agricultural crops.  Fatullo primarily grows beans and corn.  His wife and children help him in this business.  He earns a stable income from his business and recently used the profits to build a new house for his son.  Fatullo wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of flour in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 21 years old and a married woman with one child who is not yet in school. She has a business of selling breads in Buluk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Agnes requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profits for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more breads for resale.

loans.name: Zea

texts.en:
Due to thehigh cost of basic commodities, Zea is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase different kinds of vegetables and fruits to sell. Zea hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business she will be able to improve the family's standard of living. 

Zea is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. They live in Bantog, Angadanan, Isabela. Her husband is a driver and he also helps her with selling vegetables in the community. Zea uses her income to pay the tuition fees of their children and for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to diversify more into hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Arnord

texts.en:
Arnold is 33 years old, married, and blessed with four school-aged children.  

He has been raising hogs for three years. He earns about PHP 6,000 for each pig he is able to sell. He is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for his hogs to ensure good nutrition. A hog that has had good nutrition can be offered at a higher price when it's ready for sale. 

With the help of this loan, he would like to strengthen his pig selling business and earn enough money to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for his hogs.

loans.name: C18514 Korubeho Group

texts.en:
Antoinette is 43 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 7 and 4. She is a businesswoman selling clothes. Antoinette is also the leader of this group, which is called "Korubeho" in the local language. This word means "effort" in English. Antoinette employs one person to help her and she has five years of experience. She starts her work at 7:00 a.m. and works until 6:00 p.m. every day. She is the first person on the left in the picture. 

Antoinette and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more products to sell, like salt, sugar, cooking oil, clothing and so on. Once their businesses have expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and save for their futures.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Twivane Mubukene B/gr Group

texts.fr:
Espérance  fait partie du groupe Twivane Mubukene B. Le nom du groupe signifie «Luttons contre la pauvreté  ». Elle a 55 ans et elle est mariée avec 6 enfant de 1 à 14 ans, dont 4 scolarisés.

Espérance est agricultrice. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 200kgs des pommes de terre, 10kgs d’engrais, 60l d’eau et paiement main d’œuvre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter la capacité et d’acheter d’autres terrains de champs afin d’augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Espérance voudrait être parmi les grandes agricultrices dans ce district. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer le bien être de sa famille et payer les frais scolaire des études supérieur de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Espérance is part of the "Twivane Mubukene B" group. The name of the group means "Let´s fight poverty". Espérance is 55 years old, married and has 6 children aged between 1 and 14 years, 4 of whom go to school.

Espérance is a farmer and this is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will use the money to buy 200 kgs of potatoes, 10 kilos of fertilizer and 60 litres of water, and to pay the farm labourers. She plans to grow her business by increasing capacity and buying more plots of land in order to increase production. 

Over the next few years, Espérance would like to become one of the district´s biggest farmers. She plans to use her profits to improve her family´s standard of living and pay her children´s higher education expenses.

loans.use: to buy 200 kgs of potatoes, 10 kilos of fertilizer and 60 litres of water, and to pay the farm labourers.

loans.name: Choijamts

texts.en:
Choijamts is 52 years old, married, and has two teenage children. He lives in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent, with his family. He has been driving a taxi for more than 15 years. During the first eight years he drove a company car, but for the last seven years he has been driving his own car to run a transportation business. With his many years of experience, he has a lot of loyal customers and his business is expanding rapidly. 

His family is made up of very hardworking people and they always wanted to build their own house. Choijamts has been saving to build a house. Unfortunately, there is still need of some extra funds to finish the house building. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building his house.

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en:
Ainagul is the leader of this group. She is 54 years old and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she has raised four children. All the children are married and live separately with their own families. 

Four years ago, with an initial investment of 6,000 soms, Ainagul began to take orders for sewing Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets. At the moment she needs money to purchase fabrics and sewing materials. For this purpose, she is applying for the loan. In the future, with the profits gained from her business, she plans to repair her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sewing materials.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is a 43-year-old, divorced father of an 18-year-old daughter. He lives in his sister’s apartment with her family. He runs a taxi business with his own car. He dreams to have his own home someday and start a new life. He is seeking every opportunity to earn money. 

Now he has a plan to start a new business of construction designation. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy a mastic mixer machine to start planning his new business. He believes it will increase his income notably.

loans.use: to buy a mastic mixer machine to start planning his new business.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Genaro is 42-years-old, married and blessed with two school-aged children. He has been selling ice drops and vegetables in the village where they are living with his family for 1 year. He earns about PHP 500 a day.

He is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase ice drops and vegetables to resell. In the future he would like to have his own ice drop stall so he can send his children to school and to give his family a progressive standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ice drops and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Tukhta

texts.ru: Тухта жительница города Худжанд. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Она имеет среднее образование. Тухта рядом с домом открыла лавку, где продает газеты и журналы. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки канцелярских товаров.
texts.en: Tukhta lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 48 years old, married and has one child.  She has a secondary education.  Tukhta opened a store near her house, where she sells newspapers and magazines.  She has been involved in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of office supplies.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is from the village of Mabantad. She is 35-years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living she has operated her general store for over three years.  She earns about PHP 12,000 a month.

She wants to expand her family business. That is why she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, biscuits, shampoo, detergent soap, and ingredients to sell.

Rosalinda hopes to grow and expand her general store to secure her family's future and to educate her children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life they are striving hard to earn and save for education purposes.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, biscuits, shampoo, detergent soap, and ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Sokhibnazar

texts.ru: Сохибназар честный, добросовестный предприниматель. Он занимается продажей продуктов питания. Сохибназар женат и у него сын, также с ним живет сестра и племянник, которому 18 лет. Он занимается куплей  продажей уже 4 года. Сохибназар хочет расширить торговлю, чтобы пополнить семейный бюджет. Для  этой цели он хочет получить займ  на сумму 7700 сомони, надеясь на вашу поддержку, он благодарит вас за помощь.
texts.en: Sokhibnazar is an honest and conscientious businessman. He sells food products. Sokhibnazar is married and has a son, and also his sister and nephew who is eighteen years old live with him. He has been in this business for four years now. Sokhibnazar wants to expand his business so that he can refill his family budget. With this purpose he wants to get a loan in the amount of 7,700 somoni and hopes for support and thanks everyone for the help.

loans.use: to expand business and build a store.

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en:
Bayanmunkh is 36-years-old and lives with his wife and two children in Mongolia. His two daughters both attend kindergarten. He has been driving a taxi for one year and his wife runs a tailoring business. He is a very diligent person who always cares about his family's wellness.
 
Recently Bayamunkh has purchased a small sized piece of land in the suburban area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Now he is planning to build a house on his land but he lacks the money lack to build his new house. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials to start building the family house on the land he has just purchased.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to start building a family house on the land he has just purchased.

loans.name: Bannawag

texts.en:
Bannawag started his hog raising business two years ago with three piglets for fattening. Bannawag is 48 years of age and is married. They are blessed with two children who they are sending to school. With his duration in business, Bannawag learned that his business is more profitable if he has a pig for breeding.

Bannawag is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He believes that the loan will be a big help for him to maintain his business. He hopes to continue sending his children to school until college through the profits he earns from the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar, 55, lives with his family in an apartment. He has only one son who is 29 years old and lives with his parents. 

Otgonbaatar has been working at the Mongolian Railway Company as a welder for many years. Now he is a guard for the company, since he is going to retire soon. 

His dream is to build a house for his son and help him to start his life. Fortunately, he already started building the house and is 90 percent finished. Now he needs funding to finish the house and he is requesting a loan for it.

loans.use: To finish building a house for his son.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба жительница города Худжанд. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Она окончила институт бизнеса и сервиса. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей женской и школьной одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки женской зимней одежды.
texts.en: Nasiba lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 23 years old, married and has two children.  She graduated from a business and service institute.  Today, Nasiba is involved in sales of women's and school clothing.  She has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of women's winter clothing.

loans.use: to buy women's winter clothing

loans.name: Wend Mi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Maïmouna est la représentante du groupe WEND MI. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé 01an.01 va à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des objets plastiques (plats, sceau, des pots pour enfants, des paniers etc.) depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 23 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter des sceaux, des plats, des bols et des gobelets en plastique tous en douzaine.

Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour améliorer son activité et aider son mari dans la scolarité des enfants. Elle ambitionne voyager en Côte d’Ivoire pour acheter ses marchandises et devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Maïmouna is the representative of the "Wend Mi" group. She is married and the mother of 3 children aged between 1 and 7, one of whom attends school. Maïmouna has 4 dependents in all. She has been selling plastic items (plates, buckets, potties, baskets, etc.) for 5 years, and she gets her supplies from her local town market in sector 23. She will use this loan to restock with a dozen buckets, plates, bowls and goblets. 

Maïmouna plans to use her profits to improve her business and support her husband with the children's educational expenses. She hopes one day to become a large retailer and to be able to travel to the Ivory Coast to get her supplies.

loans.use: to buy a dozen plastic buckets, plates, bowls and goblets.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 37 years old, married and has four children. She enjoys daily activities in her hog-raising business. She devotes her full time in maintaining her business, which is the only source of income for her family. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them, earning PHP 5,000 per head. She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Jovelyn is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feed and vaccine for her hog-raising business. She plans to use additional revenue from the business towards the improvement of their general living condition.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 23 years old and single.  

To earn a living, he sells clothes. He has employed two people in his business. He was previously operating a retail shop.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access business loans and get financial education. He hopes to have a well-established business in the future for more income generation.  

He has requested 40,000 KES to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Lavrent

texts.ru:
Лаврент родился в 1956 г. в деревне Срашен, Сьюникского региона. После окончания восьми классов школы-интерната города Капана, он поступил в профессионально-техническое училище, где получил специальность маляра. Лаврент работает по своей специальности на Каджаранском Медно-молибденовом комбинате уже в течение долгих лет. 
Жена Лаврента домохозяйка, дочь замужем и живет отдельно, а сын Лаврента вместе со своей семью живет с родителями. 
С 2005 года Лаврент вместе с сыном занимаются сельским хозяйством в деревне Неркин Анд (Nerkin Hand). На своей ферме они разводят крупный рогатый скот, овец, коз, свиней. Также они выращивают картофель на продажу. Говядину, баранину, свинину, а также молоко и овечью шерсть Лаврент реализует своим постоянным клиентам в городе Капане. 
Лавренту необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для завершения строительства нового хлева для своих коров, овец и коз.
texts.en: Lavrent was born in 1956 in the Srashen village of the Syunik region.  After completing eight grades of a Kapan boarding school, he went to a professional technical college, where he obtained a painter specialty.  Lavrent has been working in his field at the Kajaran copper-molybdenum factory for many years.  Lavrent's wife is a homemaker, daughter is married and lives separately, and Lavrent's son and his family live together with the parents.  Since 2005, Lavrent and his son have been involved in agriculture in the Nerkin Hand village.  They breed cattle, sheep, goats and pigs at their farm.  They also grow potatoes for sale.  Lavrent sells beef, lamb, pork and milk and sheep wool to his loyal customers in the town of Kapan.  Lavrent needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram to finish construction of a new barn for his cows, sheep and goats.

loans.use: to finish contruction of a new barn for his cows, sheep and goats

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh, 27, lives with his wife and two children in a small house in Dornod, a province located far from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. 

He transports passengers around the region with his motorbike. He has been doing the business for two years successfully. His wife works in a private company as a food technologist. 

Their family house is quiet old, and the roof, floor and wall have become dangerous. He is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to repair  his house so it is safe to live in.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butte, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata, who is from San Juan, Alicia, Isabela, is 53 years old, married, and has three grown children. To make a living, Fortunata has been raising livestock.for over 40 years, primarily pigs for fattening and sale. She earns approximately P5,000 (Philippine peso) a month.

Fortunata joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha has applied for a loan with Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business of selling animals. He buys goats and sheep, raises them, and then sells on Eid (a Muslim festival) to butchers for a profit. With the loan, he will buy goats and sheep to sell at higher profits. 

Martha herself is a seamstress. She sews very good quality clothes that earn her good profits every month. Her customers are mostly her community members who trust her work and place regular orders with her every month.
