She has given birth to five children; all of them are enrolled in a local school getting their education. She is a very caring mother and she works very hard in her business in order to pay for her children’s education.
 
She is very confident that an investment will be productive for her husband and will improve his business condition. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application with Asasah.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for selling.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат трудолюбивая, честная женщина. Она более 10 лет занимается  откормом и разведением скота. В настоящее время у нее 6 овец, одна корова с теленком. У Саодат 3 гектара абрикосового сада, с которого ежегодно получает 5 тонн кураги. Она замужем, имеет 2 детей. Саодат  также занимается покупкой  и отправкой  сухофруктов в Российскую Федерацию. Реализацией товара в России занимается муж. Саодат  хочет купить корову и овца. Для расширения этого бизнеса она хотела бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США. Она надеется, на вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Saodat is a hardworking and honest woman. She is married and has two children. She has been feeding cattle and doing animal husbandry for more than ten years. At this time she has six sheep, one cow and a calf. Saodat has three hectares of apricot garden from which she gets five tons of dried apricots a year. Saodat also does buying and selling of dried fruits in the Russian Federation. Her husband helps her with selling of the goods. Saodat wants to buy a cow and a sheep. To expand this business she wants to get a loan in the amount of $2,000 USD. She hopes for everyone's support and help.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, 33 years old, is a married woman with six children, all of whom are in school.

She has a business of selling fish in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Monica requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 40 years old, married and blessed with six children. He has operated a three-wheeled motorcycle for 10 years as a source of income. He earns PHP 250 daily to buy food and pay his electric bill. This income is not enough to provide for the daily needs of his family members, so he is working hard to increase his income potential every day.

Roger joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He wants to purchase spare parts such as wheels and new tires for his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as wheels and new tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John has requested another loan of 70,000 KES to buy men's trousers. He had used his previous loan to buy men’s trousers. He witnessed a tremendous growth in his business. He was able to get more income to support his family including educating his child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatou Binetou

texts.fr: Madame  Fatou  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 35 ans.  Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 11 ans.  Depuis plus de 10 ans elle s’adonne   au commerce d’habits.  En même temps elle pratique l’activité de couture.  Elle a opté pour cette activité dans le but de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des besoins familiaux.  C’est le fait de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices qui l’intéresse  dans son activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2002. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs  prévu pour  ses frais de voyage vers 2 pays limitrophes du Sénégal et l’achat de  tissus et d’habits destinés a la vente. Elle souhaite rentabiliser son activité e avec l’accroissement  de ses profits améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa  famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou lives in Senegal. She is 35 years old and married with three children ranging in age from 3 to 11 years old. She has been selling clothing for over 10 years. As a secondary activity, she is also a seamstress. She does this to support her husband in taking care of their family. What appealed to her in this choice of activity was the ability to earn substantial profits. 

She became a member of a U-IMCEC branch in March 2002. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs to travel to two neighboring countries of Senegal and purchase fabrics and clothes for resale. She hopes that a boost in revenue will help to make her business profitable and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers and onions for her business.

loans.name: Mirzosaid

texts.ru: Мирзосаид честный, трудолюбивый. Раньше он продавал мебель, вот уже год занимается  покупкой и реализацией продуктов питания. Он приобретает товар с центрального рынка. Жена помогает ему в бизнесе, у них 2 детей. У Мирзосаида собственный магазин. Он имеет хорошую репутацию. Мирзосаид хочет развить бизнес, но у него нет достаточных средств. Он просит займ в размере 1000$ США и надеется, что вы ему поможете. Мирзосаид заранее благодарит вас за понимание.
texts.en: Mirzosaid is honest and hardworking. Previously he has been selling furniture but since last year he has managed his own grocery store. He purchases goods to sell in his store from the central market. His wife helps him with his business and they have two children together. Mirzosaid's grocery store has a good reputation. He would like to add more variety to the goods he offers in his store, but he is lacking the capital to make the bulk purchases. That is why Mirzosaid is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars and he is hoping for your help. Mirzosaid would like to thank all of his lenders in advance!

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and married to David. She supports a family of ten people. She is a farmer who grows flowers and fruits. She has been doing this for a period of six years. 

She has applied for a loan of Ksh 20,000 which she will use to purchase irrigation pumps to enlarge the irrigated land. She earns an income of Ksh 4,000 per month.

The anticipated profit that she will make will be used to expand the farm. This is her first loan with KADET. Her hope for the future is for her farming activity to be successful and to supply fruits country-wide.

loans.use: to buy more irrigation pumps.

loans.name: Nursifat

texts.ru: Нурсифат жительница Шахритуского района. Возраст, 54 года. Она вдова. Имеет троих детей. У нее высшее образование. По профессии она педагог. В этой области она работает 34 года. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. Нурсифат выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа топлива, семян лука и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Nursifat lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 54 years old, a widow and has three children.  She has a higher education and is a teacher by profession.  She has been working in this field for 34 years.  Besides this work, she is involved in agriculture.  Nursifat grows vegetables for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel, onion seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fuel, onion seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 28 years old and is married to Beatrice. They have three children; 10, 3 and 2 years old.

Jared has a business of selling belts, hair combs, mirrors, etc., and he has been doing this for one year. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to increase his stock of belts, hair combs and mirrors for sale.

He hopes to own a shop for doing his business in the future.

loans.use: To increase his stock of belts, combs and mirrors.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is married and has seven children, four of whom work and two of whom attend school.  Her husband works in a factory earning a meager income. 

Zahida has been operating a school canteen for the last 10 years to financially support her husband and family. Through her canteen, she sells cold drinks, snacks, and other foods to school children. Her rates are very reasonable and she earns a good profit every month. 

Zahida is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her canteen business. With the loan, she will  purchase cold drinks, snacks, juices, etc. in larger quantities for selling and increasing her profits.  She is very confident that an investment will help her improve her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase cold drinks, snacks, and juices for canteen business.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette est une femme mariée de 40 ans qui habite sur le territoire sénégalais. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 9 et 18 ans.  Elle évolue actuellement et depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de poissons. Auparavant elle a  pratiqué  la vente d’habits pendant  20ans.  La raison qui l’a poussé  a changer  les produits qu’elle vend  est le fait que les poissons génèrent plus de bénéfices  ce qui importe le plus pour elle. Elle est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003. Elle  a déjà bénéficié de 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons à vendre. Elle compte renforcer son fonds de roulement pour mieux développer son activité de vente de poissons. Son objectif c’est d’améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Maguette lives in Senegal. She is 40 years old and the mother of 4 children aged between 9 and 18. She sold clothes for 20 years before deciding to sell fish, which she has been doing for over a decade. She switched from selling clothes to selling fish because the latter business was more profitable, the most important consideration for her. She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since November 2003 and has already received 3 loans. She is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs, which will increase her working capital and enable her to buy some fish for resale, and develop her business further. Her ultimate goal is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha,  Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez ensino superior e pretende dar continuidade com os seus estudos. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa. 

Saiu de Namaacha para Boane para dar continuidade com os seus estudos, trabalha como docente no Ministerio da Educação ha mais de 19 anos  e tem um salario de 7.395.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria .
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 30.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, ferro, pedra e outros).
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo, in southern Mozambique. A married mother of two school attending  children. She completed secondary education and intends to continue her studies.  She lives in her own home with her family and sustains her mother by sending some money to help with household expenses.

She left Namaacha for Boane to continue with her studies. She has worked as a lecturer at the Ministry of Education for over 19 years and has a monthly salary of 7.395.00 meticais (MZN) which she applies to household expenses and some savings to her bank account.

She has never had loans in other banks. She heard of Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 30.000.00 meticais (MZN) with which she would buy material to work on her home (sand, cement, iron, stone and other).

She has agreed to repay the loan without issue and looks to the future to complete her home for the comfort of her family.  She hopes to ask for future loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy material to work on her home (sand, cement, iron, stone and other).

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is from the village of Gantiadi in southern Georgia.  She is 37 years old and lives with her husband, Nodar and their 12 year old son, Giorgi.  Her son attends school.  Tsiala and Nodar have three milk cows and they sell milk locally to the dairy product wholesalers.  Also, they grow potatoes on a family-owned 0.3 hectare land parcel.  The harvested potatoes are sold in Tbilisi, the capital city. Their agricultural activities provide an average income of 600 Lari (approximately 360 USD) per month.  Additionally, Nodar works as an artisan in the village.

Tsiala requested credit to finance some seasonal farm expenses.  Specifically, 200 Lari (also called GEL) will be spent to pay the workforce for harvesting potatoes.  The remaining 800 Laris will be used to purchase hay to feed the cows during the winter months.  In the spring, calves will be sold for a good price, providing income to the family.  The harvested potatoes will be sold during the winter months.

loans.use: to purchase hay to feed three milk cows and cover potato harvest-related costs.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Муслима честная, трудолюбивая женщина. Более 4 лет она занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. За это время Муслима достигла больших успехов в бизнесе. Она в основном занимается продажей  ткани и женской одежды. У Муслимы также у магазина есть салон красоты.  Она  является руководителем этого салона. Муслима имеет  двоих детей, сын помогает ей в бизнесе. В  будущем она хочет расширить бизнес и открыть швейный цех.  Муслима поэтому обращается к вам и просит помочь в предоставлении  займа на сумму 1680$ США. Она надеется, что вы не откажете ей в помощи и благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Muslima is an honest and hardworking woman. She has been a businesswoman for the last four years and has been very successful in her endeavors. Muslima's main occupation is selling fabrics and women apparel. Muslima's store also has a beauty parlor which she manages. Muslima is a mother of two children and her son helps her with business. In the future she would like to expand her store to also include a sewing shop. That is why Muslima has turned to you to ask for a loan of $1680. She hopes that you will not deny her your help and is very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez 9ª classe e não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua sogra enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa. 

Tem um negocio proprio ha mais de 3 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para obra da sua casa (barrotes, cimento, chapas, vidros, pedra e outros). Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 16.000.00mt e 23.000.00mt e foram aplicados para inicio da obra da sua casa.
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Eugenia was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name in the South of Mozambique, is married and the mother of 2 children who both attend school. She completed 9th grade and didn’t continue her education due to financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother-in-law by sending some money to help with household expenses.

She has had her own business for more than 3 years and has a monthly income of around 10,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she applies to household expenditures and saves in her bank account.

She has never had loans with other banks and came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku for the value of 25,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase materials for the construction of her home (beams, cement, sheets, windows, stone and others). Her previous loans were for 16,000.00 MZN and 23,000.00 MZN and were used to begin the construction of her home.

She commits to paying off this loan without problems and in the future intends to complete the build of her house to improve the comfort of her family – as such she will solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase materials for the construction of her home (beams, cement, sheets, windows, stone and others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase products (rice, flour, sugar, oil and others) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction materials for his home (cement, stone, sand, blocks and others)

loans.name: Mamasoli

texts.ru: Мамасоли проживает в районе Кубодиен. Он женат. Ему 37 лет. У него пятеро детей. Он уже восемь лет как занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном он продает овощи. В торговле ей помогает его жена. Он берет кредит для покупки несколько мешков лука, картошки и моркови.
texts.en: Mamasoli lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 37 years old, married and has five children.  He has been involved in sales at the market for eight years.  Mamasoli primarily sells vegetables.  His wife helps him in this business.  He is requesting this loan to buy several sacks of onions, potatoes and carrots.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of onions, potatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue work on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 cases of "thiof," a fish in the species of grouper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, stone, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Saleh's Group

texts.en:
Saleh is a 45-year-old housewife who performs her household responsibilities at home.  She is very caring and her family is very happy with her nature.  Saleh’s husband is a fruit seller who sells fresh, seasonal fruit to his customers for a good profit.  She is the mother of two daughters who are both very young and have not yet started their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business.  He will buy fresh, seasonal fruit in bulk to increase his sales and profit.  Saleh’s husband has been in this business for many years and she is confident that an investment will make his business more profitable. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saleh”.

loans.use: to support her husband's business so he can buy fresh,seasonal fruit in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Mocuba, Provincia  da Zambezia, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos que ainda não tem idade escolar. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatorio. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Zambezia para Maputo ( Boane) cumprindo com o serviço militar, é funcionário do Ministerio da Defesa ha mais de 25 anos e tem um salario de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BARCLAYS).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (barrotes, chapas, areia, cimento, pedra, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.500.00mt,8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt,12.000.00mt,e 14.000.00mt, aplicados para a obra e bens da sua casa.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para concluir a sua casa e iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Celestino was born in the district of Mocuba, in the province of Zambezia in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two school-age children. He went to school through the third grade but dropped out in order to complete his compulsory military service. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Zambezia for Maputo (Boane) to fulfill his military service. He's been an official at the Ministry of Defense for more than 25 years and earns a salary of 4,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account.He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fifth loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (rebar, sheet metal, sand, cement, stone, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 5,500, 8,500, 10,000, and 14,000 meticals, were all also used for his home. He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house and start his own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (rebar, sheet metal, sand, cement, stone, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: João

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 7 filhos todos maiores de idade. Fez o nivel primário e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 4 netos que vivem com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante ha mais de 14 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um Vizinho que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, amendoim, peixe, óleo, massa, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
João was born in the District of Boane, in the Province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique, is married and the father of 7 children, all adults. He completed primary school and didn't continue his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and supports another 4 grandchildren who live with him.

He has never left his home town, has been a trader for more than 14 years and has a monthly income of around 10,000.00 meticals (MZN) which he spends on household expenses and saves in his bank account (BIM). 

He has never had loans with other banks and came to know Hluvuku through a neighbour who is also a client of this institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase products (beans, peanuts, fish, oil, pasta and others) to increase the quantity of his goods.

He commits to paying off the loan without problems and in future intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku to increase his commercial activity.

loans.use: purchase products (beans, peanuts, fish, oil, pasta and others) for resale

loans.name: Jaqueline F

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui vend des produits halieutiques notamment le poisson frais, le poisson séché et le poisson fumé.Elle écoule son produit sur les marchés de sa localité, ce qui lui assure des revenus pour prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille .Pour renorcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 250000F de l'UIMCEC pour acheter  du poisson et des produits entrant dans la transformation .
texts.en:
Jacqueline sells fish products, in particular fresh fish, dried fish, and smoked fish. She sells her products on the markets of her city, which assures her an income to provide for herself and her family.

In order to bolster her working capital, she's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in order to buy fish and products needed for the transformation process.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of fish and products needed for the transformation process

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos todos maiores de idade. Frequenta o 2º ano do Instituto Comercial. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É  comerciante ha mais de 15 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt e uma pensão militar de 8.924.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos (BIM) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção DE capoeiras para producao de frangos de corte (ferro, areia, pedra, cimento e outros) para garantir o crescimento do seu negocio.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua actividade comercial e obter maiores rendimentos.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the city of Maputo in the Province of the same name in the south of Mozambique, is married and the mother of 6 children, all adults. She attends 2nd year of the Commercial Institute. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has been a trader for more than 15 years and has a monthly income of around 2,000.00 meticals (MZN) and a military pension of 8,924.00 MZN which she uses on household expenditures and saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has had loans from other banks (BIM) and managed to pay those off without difficulty. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku for the value of 20,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase materials for the construction of chicken coops for the production of chickens for slaughter (iron, sand, rock, cement and others) to guarantee the growth of her business.

She commits to paying off the loan without problems and in the future intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku to increase her commercial activity and obtain a greater income.

loans.use: purchase materials for the construction of chicken coops (iron, sand, rock, cement and others)

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 27 years old.  He is single and takes care of her sister who attends secondary school.  Moses does some retail business, selling assorted items like mirrors, torches, hair combs, and other items. 

Moses is applying for his first loan from Kiva partner KADET Ltd. to increase his stock of products.  The profits from his business will be used to pay his sister’s school fees.  He hopes to expand his business to become a wholesale venture in the future.

loans.use: To increase his stock of mirrors, torches, hair combs, and other items for sale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe e a sua sobrinha que vivem com ela. 

É  comerciante ha mais de 8 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, peixe, cervejas amendoim e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 15.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 18.000.00mt, todos aplicados na obra de casa e algum para o comercio.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the District of Boane, in the Province of Maputo, in the south of Mozambique, is married and the mother of 1 son who attends school. She completed 7th grade but did not continue her education due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother and a niece who both live with her.

She has been a trader for more than 8 years and has a monthly income of around 15,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she uses for household expenditures and also saves a little in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks and came to know of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase products (peanuts, fish, beer and others) to increase the quantity of her goods.
Her first loans were for 15,000.00 MZN, 10,000.00 MZN an 18,000.00 MZN, all used for the construction of her house and on her business.

She commits to paying the loan off without problems and in future intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku to increase her commercial activity.

loans.use: purchase products (peanuts, fish, beer and others)

loans.name: Wend La Yangda Group

texts.fr:
Mme Kalizeta est la représentante du groupe WEND LA YANGDA. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans le moins âgé a 8 ans. Tous les trois vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes à sa charge

Mme a utilisé le prêt pour son activité de coiffure et veux continuer dans cette même activité

Mme est coiffeuse et vend parallèlement des sacs à main pour dame. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 9 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur n°10 d’Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut acheter 5 sacs à main et 12 paquets de mèche.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales et dans le bon fonctionnement de son salon de coiffure. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de vente de sacs à main.
texts.en:
Kalizeta is the representative of the WEND LA YANGDA group. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is sixteen years old and the youngest is eight. She used her previous loan for her hairdressing business, and wants to continue with it.

Kalizeta is a hairdresser and alongside she sells ladies handbags. She has been in this business for nine years. She gets her supplies at the market of the 10th district of Ouagadougou. Her customers are exclusively women. Kalizeta would like to buy 5 handbags and 12 packs of hair extensions.

Kalizeta will use her profits to help her husband with family care and to improve the service in her salon. Her wish is to open a large handbags store.

loans.use: to purchase 5 handbags and 12 packs of hair extensions

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children who are ten and fourteen years old.  She runs a retail shop in a Nairobi market where she sells sugar, flour, rice, beverages, detergent, and other items.  Jane says that her business is profitable and the major challenge she has is one of financial constraints.  However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Jane is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more general items to expand her retail business.  She hopes to be a wholesaler in future.  She is very hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, rice, beverages, detergent, and other items to sell at her retail shop.

loans.name: Mor  Anta

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié.Il exerce l'activité de commerce de pièces détachées.Avec cette activité, il assure l'entretien de sa famille.Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des pièeces détachées pour automobile.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married man who makes a living selling spare parts. This activity allows him to support his family. 

In order to strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 250,000F to buy automobile spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 30 years old and has three children who are between the ages of 6 months and 7 years old.  Her husband builds houses.  Beatrice sells vegetables, which she has been doing for the last four years. This business has enabled her to build a family house. 

Beatrice needs a loan to buy more vegetables and fruit to increase her business profits.  She will use the additional profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos que frequenta a escola.Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua nora e o neto que vivem com ela. 

É  comerciante ha mais de 5 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( sumos, feijão, amendoim, peixe, cervejas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 16.000.00mt, 17.000.00mt,  19.000.00mt, e 21.000.00mt todos para o comercio.  
No futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para fazer crescer a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is single and the mother of four children, who go to school. She went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her daughter-in-law and grandson, who live with them.
She's had a shop for more than 17 years and earns 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM). She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (juice, beans, peanuts, fish, beer, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. Her first loans, in the amounts of 16,000, 17,000, 19,000, and 21,000 meticals, were all used for the business. In the future she hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products (juice, beans, peanuts, fish, beer, etc.) for her shop.

loans.name: Filidus

texts.en: Fredaus is 33 years old and has 3 children ages 3 – 8. Two of them are in school. Her husband is a photographer.  She sells vegetables and tea spices.  She has been doing this business for the last 15 years.  This business has enabled her to buy a piece of land on which she plans to build a family house. She would like a loan in order to buy more vegetables and spices in order to make more profits. She will use the profits to care for her family .

loans.use: to buyi vegetables and spices for sale.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is 25 years old and has a 6 year old child. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. Her child is in school.  She sells vegetables in the market and her business has enabled her to buy chairs to put in her sitting room. Claudette needs to start up another business in addition to the existing one.  She needs a loan in order to buy a motorcycle to earn more income . She will then use the profits to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy a motocycle.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia  de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola. Fez a 8ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É  comerciante ambulante ha mais de 6 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um familiar que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( sumos, ovos, amendoim, peixe  e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, para o comercio.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Amelia was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who go to school. Amelia finished eighth grade and did not continue school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has been making sales on foot for more than six years and has a monthly income of about 4,000 meticais. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Amelia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a relative who is also a customer of this institution. This is her third Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (juices, eggs, peanuts, fish and other items) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 8,000 and 20,000 meticais, and were for the business.

She promises to make her payments with no problems and intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans to build a store in the future.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (juices, eggs, peanuts, nuts, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motor and accessories for his vehicle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 6 filhos destes 3 frequentam a escola. Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É  comerciante ambulante ha mais de 11 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 14.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar panelas, para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.000.00mt, e 12.000.00mt, para o comercio.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para construir um estabelecimento comercial e diversificar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has six children; three of them go to school. Rosa finished fourth grade but did not continue with school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has made sales on foot for more than 11 years and has a monthly income of about 4,000 meticais. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Rosa has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is her third Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 14,000 meticais to buy pots and pans so she can increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 8,000 and 12,000 meticais, and were for the business.

She promises to make her payments without problems, and in the future she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans to build a store and diversify her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy and sell pots and pans.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos destes 2 frequentam a escola.Fez o ensino primário e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

trabalha  como servente no colegio nhamunda ha mais de 9 anos e tem um saláio de 4.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Rosalina was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has four children; two of them go to school. Rosalina finished primary school but did not continue because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and also supports a niece who lives with her.

She has worked as a helper at Nhamunda school for more than nine years and has a monthly salary of 4,600 meticais. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Rosalina has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is her first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy bundles of used clothing so she can increase her inventory. 

She promises to make her payments with no problems, and in the future she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy office and school supplies for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат жителница района Шахритус. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе. В этой области она уже 17 лет. Кроме того Малохат занимается растениеводством. У нее при доме имеется участок земли, где она выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для покупки селитры.
texts.en: Malohat lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 34 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  Malohat has a higher pedagogical education.  She works at a secondary school and has been working in this field for 17 years.  Besides this work, Malohat is involved in agriculture.  She has a plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 28 years old and has 2 children who are 8 and 6. One of them is in school. She is married and her husband drives  a motorcycle taxi. She sells vegetables in the market which has allowed her to support her family. She would like a loan to purchase to increase her capital which she will use to buy more vegetables. Consolee will use the profits to meet the needs of the family and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Diokkere Endam 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe diokkere endame 1 est composé de 8 hommes qui pratiquent tous le commerce de bétail.Ils achétent des moutons, des vacjhes ou des chevres qu'ils revenent dans les nombreux marchés hebdomadaires de leur région.Le chef de groupe est un homme marié qui, en plus du commerce de bataiol, pratique la culture du mil et de l'arachide.Il est marié et père de quatre enfants. Ses activités lui procurent des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de bien entretenir sa famille mais aussi d'épargner à l'UIMCEC.le groupe sollicite un pret de 950000f pour acheter des moutons qui seront revendus à l'approche de la fete de Tabaski.Leur ambition est de réaliser une ferme agropastorale.
texts.en:
The group "Diokkere Endame 1" is composed of eight men who all have livestock businesses. They buy sheep, cows, or goats that they resell at numerous weekly markets in their region. 

The group's leader is a married man who, in addition to livestock farming, grows millet and peanuts. He is a married father of four children. His businesses bring in the revenues significant enough to allow him to support his family well but also to save money at U-IMCEC. 

The group is requesting a loan of 950,000 francs to buy some sheep that will be sold as the Tabaski holiday approaches. Their ambition is to establish an agro-pastoral farm.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a business woman, age 57, and blessed with four children. For the last 6 years, she has been managing a butcher shop to bring up the family. She has employed one person to assist her in the business. Previously, she used to run a retail shop. In the next 5 years, she wants to open another outlet of her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter

loans.name: Diokkere Endam 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIOKKERE ENDAM 2 est composé de 5 membres, adultes, tous marioés.Ils pratiques l'élevage notamment l'embouche  ovine.En hivernage, ils s'adonnent aussi à l'agriculture.Le chef de groupe est un homme agé, père de 5 enfants dont deux vont à l'école.Avec la stabuation et la vente du bétail, il nourrit sa famille et arrive tant bien que mal à subvenir à leurs besoins alimentaire, sanitaire, d'habillement et de logement.Le groupe sollicite, à l'approche de la fete du mouton (Tabaski), un pret de 950000F pour acheter 35 moutons qui seront revendus au bout d'un mois.L'ambition du groupe est de se lancer dans la stabulation des bovins.
texts.en:
The group DIOKKERE ENDAM 2 is composed of five members, all married adults. They raise livestock and specialize in the fattening of sheep. During the winter, they are also devoted to agriculture. The group's leader is an older man and the father of five children, of whom two are students. By sheltering and selling livestock, he is feeding his family, and he manages the best he can to meet their needs in terms of food, health care, clothing, and housing. 

The group is requesting a loan of 950,000 francs to buy 35 head of sheep as the sheep festival (Tabaski) approaches. The sheep will be sold at the end of the month. The group's ambition is to establish themselves in the sheltering of cattle.

loans.use: to buy 35 head of sheep

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a hardworking business woman, age 31. She is single and blessed with one child. For the last two years, she has been managing a tailoring business to bring up her family. She also practices dairy farming to boost her income. Ann has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabric for making clothes. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for enabling her to access business loans easily.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en: Virginiah is married and blessed with four children. For the last 2 years, she has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. She also does a mobile phone-money-transfer business to boost her income. In the next 5 years, Virginiah wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to buy animal feed. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha, a 35-year-old mother of a one-year-old, has operated a bakery with her husband for two years now.  She needs the loan to buy more equipment and baking flour in order to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and baking flour.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica, a hardworking businesswoman aged 36, is married and blessed with four children. For the last five years, she has been managing a butcher shop to support her family, employing three people to help her. Now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow for slaughter, Monica wants to expand her business within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is a 47-year-old mother of six, the youngest two years old. Two children are still in school, while the others have completed secondary school. Her husband works in construction in small villages, and Annonciata has a general store which sells rice, sugar, soap, and beans.

Having run this business for the last three years, she has seen it grow as she reinvests the profits. Now requesting a loan to buy more products for her store, Annonciata will use the profits to build a house from which to run her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, rice, soaps and beans.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni is 32 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She has a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan, which she has been doing for five years.

Poni is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is married and has two children who attend school.  He is from the village of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela. He has been selling ice drops in the village where they are living with his family. He earns about 200 PHP a day.

Arthur is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase ice drops to sell. In the future, he would like to have his own ice drops stall, so he can continue to send his children to school and to provide his family with an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ice drops to sell

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dative is 30 years old and has four children between the ages of 2 and 10. Two of them are currently in school.  Her husband is a welder.

Dative sells hardware and home building supplies. She has been doing this for four years and it has enabled her to buy some land. She needs this loan to buy different materials to sell in her store, such as window panes. If she is able to realize profits from her business, she plans to build a house on her land.

loans.use: to buy hardware and home building supplies to sell in a store

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 33 years old and has five children who are between 4 and 12 years old. They are all in school. She works with her husband selling foodstuffs in the market. They have been doing this for five years, which has enabled them to build a house and send their children to school. They would like a loan to buy more foodstuffs in order to make more profits. They will use these profits to buy another house to rent out as supplemental income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 21 years old and has a four-year-old child who is not yet in school. She is married to a policeman. She sells foodstuffs and vegetables in the market such as tomatoes. She has been doing this business for two years. She managed to buy herself some land from the profits so far. Joselyne needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and vegetables. She wants to use the profits to buy a motorcycle in order to make money in the transport business, which will enable her to build a house on the land she purchased.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and vegetables.

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en:
Wellington was born in 1980. He is married and a father of five. He runs a general shop to earn a living for his family. He has operated the business for five years. In addition, he has three rental houses, which earn him extra income. He has been able to grow his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.

Wellington hopes to expand his business into wholesale within five years. He needs 70,000 KES to add more stock of sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and sweets.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and sweets.to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine has two children and a husband. Her children are five months old and two years old. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. She sells vegetables in the markets. She has been doing this for the last three years. With this business she has been able to buy land and a motorcycle to use for business.  Vestine would like a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She will use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Bineta est une célibataire de 27 ans  qui vit dans une des localités de la banlieue du Sénégal. Elle est mère d’un enfant de 5 ans.  Elle  exerce l ‘activité de femme de ménage depuis 2001 dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC ou elle est membre. Parallèlement  elle évolue dans le commerce depuis 2008. La raison de son choix pour l’activité de commerce se justifie par le fait qu’elle éprouvait le besoin de combler ses besoins sociaux. Elle est sociétaire depuis juillet 2004 et a déjà remboursé 9 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de bijoux et d’habits à vendre pour les préparatifs de la fête  de Tabaski. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses  revenus, de subvenir a ses besoins et surtout d’ aider ses parents dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: Bineta is a 27-year old single woman living in a suburb in Senegal. She is the mother of a five-year child. Since 2001, she has been working as a cleaning woman in the branch of U-IMCEC in which she is a member. In addition, since 2008 she has been  working as a vendor. Her reason for going into business is the need to improve her socioeconomic status. She has been a member since July 24 and already repaid nine prior loans. She is seeking a credit of 100,000 West African francs in order buy clothing and jewelry to resell ahead of  the Tabaski holiday [the Muslim holiday also known as  the Feast of Sacrifice]. This financing will allow her to increase her revenues, to support herself and, before all, to help her parents with their everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last 20 years, she has been selling fruits to earn a living. She also does farming. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. Her desire is to educate her children to university level. With the 50,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy bananas, oranges and water melons for resale.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges and water melons for resale

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a hardworking business lady age 31. She is single and blessed with three children. For the last two years, she has been managing a green grocery to earn a living. She also sells charcoal to boost her income. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. With 10,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Mercy Mumbi

texts.en: Mercy is 33 years old. She is married and has a son. She hopes to give her son a good education to the university level. She has a beauty salon, which has been providing hair and beauty services to the women in Nairobi. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, so the customers are spoiled by the choices. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy a hairdryer to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open another salon to be able to serve more people while making more profit. She describes herself as patient and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 29 years old and married to Janet. They have two children, two and six years old.

William has a shoe business that he has been running for the past seven years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to buy more shoes to add to his stock to sell.

He hopes to open up a shoe shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Locas

texts.en: Lucas, who is married and blessed with three children, has been managing a retail shop to make a living for the last three years, employing two people to help him. He also sells milk. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Lucas has been able to improve his business, and he is now requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and drinking chocolate for resale. Within the next five years, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and drinking chocolate.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos, 41, is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last five years, he has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. He also manages a retail shop. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old single mother of four children.  She is a food vendor.  Grace has been in this business for the last three years. She was recently introduced to KADET and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business.

With this loan, she plans to purchase onions, tomatoes and potatoes. The anticipated profits will be directed into repayment of the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a hardworking businesswoman, 41 and single. For over five years, she has been providing services such as printing and photocopying.  She has retained her business because of her good services.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a photocopier machine.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier machine

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a mother of four grown up children. She runs a clothing sales business at a busy estate in Nairobi. She has been in this business for six years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more clothes to grow her business. In the future, she hopes to grow the business to wholesale. She also hopes to build her own business premises where she will not be paying rent. She describes herself as honest, determined, and focused.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and instant noodles

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, 25, is a determined businessman who is single. For the last two years, he has been managing an electronics repair shop to make a living. He is also a church house-keeper. Previously, he was managing a green grocer to boost his income. In the next five years, he wants to become financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a phone repair machine.

loans.use: To buy a phone repair machine

loans.name: Huitzililla Group

texts.es: salieron del grupo el joven santiago y la señora Maribel e ingresaron las señoras Eleuteria va a comprar con su prestamo alimento por bulto de zacate y sorgo molidos para crianza de ganado, la señora Tomasa va a comprar mayonesa, verduras, jitomate, cebolla, chiles en vinagre , queso carnes frias, teleras. La señora Margarita tiene 41 años de edadd ella vive en union libre tiene 4 hijos 2 varones y 2 mujeres ellas estas estudiando una la prepa y la otra la secundaria, ella vende dulces refrescos, tortas, chicharrones preparados, paletas de hielo, zapatos, perfumes y cosmeticos por catalogo, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años es herencia de su suegro y su hijo le enseño a trabajar en las ventas, ella hace tandas de zapatos, tambien sale a ofrecer sus productos con las vecinas y conocidas, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para pagar el prestamo, y para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijas, ella esta orgullosa de su negocio por las ganancias que obtiene para seguir invirtiendo en dulces y zapatos, ella esta planeando vender verduras y lo pienza lograr con las ganancias, ella esta contenta con este prestamo le va a ayudar a surtir su negocio para tener mercancia para ofrecerles a sus clientes, sus sueños y esperanza son que sus hijas estudien. las integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad por sus prestamos por su ayuda de apoyarnos a crecer los negocios.
texts.en:
Santiago and Maribel left the group and Eleuteria joined.  She will use the loan to buy bulk grass feed and ground sorghum to feed cattle.  Tomasa will buy mayonnaise, vegetables, tomatoes, onions, pickled chilies, cheese, cold cuts and bread rolls.  

Margarita, 41, lives in a common law relationship and has four children: two boys and two girls.  One of the girls is in high school and the other is in middle school.  She sells candy, soft-drinks, tortas [Mexican style sandwiches], chicharrones preparados [fried pork rinds], popsicles, shoes, perfume and cosmetics via catalogue.  She started the business three years ago.  It was passed down to her from her father-in-law and her son taught her about sales.  She also sells shoes in rotating credit plans and also goes out to sell door to door among her neighbors and acquaintances.  

Her business is important because it produces income with which to repay the loan and to cover school costs for her daughters.  She’s proud of her business because of the profits it generates to continue investing in candy and shoes.  She’s planning to sell vegetables and she plans to accomplish this with her profits.  She is happy with the loan that will help her stock her business to have merchandise to offer her customers.  Her dreams and hopes are that her daughters study.  The group members thank Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the loans and for their help in supporting their business’ growth.

loans.use: to buy candy, popsicles, women's, men's and children's shoes to fill orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is a hardworking businesswoman aged 42. She is married and blessed with three children. For the last year, she has been selling tissue paper to support the family. Previously, she was earning a living as a painter. In the next five years, she wants to grow her business into wholesale. With this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to buy more tissue paper for resale.

loans.use: To buy more tissue paper

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Micheal is married and blessed with three children. For the last three years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to support the family. He also practices dairy farming. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is to become more financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access a loan credit facility.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bricks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old and is married to Albert. They have seven children and they live in Kisumu.

Mary has a grocery store that she has been running for the last nine years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more avocados, paw paws (papayas), pineapples and oranges to add to her stock to sell. 

She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more avocados, pawpaws, pineapples and oranges.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 26 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  She runs a welding workshop in Majengo, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last 10 years. 

She has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase welding equipment. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into repayment of the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase welding equipment

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a 22-year-old single man. He runs a mini petrol station in Kilifi, a business that has been in operation for the last three years. 

Anderson was recently introduced to KADET and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to add more stock of petrol, paraffin and diesel. 

The profits that will be generated from his business will be directed into the gradual expansion of his business and the repayment of the loan. Anderson’s dream is to own a big petrol station in the heart of Kilifi town.

loans.use: to purchase more petrol, paraffin and diesel to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 27 years old and a single lady. She supports her nephew who is nine years old.

She has a boutique that she has been running for the past 10 years. Carolyne has applied for a loan that she intends to use to buy more clothing to add to her stock.

She hopes to buy a piece of land in the future and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Abizeranye Group

texts.fr:
Valens fait partie du groupe Abizeranye. Le nom du groupe signifie « les fideles ». Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 2 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  6 ans de primaire.

Valens est cultivateur de légumes. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, 100kgs des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture des tomates, des choux et des légumes. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de semer au temps  et cultiver  avec des bonnes qualités des semences sélectionne pour récolte beaucoup plus. Dans les prochaines années, Valens voudrait être un grand distributeur des tomates et des choux dans les marches de son district. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et construire une autre nouvelle maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Valens is a member of Abizeranye Group, whose name means "the trustworthy". He's 33 years old, married, and has four children, age 2 to 9. Two of them attend school. He himself attended elementary school for 6 years.

Valens is a vegetable cultivator. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy seeds, 100 kg of chemical fertilizers for his crops: tomatoes, cabbage, and other vegetables.

His strategy to grow his business is to sow on time and farm using good quality seeds, in order to harvest much more. In the forthcoming years, he would like to become a large distributor of tomatoes and cabbage for the markets in his district.

With his profits, he intends to pay the school expenses of his children, and build a new home for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and 100 kg of chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Tlahkotepec Group

texts.es:
María Angélica es la representante del grupo Tlahkotepec que en su dialecto Náhuatl significa medio cerro, ella es originaria de la comunidad de altas montañas, el grupo lo conforman tambien Norma y la señora María Guadalupe.
Angélica como comúnmente la conocen en su comunidad vive con su esposo Ezequiel y su pequeña hija Nayeli de cuatro años la cual apenas da inicio con su educación preescolar, ella es ama de casa y se dedica a comprar y criar pollos que sale a vender a las comunidades que se encuentran cercanas a la suya.
Norma dedica su tiempo a las labores del hogar atendiendo a su esposo y a sus pequeñas hijas, Jesica y Perla de cuatro y siete años, mientras que doña María Guadalupe vive con su hijo Isidro y su nieta Veronica, ella cubre sus gastos diarios con pequeños apoyos que recibe de su hijo, estas últimas integrantes del grupo desean iniciar con un negocio ya que sean entusiasmado tanto con los comentarios que les realiza Angélica de que su negocio le deja excelentes ganancias.
La meta que tiene este grupo es de fortalecer sus negocios para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias y así ayudar a sus esposos con los gastos diarios dentro del hogar.
Las integrantes agradecen de todo corazón la ayuda recibida por parte de FRAC y KIVA, ya que para ellas era muy complicado tener acceso a un crédito por otras instituciones.,  con su recurso ellas fortalecerán sus negocios comprando mas pollos y alimento para su engorda.
texts.en:
María Angélica is the representative of the “Tlahkotepec” group which in their Náhuatl dialect means “half hill.”   She’s from the community of Alta Montañas and the other group members are Norma and María Guadalupe.

Angélica, as she’s commonly known in the community, lives with her husband, Ezequiel and her little girl, Nayeli, 4, who has just started pre-school.  She’s a housewife and also buys chicks to raise and then sell in the communities that are near hers.

Norma spends her time doing household chores and taking care of her husband and little daughters, Jesica and Perla, 4 and 7 respectively, while María Guadalupe lives with her son, Isidro, and her granddaughter, Verónica.  She covers her daily expenses with small contributions she gets from her son.  These last two group members want to start a business because they are very excited by the comments Angélica makes about how profitable her business is.

This group’s goal is to strengthen their businesses to improve their families’ living conditions and help their husbands meet daily household expenses.

The group members thank FRAC and VIVA with their whole hearts for the help they’ve gotten because it is very complicated for them to have access to loans from other institutions.  With this resource, they will strengthen their businesses buying more chicks and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Serigne Medina

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié.Il gère au grand marché de sa localité un magasin de vente de chaussures, de vetements pour femmes et enfants ainsi que des effets de toilette.Cette homme a beaucoup travaillé pour arriver aujourd'hui à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et de certains de ses amis.Il pourvoie à leur alimentation, leur frais de santé et d'habillement.Son activité lui permet de payer également les factures d'électricité et d'eau.Pour augmenter son stock de marchandises , il sollicite un pret de 500000F afin d'acheter des caisses de chaussures, des balles de vetement et des effets de toilette divers.Son ambition est d'ouvrir d'autres magasins en ville.
texts.en: This borrower is a married man. He runs a store at the grand market in his area and sells shoes, women's and children's clothing, and toiletry items. This man has worked very hard to be able to satisfy the needs of his family and some of his friends. He provides food and pays for health and clothing costs. His business also allows him to pay the water and electric bills. To increase his stock of merchandise, he is seeking a loan of 500,000 F in order to buy cases of shoes, bundles of clothing, and various toiletry items. His ambition is to open additional stores in the city.

loans.use: To buy cases of shoes, bundles of clothing, and various toiletry items.

loans.name: Nanu

texts.en:
Mrs. Nanu is a beautician in Thikedewal. She opened her beauty parlor seven years ago. Before opening her own beauty parlor, she took a year of beauty parlor training from a training institution. Her service is for ladies. In Nepal, this is the season of festivals, so many married women as well as unmarried women go to beauty parlors to look good. 

Mrs. Nanu is requesting the loan to buy various make-up tools for her service.

loans.use: to buy make-up tools.

loans.name: Mangala

texts.en: Mangala is 46 years old.  She is married and has three children 24, 21 and 8 years old.  In 1999, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Mangala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. For a borrower to improve living her standard, extra training is needed. In the Katmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Jose Ibaldo

texts.es:
Jose está muy contento porque ha mejorado sus ingresos, ya que ha podido comprar electrodomésticos como planchas, ventiladores, televisores, licuadoras etc. Con la ayuda de su esposa ha vendido los electrodomésticos y ha podido tener más tiempo con su familia. 

El quiere seguir generando ingresos para su familia por eso quiere un nuevo préstamo para seguir trabajando con su esposa. Quiere comprar mercadería para fin de año ya que es cuando más se vende los electrodomésticos  como televisores, ventiladores, licuadoras etc.  Esta haciendo todo lo posible por mejorar poco a poco la infraestructura de su casa, para darle un buen lugar donde vivir a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is very happy.   He has increased his income because he was able to buy appliances such as irons, fans, televisions, blenders, etc.  With the help of his wife, he sold the appliances and has been able to spend more time with his family.  

He wants to continue generating income for his family, so he would like a new loan so he can continue working with his wife.  He wants to buy merchandise for the end of the year as this is when more appliances such as televisions, fans, blenders, etc., are sold.  Little by little, he is doing all that he can to make improvements to the infrastructure of his house so that he can give his family a nice place to live.

loans.use: purchase appliances such as televisions, blenders, fans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Pasmaya

texts.en:
Pasmaya is 32 years old. She is married and has two children aged nine and four. In 2007, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used it to buy small chickens for her business. In the future, Pasmaya plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Extra training is needed to help borrowers improve their living standards. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Mody

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié.Il exerce le commerce de chaussures et est établi dans un grand marché de sa localité.Il achéte en gros des caisses de chaussures qu'il revend au détail.Il tire un bénéfice assez substentiel de cette activité, ce qui lui permet de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.Pour augmenter son stock à l'approche de la fete de Tabaski (fete du mouton), il sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 500000f pour acheter cinq balles de chaussures.Il ambtionne de devenir grossiste.
texts.en: This borrower is a married man who has a business selling footwear. He is established locally at a large market. He buys cases of shoes wholesale and then sells them retail. He derives a profit substantial enough to enable him to support his family. To increase his inventory ahead of Tabaski (the sheep festival), he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs from U-IMCEC in order to buy five bales of footwear. His ambition is to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy five bales of footwear

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria tiene 42 años y tiene 1 hijo, desde hace 21 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de salón de belleza, inició su negocio ofreciendo sus servicios fue comprando ciertos productos poco a poco y así obtener lo que tiene hoy en día. Lo que más le gusta es brindar un buen servicio así sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos con este medio de vida. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pintura de labios, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, shampoo, peines, cepillos, entre otros.
texts.en: Rosa Maria is 42 years old and has 1 child.  She has been making a living by offering beauty salon services for the past 21 years.  She started her business by slowly buying certain products.  This is how she obtained what she has today.  What she likes most is giving good service so that her customers are satisfied with her work.  With this loan she will buy lipstick, creams, treatments, nail polish, shampoo, combs, brushes, etc.

loans.use: buy lipstick, creams, treatments, nail polish, shampoo, combs, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Angel Gilberto

texts.es:
Angel hace 10 años compro un Televisor para alquilar play station y vender cd y ademas a su negocio le agrego la venta de bebidas y sanck para los clientes.
