Anteriormente solo sembraba granos básicos pero desde hace 8 años decidió sembrar frutas tales como guayaba y guanábanas comenzó como un proyecto que inicio cuando tenia 56 años vio que era mas rentable trabajar con este tipo de siembras y puso en marcha el proyecto ahora ya es una parte de su plantación y negocio del cual sobrevive pero también vende leche y granos básicos para tener otros ingresos cuando la temporada de las cosechas son bajas.
Solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento, compra de insumos y fertilizantes de las plantaciones de guayaba ,pues al crédito le ayudaría a realizar un manejo agronómico de mejor calidad a sus cosechas. En sus planes futuros el quiere ser un productor de guayabas tipo jamaiquinas. Su meta próxima es duplicar el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Pedro, 64, is from Quezalguaque, León.  He’s the father of three children.  He’s a guava (tropical fruit), soursop and basic grains farmer.  He used to just farm basic grains but 8 years ago decided to plant fruit like guava and soursop.  He started this project when he was 56 years old and noted that it was more profitable to work in this type of crop so he launched the project and now it’s part of his plantation and business which is his source of support.  However, he also sells milk and basic grains in order to have other income when crop season is low.

He’s asking for the loan for crop maintenance, to buy supplies and fertilizer for the guava plants.  The loan will help him provide better agronomic management for improved crop quality.  His future plans are to become a producer of Jamaican-type guavas and his next goal is to double the size of his crops.

loans.use: to buy farmin supplies.

loans.name: G.s. Nagarote Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Nagarote está conformado por Dominga, Patricia y Laura. Ellas son personas responsables y disfrutan de mantener a sus familias por medio de sus negocios. Dominga Dolores se dedica a una pulpería, desde hace mas de 22 años inicio con pocos productos de consumo popular, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitaban variedad de productos Dominga ha mejorado su inventario. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, refrescos, jugos, galletas, sopas, enlatados entre otros.
texts.en:
Dominga, Patricia, and Laura are members of the Nagarote Communal Bank.  They are responsible people, and they enjoy supporting their families through their businesses.

Dominga Dolores has had a store for over 22 years.  She started with a few popular consumable products.  Most of her customers always request a variety of products from her.  Dominga has improved her inventory.

The reason for the loan is to buy basic grains, detergent, soft drinks, juice, cookies, soup, and canned goods, among other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergent, soft drinks, juice, cookies, soup, and canned goods among other products.

loans.name: Abigail Group

texts.es:
El grupo Abigaíl ha solicitado un préstamo nuevamente a FRAC, ahora son 11 integrantes, pero del préstamo anterior solo siguen 6 personas y se han integrado 5 mas: Tomasa, Florentina, Elizabeth, Ma Dolores y Dulce Elia. Hay que mencionar que áhora todo el grupo trabaja en una tienda y se unieron para poder emprender y/o impulsar sus propios negocios.
Para éste nuevo préstamo dicidieron que la representante del grupo sería la señora Minerva que se dedica  a la venta de perfumes y cosmeticos, ella es una señora muy trabajadora  le gusta  salir adelante para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosmeticos desde hace tres años, esta muy contenta por que su negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias y así le puede ayudar a su mamá  en lo que necesite.
Esta muy contenta por que cada día tiene mas clientes que están satisfechos, ya que siempre trata de darle sus perfumes a tiempo y no quedar mal con ellos para para no perder clientes.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar más perfumes de diferentes aromas y marcas como son: avon, fraiche, chantal, mary key.
La señora Minerva no tiene hijos,  ya que no esta  casada  le gustaría encontrar una persona  con quien tener hijos y disfrutar su negocio y el apoyo  que le ha dado fundacion realidad.
**desde el prestamo anterior Isacc aparece con el sexo equivocado ya que aparece como mujer y es hombre
texts.en:
The Abigail Group is requesting a new loan from FRAC.  Now the group has 11 members, but only six of them participated in the previous loan.  The five additional members are Tomasa, Florentina, Elizabeth, Ma Dolores, and Dulce Elia.  It should be mentioned that all of them now work as a group in a store and have joined together so that they could either establish or continue their own businesses.  

For this new loan, it was decided that Sra. Minerva would be the group representative.  She sells perfumes and cosmetics.  Minerva is a hardworking woman who enjoys moving forward so that she can have a better quality of life.

She has been selling perfumes and cosmetics for three years.  Minerva is very pleased that her business has generated good revenues, which enables her to help her mother with what she needs.  She is happy that every day she has more customers who are satisfied with her work.  Minerva always tries to deliver her perfumes on time and keep everyone happy so that she does not lose customers.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more perfumes of different scents and brands such as Avon, Fraiche, Chantal, and Mary Kay.  

Sra. Minerva does not have children.  She is single and would like to find someone to marry so that she can have children.  Minerva enjoys her business and the support she has received from Fundación Realidad.  

**Note:  In the previous loan, Isacc was categorized incorrectly as a woman.  He in fact is a man.

loans.use: to buy perfumes made by Avon, Fraiche and Mary Kay.

loans.name: Flor De Nardo Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama flor de nardo y se integra de tres señoras quien cada una se dedica  a diferente actividad  y se ubica en un lugar bonito.
 	

   Quien se le tomo la  entrevista  se llama Asunción de Jesús  ella es soltera  y el préstamo lo invertirá en a la compra de  ropas, para damas caballeros, niñas y niños en y comezón a trabajarlo hace un año y  ve que le está dando un buen resultado ya que ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos.

     Quien lo motivo ha esta actividad fue sus propios meritos  así tener sus propios ingresos y apoyar a su familia que también necesitan  de su apoyo y sus  papas no se vean limitado con los  ingresos de la  casa.

     Lo que más desea es que con  esta pequeña actividad ella pueda ir mejorando cada día más su negocio y con el tiempo  rentar un local para vender su mercancía.

      Las personas que integran en el grupo son la señora: Vitalina quien invertirá el préstamo   en  la compra de  productos de la región  y por último la señora Ernestina quien invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Flor de Nardo” and consists of three women. Each one of them engages in a different business activity. They live in a beautiful place.

Asunción de Jesús was the member who was interviewed. She is single and her loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing for women, men, girls, and boys. Asunción began working a year ago and has achieved good results, which has enabled her to improve her income.

The reason for starting this business of her own merits was so that she could have her own income for supporting her family. She also needs to support her parents who have limited household income.

What she wants most from her small business is to improve more each day with her venture. Within time, she hopes to rent a shop where she can sell her merchandise.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Vitalina will invest her loan in the purchase of products from the region. • Sra. Ernestina will invest in the purchase of ingredients for making bread.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, girls, and boys.

loans.name: Azteca Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama azteca y se  ubica en un lugar muy bonito en donde hay muchos árboles en la que es una comunidad muy agradable , la señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama María luz quien es afortunadamente  casada con el señor Antonio y conquián procreo siete hijos quienes cuatro ya están casado y tres a un están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos por reja  y luego venderlo  destazado en la misma localidad en donde lleva trabajando hace ya unos años y le va bien.
 
    Quien  lo motivo a esta actividad  fue su familia ya que también quiere apoyar a su  esposo con los ingresos de la casa y así sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes aun dependen de su apoyo y desean darle lo más necesario.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo  que solicito pueda seguir trabajando para continuar con sus horros y apoyarse con los ingreso hasta que dios le preste vida.
 
   Los dos integrantes más que solicitaron el préstamo son:   Marco Antonio quien invertirá en la compra de  frutas y  verduras  así también se integra el señor Jaime quien invertirá en la compra de marranos para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called Azteca and is located in a beautiful, wooded area in a nice community.  María Luz was the person interviewed and she is married to Antonio.  They have seven children, four of whom are married and the other three are still in their care.

She is requesting a loan to buy caged chickens for her poultry butchery business.  For several years she has been involved in this work in her home town.

Her family is responsible for getting her started since she also wanted to help her husband cover household expenses and help her children get ahead, giving them everything they need. 

What she wants most is through her small business and with the loan to be able to continue saving money and earning an income for as long as she lives.

The other two members requesting a loan are:  Marco Antonio who will buy fruits and vegetables, and Jaime who will buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: G.s. Las Chacaras Group

texts.es: Marcia Mercedes y Maria Luisa conforman el grupo solidario Las Chácaras. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas, pero han logrado salir adelante por medio de sus esfuerzos. Maria Luisa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace más de 30 años que tiene este medio de vida, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo ella es una madre responsable que disfruta de realizar este negocio que le proporciona los gastos necesarios para su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra sandias, melones, mangos, naranjas, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The Las Chácaras solidarity group has two members, Marcia Mercedes and María Luisa.  They have different economic activities, but both have managed to get ahead through their efforts.

María Luisa has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than 30 years.  She has three minor children.  She is a responsible mother who enjoys her business, which provides her the necessary expenses for her home.

The reason for the loan is to buy watermelons, melons, mangos, and oranges, among other products.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, melons, mangos, and oranges, among other products.

loans.name: Miguel Geronimo

texts.es: Desde hace 13 años Miguel Gerónimo se ha dedicado a vender mercadería en general a sus familiares, amigos, y conocidos, labor que le ha permitido generar ingresos para su hogar. Sin embargo actualmente enfrenta dificultades económicas, lo que le ha impedido el progreso de su negocio y sus ganancias ya que no cuenta con capital para comprar la mercancía que sus clientes solicitan, y es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un crédito, el cual invertirá en surtido de mayor variedad y cantidad como es ropa, calzado, bolsos, billeteras, prendas de plata y oro laminado.
texts.en: Miguel Gerónimo has been selling general merchandise to his family members, friends and acquaintances for thirteen years.  This work has enabled him to make income for his household.  However, he currently faces financial difficulties which have prevented him from making progress in his business and earning more profits.  He does not have the capital he needs to buy the merchandise that his customers are asking him for and this is why he is requesting a loan.  He will invest his loan in stocking his business with a larger variety and quantity of merchandise such as clothes, footwear, bags, wallets, and gold- and silver-plated jewelry.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, bags, wallets, and gold- and silver-plated jewelry

loans.name: María Clemencia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 65 años, divorciada quien reside en el barrio "Balcón del Valle" al sur de la ciudad de Quito capital del Ecuador. Un barrio pintoresco y muy populoso en la parroquia Alfaro.

Ella trabaja vendiendo jugos naturales en la mañana y el resto del día vende ropa y cosméticos para poder vivir. Los jugos son de aloe vera y yerbas las cuales mezcladas son agradables al paladar y muy apetecidas por sus clientes; dicen que estas bebidas tienen poderes curativos, sobre todo en problemas gástricos y también son usadas como bebidas energizantes naturales. María ha decidido invertir en sus negocios para aumentar sus ingresos. Por este motivo fue  Fundación Alternativa en busca de recursos económicos para lograr su objetivo. Su sueño es tener su kiosco propio ya que actualmente trabaja de manera ambulante. Ella nos cuenta que la necesidad poco a poco fue haciendo que ella incurra en estos negocios con lo cual hoy ella se mantiene.
texts.en:
María is a 65 year old woman who lives in the Balcón del Valle neighborhood to the south of the city of Quito, the capital of Ecuador.  It is a picturesque neighborhood, and the Alfaro parish is very heavily populated.

She works selling natural juices in the morning, and the rest of the day she sells clothes and cosmetics in order to be able to survive.  The juices are made of aloe vera and herbs that are mixed to have a pleasing taste that her customers really like.  They say that these drinks have curative powers, especially for gastric problems.  They are also used as natural energizers.

María has decided to invest in her business in order to increase her income.  That is why she went to Fundación Alternative looking for financial resources to reach her objective.

Her dream is to have her own kiosk because she currently works in an itinerant manner.  She tells us that little by little necessity made her get into these businesses, which she now maintains.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
LA SRA  Katiuska de 30 años de edad, conviniente, tiene dos hijos menores de edad en etapa escolar. Ella es una mujer luchadora por salir adelante  con su familia, actualmente se dedica a la  confección y venta de peluches artesanos, estos productos los vende a sus amistades, vecinos  que los vende un buen precio ya que son elaborados con materiales de calidad.
Solicita este préstamo para poder incrementar su negocio y así poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida .Desearía para el futuro poder tener un local  en el centro de  Huancayo .Kattyusca en la foto  tiene cargada a su menor hijo, viste una chompa color marrón y verde, buzo color plomo, Kattyusca se encuentra ubicada a lado derecho de la socia que viste una chompa color rosado
texts.en:
Katiuska is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has two school-age children who are still dependent on her.  She is a tenacious woman who works to get her family ahead in life.  Her current business is hand-making and selling cuddly toys.  She sells these products to her friends and neighbors.  She sells them for a good price because they are made with good-quality materials.

Katiuska is requesting this loan so that she can increase her business and thereby provide her children with a better quality of life.  In the future, she would like to be able to own business premises in the center of Huancayo.  In the photo, Katiuska is holding her youngest son, wearing a brown and green sweater and gray tracksuit.  She is to the left of the member who is wearing a pink-colored sweater.

loans.use: to stock her business

loans.name: Pedro Heriberto

texts.es:
Pedro de 48 años, es un hombre trabajador que  tiene un pequeño negocio de elaboración de cofres de madera para muertos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00am hasta las 19h00pm haciendo cofres de madera de todos los estilos.    

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para mejorar su negocio ya que está divorciado y tiene tres hijos que aun estudian y como padre quiere darles lo mejor a ellos. Por eso desea mejorar sus ingresos comprando con el préstamo madera.  En el futuro quiere terminar de construir mejor su casa.
texts.en: Pedro, 48 years old, is a hardworking man who has a small business making wooden boxes for the dead. He works every day from 9:00 am until 7:00 pm making all types of wooden boxes. He has many dreams for improving his business since he is divorced and has three children who are still in school, and, as their father, he wants to give them the best. Therefore he wants to improve his income by purchasing wood with the loan. In the future he wants to finish making his house more sound.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es: Hernán, tiene la edad de 46 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Él quiere  comprar  una  sierra de banco, una caladora , un cepillo, un ruther para usar en un pequeño taller donde fabrica todo tipo de muebles. Tiene varios años que se dedica a ésta actividad y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. También, él no ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Hernán también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro unas personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en: Hernán, who is 46 years old, is married and has three children who are his highest priority. He wants to purchase a bench saw, a jigsaw, a plane, and a router to use in a small workshop where he makes all kinds of furniture. He has done this work for several years and wants his business to grow. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR, and he has not had other loans at state banks either. FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. Hernán wants to offer his children the education they need to be prepared and to be able to meet life's challenges more easily.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of chickens to sell

loans.name: Chiwillitos Group

texts.es: La Sra. Martha de 43 años de edad casada, con 1 hijo  de 10 años en etapa escolar ,Martha es  una de las socias  muy empeñosa ,luchadora por lo que quiere ,conforman la nueva alcancía comunal  Chiwillitos.Se dedica  a la venta de granos al por mayor y menor ,también se dedica a a la crianza de cuyes .Solicita este préstamo para poder  comprar as  granos y así poder tener una variedad de graos en su negocio y poder generar mas ingresos. Desearía para el futuro  poder exportar sus granos .Martha en la foto viste una chompa color crema ,polo color blanco ,se encuentra ubicada a lado derecho del socio que viste un polo color azul y blanco .Todos los integrantes de esta alcancia se encuentarn muy agradecidos por el prèstamo brindado.
texts.en: Sra. Martha, 43, is married, with a 10-year old son in school. Martha is a very hardworking woman who strives for what she wants and is a member of the new communal bank Chiwillitos. She sells seeds both wholesale and retail, and also raises cuyes [guinea pigs; sometimes raised for their meat in parts of Latin America]. She requests this loan to be able to purchase more seeds so she can have a variety of seeds for her business and thereby generate more income. In the future she would like to be able to export her seeds. In the bottom photo, Martha is at the far left wearing a cream-colored sweater and white T-shirt. All of the communal bank members are very grateful for the loan opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her business

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth, tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado pero está separada de su esposo y tiene tres hijas que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere  comprar pollos de engorde para mejorar la producción y aumentar las ventas. Tiene varios años que se dedica a ésta actividad y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  ha realizado otros préstamos en Cooperativa de crédito, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Yaneth también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijas la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro unas personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 40 years old and married, but is separated from her husband. She has three daughters who are her highest priority. Yaneth want to buy chickens for fattening so that she can improve production and increase her sales. She has been in this business for several years and wants to grow.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has received other loans from a credit cooperative, but FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate. Yaneth also wants to provide her daughters with the necessary education so that they can be prepared individuals in the future and have an easier time facing life.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small food cart.

loans.name: Carlos Rolando

texts.es: El Señor Carlos labora como maestro constructor, lleva trabajando así por más de 5 años, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, ha demostrado a lo largo de los años que se desempeña muy bien en su trabajo. El comenzó como peón y ayudante de albañil, poco a poco a ido progresando y hoy en día es ya un maestro constructor, haciendo trabajos de levantamiento de muros, encofrados y ferrería en general; él va a invertir el crédito kiva para invertirlo en otro negocio y es la venta de galletas, golosinas y gaseosas, arreglando también su puesto de madera en su casa. El Sr. Carlos tiene el sueño de tener en el futuro una bodega bien abastecida en donde vender, será su mayor negocio y entrada, por que desea mejorar su condición laboral y con su trabajo como maestro constructor y su espíritu emprendedor lo realizará. El ya es un ejemplo de emprendimiento para sus hijos. Carlos esta muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos works as a master builder and has been in this profession for more than five years. He has two children who are of school age. Carlos has demonstrated over the years that he performs very good work. He began as a laborer and masonry assistant. Over time he has progressed gradually and has now reached the level of master builder. The services he provides include raising walls, formwork, and general foundry work.

He will invest this Kiva loan in another business. Carlos will sell cookies, candy, and sodas so he plans to build a wooden stand at his house. In the future, he dreams of having a well-stocked store where he can sell and become the largest business so that he can improve his working conditions. With his job as a master builder and his entrepreneurial spirit, Carlos will be able to accomplish his goal. Already he is an example of entrepreneurship for his children.

Carlos is very grateful for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to start another business selling cookies, candy, and sodas.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Doña Angelina tiene 36 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos que dependen de ella y 4 de ellos estudian la secundaria y la primaria. Angelina vende frutas y legumbres en el mercado de su población desde hace 4 años, y dice que emprendió el negocio por que con lo que le daba su esposo no le alcanzaba para mantener a sus hijos, entonces ella un día que no tenia para darle de comer a sus hijos fue a cortar nopales y chiles manzanos que tenia en su casa y salio al mercado y si vendió todo y desde ahí dijo “si me deja buenas ganancias el vender la verdura” y decidió ir a diario al mercado a vender en su cubetita. Platica que todos los días va a la central de abastos a comprar la verdura fresca y después como a las 3 de la tarde se regresa a su casa a atender a sus hijos y esposo. Doña Angelina esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que tanto le gusta, la meta que tiene es poner un puesto afuera de su casa por las tardes para seguir vendiendo sus legumbres y la fruta de temporada.
texts.en:
Angelina is 36, and has five children who depend on her. Four of them are in high school and primary school. Angelina has been selling fruits and vegetables in the market of her town for four years. 

She says that she started her business because what her husband gave her wasn't enough to support her children. Then one day when she didn't have anything to give her children to eat, she cut pads of nopal cactus, and manzano chiles that she had by her house, went to the market, and sold everything.  At that point she said to herself, "Yes, I can make good money selling vegetables", and decided to go to the market every day to sell from her little stand.

She says that every day she goes to the central produce terminal to buy fresh vegetables,  and afterwards, at about 3:00pm she returns home to attend to her children and husband.  Angelina is asking for a loan in oder to continue investing in her business that she likes so much. Her goal is so set up a stand outside her house to keep selling her vegetables, and fruit in season.

loans.use: To sell fruits and vegetables in the street.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es: La Sra. Cipriana es una  mujer muy trabajadora con muchas ganas D. salir adelante y sacar a su familia poco a poco adelante; ella es viuda, tiene un hija D. 15 años D. edad, que se encuentra en la etapa escolar; la Sra. Cipriana se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes como (arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos etc.), ya lleva en este negocio por mas D. 5 años, ganando semanalmente la cantidad D. S/. 220 nuevos soles aproximadamente. Ella va a invertir el crédito otorgado en el mejoramiento D. su vivienda ya que le falta construir unos cuartos y ponerle piso. Su principal sueño D. la Sra. Cipriana es terminar D. construir D. su casa y darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su menor hija. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sra. Cipriana is a hardworking woman who has the desire to succeed and to help her family gradually move forward. She is a widow and has a 15-year-old daughter who is in school. Sra. Cipriana sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and other products. She has been in this business for more than five years. Cipriana earns a weekly income of approximately 220 PEN.

She will invest the provided loan in improvements to her home, which lacks some rooms and needs to have a floor installed. Her main dream is to finish the construction of her house and to proviD. a better quality of life for her young daughter. Sra. Cipriana is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to build a room for her daughter.

loans.name: Nilcia

texts.es:
Nilcia es una microempresaria, ha adquirido ocho préstamos y está muy emocionada al recibir su noveno, el cual ha planificado invertir en la compra de ropas nuevas, especialmente para mujeres como faldas, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, entre otros artículos para vestir. Nilcia inicio su negocio con un poco de ahorro hace aproximadamente 4 años. 

Su familia está compuesta por 2 hijos y su pareja sentimental, sus hijos son aun menores y están asistiendo a la escuela, el sueño más grande de Nilcia es ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios y convertirse en profesionales. Su más difícil e importante reto es poder terminar de construir su casa, por lo cual estará usando los beneficios de su negocio para ahorrar e ir comprando los materiales necesarios para la construcción.  

Nilcia vive en la ciudad de Hato Mayor, al este de República Dominicana, rodeada de montañas y mucha vegetación, siendo su principal actividad económica la agricultura y ganadería. Nilcia al igual que muchos otros ciudadanos dominicanos y haitianos realizan diariamente sus actividades de negocios. Nilcia está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que les da el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes.
texts.en:
Nilcia is a micro businesswoman.  She’s had 8 previous loans and she’s very excited about getting her ninth which she plans to use to buy new clothes, especially for women, like skirts, pants, blouses and underwear, among other articles of clothing.  Nilcia started her business with a bit of savings she had about four years ago. Her family consists of two children and her spouse.  Her children are still minors and attend school.  

Nilcia’s greatest dream is to see her children complete their schooling and become professionals.  Her most difficult and important challenge is to be able to finish building her house and this is what she’s using her business’ profits for and saving up for to gradually buy the necessary building materials and supplies.

Nilcia lives in the city of Hato Mayor in eastern Dominican Republic.  It’s surrounded by mountains and much vegetation.  Its main economic activity is farming and raising livestock.  Nilcia, as well as many other Dominican and Haitian citizens, work at their businesses daily.  Nilcia is very grateful for the opportunity that the support each and every one of you gives her.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Franci Marilu

texts.es: La Sra. Franci es una mujer trabajadora, muy creativa y con muchas ganas de superarse cada día mas, ella es casada, tiene un hijo de 24 años de edad; la Sra. Franci se dedica a confeccionar vestidos, trajes y también a la venta de los mismos, la señora Franci lleva 5 años en este negocio, la solicitante estudio confección es por eso que puso el negocio, empezó con una maquina y poco a poco supo salir adelante, gana aproximadamente S/ 250 nuevos soles semanales. El crédito otorgado lo va invertir en la compra de telas y ropa para la venta. Sus metas de la  Sra. Franci  es tener su propia casa y también exportar la ropa que confecciona al extranjero. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sra. Franci is a hardworking and creative woman who has tremendous desire to succeed with each passing day. She is married and has a 24-year-old son. Sra. Franci makes and sells dresses and suits. She has been in this business for five years.

Franci studied sewing, which is why she established this business. She started with a sewing machine and has gradually been able to get ahead. Franci earns approximately 250 PEN each week. The loan being provided will be invested in the purchase of fabric and clothing for sale. Sra. Franci’s goals are to have her own house and to export the clothing she produces to other countries. She is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es: La señora Jimena tiene la actividad de venta de condimentos y otros, su puesto  esta ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz, el negocio de la señora Jimena es sacrificado porque tiene que levantarse a horas muy tempranas de la mañana para realizar su venta, su esposo es chofer asalariado de un taxi el se levanta desde la mañana hasta muy tarde, la pareja es un matrimonio joven tienen un hijo de apenas un año, la pareja lucha mucho para surgir en la vida, y quieren logran un futuro mejor para sus hijos, invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio comprando ajo, comino,  ají, caldos saborizantes, etc., La Sra. Jimena esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jimena sells condiments and other products.  Her stand is located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Fátima zone.  Her work is very demanding because she has to rise very early in the morning to carry out her sales.   Her husband’s a salaried taxi driver.  He’s up from very early in the morning until very late at night.  They are a young married couple with a son who is barely a year old.  They struggle much to get ahead in life and they want to attain a better future for their children.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  She will buy garlic, cumin, chili, flavoring for soups, etc.  Jimena is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy garlic, cumin and chili.

loans.name: Silvio Rene

texts.es: El señor Silvio vive en la casa de sus padres es soltero y aporta con la educación de sus hermanos y sobrinos, es un cliente nuevo que fue invitado por su hermana que es cliente de nuestra institución y como actividad principal se dedica al arte del pintado y decoración de interiores  fachadas de paredes desde  muy joven  actualmente el es independiente y sus contratos los realiza en la cuidad de La Paz, Cochabamba y otros departamentos  el crédito que solicitó es para la compra de escaleras metálicas y pintura por mayor por que sus contratos son a obra vendida, está muy feliz por que con el crédito otorgado ya podrá finalizar un contrato que tenia pendiente en Cochabamba.
texts.en: Silvio lives in his parents’ house.  He’s single and helps out with education costs of his siblings and nephews and nieces.  He’s a new client who was invited by his sister who is a client of our institution.  His main activity is painting walls and interior decorating.  He’s been independent since a very young age and he makes his contracts in the city of La Paz, Cochabamba and other departments.  He asked for the loan to buy metal ladders and paint at wholesale because his contracts are based on sold jobs.  He’s very happy with the granted loan because he will finally be able to complete a pending contract he has in Cochabamba.

loans.use: to buy ladders and paint.

loans.name: Yeny Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Yeny es una mujer luchadora, con ganas de superación, ella es casada tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 14 años de edad, la Sra. Yeny se dedica a la venta de comida, jugos  y raspadilla; lleva en el negocio mas de 4 años, gana semanalmente S/ 150 nuevos soles aproximadamente. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de un kiosco y mesas para la venta de comida , para poder tener mayor concurrencia de clientes. Sus principales sueños de la Sra. Yeny es construir su casa y tener un restaurante muy grande donde brindar diferentes platos. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sra. Yeny is a determined woman who desires to succeed. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 14. Sra. Yeny sells food, juices, and snow cones. She has been in business for more than four years and earns approximately 150 PEN a week.

The loan being provided will be invested in the purchase of a kiosk and tables for her food business so that she can accommodate more customers. Her main dreams are to build a house and to have a large restaurant where she can serve different dishes. She is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk and tables for her food business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Mónica, cliente que anteriormente saco un crédito con financiamiento Kiva, ahora solicita otro  crédito, no tubo ningún problema con el pago de sus cuotas, ella  se dedica al servicio de peluquería a domicilio por las noches y fines de semana, ya que en el día trabaja en un salón de peinados en la zona de Calacoto, especialmente hace manicure, pedicura y también tintes, peinados. La señora Mónica vive con su papá y hermanos, ella tiene un hijo pequeño en edad escolar, es una clienta muy trabajadora y responsable, el crédito que ahora solicita es para compra de material  y equipamiento  para el trabajo que realiza como tintes y otros productos de peluqueria.
texts.en:
Mónica took out a previous Kiva loan.  She’s now asking for another loan.  She had no problems repaying the previous one.  She provides in-home beauty salon services in the evening and on weekends because during the day she works in a hair salon in the Calacoto zone.  Her specialties are manicures, pedicures, hair coloring and hair styling.

Mónica lives with her father and siblings.  She has a small, school age son.  She is a very hardworking, responsible client.  She will use the requested loan to buy supplies and equipment for the work she does like hair dyes and other beauty salon products.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Julia Isabel

texts.es: La señora Julia  es cliente antigua de nuestra institución  ella vive en la casa de su mamá quien también es nuestra cliente ambas trabajan con puntualidad en sus pagos, La familia de la Sra. Julia esta integrada por  dos niños en edad escolar su esposo trabaja en provincias aledañas de La ciudad de La Paz (yungas), la señora se dedica a la venta de comida y venta de refrescos desde hace bastante tiempo, ella vende por su zona donde hay una cancha césped sintético y también en las fiestas que hay por la zona, ella requiere el préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de un cuarto ya que vive solo en un cuarto bastante estrecho y una cocina pequeña y con la construcción desea brindar comodidad a su familia  motivo por cual se les solicita el financiamiento Kiva.
texts.en:
Julia’s a longstanding client of our institution.  She lives in her mother’s house who is also a client of ours.  They both make their payments punctually.  

Julia’s family consists of two young, school age, children and her husband who works in provinces (Yungas) adjacent to the city of La Paz.

She has been working selling food and soft-drinks for quite some time now.  She sells in her neighborhood where there is a synthetic grass playing field and also at the local festivals in her area.

She needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies to build a room because she lives in a cramped single room with just a very small kitchen.  With this construction she hopes to provide her family with more comfort and this is why she’s asking for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for general maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as flowers and materials to make greeting cards and floral arrangements.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra.  Eugenia esta casada con  el señor Jorge y viven la ciudad de La Paz tienen  dos hijos que están en la edad  escolar, la cliente vende comida  y su esposo trabaja  en la   en una empresa publica,  juntos trabajan sacrificadamente  para salir adelante   y de esta manera lograr sus objetivos que tienen en la familia el crédito  que solicito lo invertirá en la compra de material de construcción para la refacción de la casa donde viven , la Sra. Eugenia se siente feliz por ser beneficiado con el crédito, ya que con este crédito la  Sra. brindara mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is married and lives with her husband Jorge in the city of La Paz. They have two school-age children.

She sells food, and her husband works for a public agency.  Together they work hard and make sacrifices in order to make progress and achieve their goals for their family.

The loan she is seeking will be invested in construction materials to make repairs to their house.

Eugenia will be happy to receive this loan, since with these funds she will be able to provide more comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stove, cooking utensils, supplies, and ingredients for preparing fast food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to build her inventory of clothes, perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esmeralda Bibiana

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar vive la señora Esmeralda, tiene 51  años, actualmente mantiene una relación de unión libre y de otra  relación que tuvo hace tiempo  tiene tres hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es mecánico automotriz. 

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y otros clientes llegan hasta su casa, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, pantalones, blusas y ropa en general. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un local para vender la ropa y todos sus productos.
texts.en:
The members of the August 4th Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the parish of Andrés de Vera in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. For many years, Portoviejo has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Sra. Esmeralda lives in this place. She is 51 years old and currently in a common-law relationship. Esmeralda has three children from a previous relationship who are now grown and independent. Her husband is an automobile mechanic.

Esmeralda is a homemaker who earns her own income by selling clothing through catalogs and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works every day by going door-to-door. Other customers come to her house. Esmeralda extends credit for her products and collects payment at the end of each week. She has been in this business for three years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, trousers, blouses, and clothing in general. Esmeralda is participating in her fourth loan with the Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell clothes and all of her products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, trousers, blouses, and clothing in general.

loans.name: Moises Edwin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin trabaja desde muy joven con la confección de prendas de vestir, inicialmente se dedicaba a realizar la confección de chamarras para varón, en la actualidad confecciona chalecos en tela polar, el producto se puede vender durante todo el año a sus diferentes clientes, el Señor Edwin aún es soltero y no tiene deudas en ninguna institución financiera, solamente tiene crédito en Emprender, ya trabajo anteriormente con crédito con montos menores mostrando mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos, a un futuro el quiere tener un negocio muy grande con un taller amplio y bien equipado, ya ahora esta adquiriendo experiencia y conociendo mejor el mercado, para posteriormente tener varios clientes a quien distribuir sus productos ya que el entrega sus pedidos por arriba de las 5 docenas, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una maquina elastiquera, Esta muy contento por ser un cliente preferencial y contar con el crédito Kiva.
texts.en: Edwin has been making clothes since he was very young.  He started out making men's jackets and currently makes fleece vests.  He sells his products year round to his different customers.  Edwin is still single and doesn't have debts with any financial institution.  He only has a loan from Emprender.  He already received a loan for a smaller sum and showed a lot of responsibility in making his repayments.  In the future, he would like to have a very large business with a large, well-equipped workshop.  He is currently gaining experience and increasing his knowledge of the market so that he will later have a number of customers to whom he will distribute his products.  He delivers his orders above 5 dozen.  Edwin will use his loan money to buy an overlock machine.  He is very happy to be a preferred client and receive a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to invest in buying an overlock machine

loans.name: Aurora Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Aurora, tiene 51 años  de edad, está separada y fruto de esa relación tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de  edad e independientes. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Ella para ganar el sustento diario se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, allí también vende bebidas como agua, sodas y cervezas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 20h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sodas, aguas y cervezas.

Sus sueños es gozar de buena salud y seguir adelante en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The members of the August 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the parish of Andrés de Vera in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. For many years, Portoviejo has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Aurora. She is 51 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children who are grown and independent. Aurora is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the benefits that the organization has provided.

She earns her daily living by selling clothing of all types. Her sales are made by going door-to-door. She also sells from her house where she has a small store. There she also sells beverages such as water, sodas, and beer. Aurora works every day from 8am to 8pm. She extends credit to her customers and collects at the end of every week. Aurora buys her merchandise in Guayaquil as needed. She has been in this business for more than four years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, sodas, water, and beer. Her dreams are to enjoy good health and to move forward in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, sodas, water, and beer.

loans.name: Mariana Magaly

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  10, 8 y 3 años, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Ella para ayudarse y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, le encanta vender y vende muchos productos a la vez,  vende  productos Lebel, Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para dama), artículos para el hogar como: planchas, ventiladores, licuadoras, zapatos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los  días por las mañanas ya que en la tarde tiene que ayudar a sus hijos en las tareas de la escuela. Deja a crédito y cobra todos los fines de semana. Tiene cinco años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos, planchas, licuadoras, etc. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha podido financiar en momentos difíciles.
 
Su sueño es ver que  a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
In the parish of Andrés De Vera in the city of Portoviejo - the capital of Manabí which has long been known as the city of the royal tamarind trees - the members of Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto meet every 15 days.

Here we meet Señora Mariana. She is 28  years old, and married with 3 children, aged 10, 8 and 3. The older 2 children attend school, nad her husband is employed by a company.

To help herself and her husband with their household expenses, she dedicates herself to her business. She loves selling, and sells many different products at once: she sells "Lebel" and "Esika"-brand beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies accessories; she sells household goods such as irons, fans, and liquidisers; as well as shoes and other things. She works every morning, because in the afternoons she has to help her children with their homework. She extends credit to her customers and collects payment every weekend. She has worked like this for 5 years, and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, shoes, irons, liquidisers, etc. This will be her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans have seen her through some difficult times. Her dream is for her children not to lack anything they need.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, shoes, irons, liquidisers, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: En la localidad de Kennedy, Sandra compró un consultorio odontológico, ella está motivada a ser independiente porque requiere pasar mayor tiempo con sus hijos y trabajando para una empresa no lo lograba. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual hará adecuaciones a su infraestructura locativa, quiere cambir la división , comprar canecas para el manejo de residuos y además tener impreso el protocolo que requiere la secretaría de salud para su buen funcionamiento. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que planea su crecimiento poco a poco. En su consultorio ofrece servicios odontologicos a la comunidad que la rodea, espera que prestando un servicio de calidad, a precios atractivos y un servicio de calidez humana logre impactar su clientela objeto y posicionamiento de  este mercado que necesita conquistar.
texts.en:
In the town of Kennedy, Sandra bought a dental practice. She is motivated to become independent because she wants to spend more time with her children and was not able to get a job with a company. Sandra is currently applying for a Kiva loan so that she can make structural renovations, change the room division layout, and buy medical waste bins that have the proper protocol printed on them as required by the health department.

This Kiva loan is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the organization that will assist her with her gradual growth. In her office, she provides dental services to the surrounding community. Sandra hopes to provide a quality service, affordable prices, and warm treatment to impact her target audience. This will help her gain position in the market that she needs to conquer.

loans.use: to make structural renovations, change the room division layout of her office, and buy medical waste bins that have the proper protocol printed on them.

loans.name: Juliana Betzabe

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juliana, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  6 y de 3 años de edad, el  mayor estudian en escuela y el menor está en una guardería. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que además de ser comerciante también trabaja en un bar restaurante en la ciudad por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual. También se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, relojes, productos Oriflame y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00 en el restaurante de lunes a sábado, por las noches y domingos ella realiza sus ventas aunque también aprovecha para  vender en su lugar de trabajo a personas que la conocen y a quienes les da facilidades  de pagos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, joyas de plata, relojes, etc. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio restaurante o un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '4 de Agosto' community bank meet in Andrés de Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province.  This city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet Juliana.  She is 29 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage who are 6 and 3.  Her eldest is in elementary school and her youngest is in daycare.  Her husband is a driver.

Juliana is a very hard-working woman who, in addition to selling products, also works in a bar-restaurant in the city, for which she receives a monthly wage.  She sells silver jewelry, watches, and Oriflame- and Yanbal-brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works from 6.00am to 6.00pm in the restaurant, from Monday to Saturday, and sells her products in the evenings and on Sundays, though she also sells them at work to people that she knows and to whom she provides credit terms.

Juliana will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, silver jewelry, watches, etc.  This is her third loan cycle as a member of her community bank which she likes because the interest rates are lower than with other loan institutions.

Juliana's dream is to own her own restaurant or general store.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, silver jewelry, watches, etc.

loans.name: Manuela Sisivel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Manuela, tiene 45 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos de 10 y 8  años de edad  los mismos que estudian en escuela. Lleva dos ciclos en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y porque no piden tantos requisitos para poder recibir los créditos.

Ella para salir adelante y para sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace muchos años atrás tiene un restaurante en el cual prepara y vende deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días  desde las 03h00 hasta las 15h00, allí prepara deliciosos desayunos y variados almuerzos, con ella trabaja una señora a quien le paga un sueldo mensual.  Gracias a su negocio ella ha podido salir adelante y ahora con los créditos lo ha podido mejorar aun más.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es darles una muy buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Andrés  De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the “4 de Agosto” communal bank meets every 15 days. 

Here we meet Manuela. She is 45 years old. She is the single mother of two children who are 10 and 8 years old and who are attending school. She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles. She likes it because of the assistance and because there aren’t lots of requirements for being able to receive the loans.

In order to get ahead and to help her children get ahead, she has had a restaurant for several years where she prepares and sells delicious meals. She works every day from 3:00 AM until 3:00 PM. She makes delicious breakfasts and a variety of lunches. She works along with a woman who she pays a monthly salary. Thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead and now with the loans she has been able to improve even more. 

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for the preparation of her foods. 

Her dream is to give her children a very good education.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients

loans.name: Candida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Candida, de 45 años , es una humilde comerciante originaria de la ciudad de León , es madre de tres hijos, ella se dedica a vender mariscos en el mercado de la terminal de buses de León, ella empezó desde muy joven en este negocio, aprendió de sus padres quienes antes se dedicaban a vender , luego ella siguió en la venta de pescado lleva 27 años con este negocio , por las tardes dos de sus hijos de menores la ayudan a atender el negocio ya que por la mañana ellos estudian, de esta manera entre escamas y hielo ah venido sacando adelante su negocio y su hogar día a día.
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar maricos para vender en su local.  Pues se acerca una temporada buena para la venta de mariscos. Ella lucha cada día por darle lo mejor a su familia, ella quiere hacerle algunas mejoras a su local , para tener mas capacidad y condiciones para almacenar y vender mariscos.
texts.en:
Candida, age 45, is a humble merchant from the city of León, and she has three children.  She sells seafood at the market at the León bus terminal.  She started this business when she was very young.  She learned from her parents who used to sell.  She continued on selling fish, and she has been in this business for 27 years.  

Two of her minor children help her tend the business in the afternoons.  In the mornings they go to school.  This way, between scales and ice, she has gotten her business and her household ahead day by day.

She needs the loan to buy seafood to sell at her place.  The season for good seafood sales is approaching.  She struggles every day in order to give her family the best.  She wants to make some improvements to her place.  She will do this in order to have a greater capacity and conditions to store and sell seafood.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell at her place.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente él trabaja para mantener a la familia, el oficio de la agricultura lo aprendió de su padre, siembra maíz, frijol y hortalizas, su horario es de 6:00am a 2:00pm, para atender sus ocupaciones agrícolas.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra, pues se dispone a  realizar la plantación de frijoles, el préstamo le ayudara para la obtención de los insumos necesarios para desarrollar el cultivo.
Julio quiere disponer de tiempo y buena salud para trabajar diariamente, con la intención de proveer para su familia todo lo necesario, logrando apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Julio is a farmer and lives with his wife and two children.  He is the only bread winner for the family and learned his trade from his father.  He grows corn, beans and vegetables and works from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. attending to his agricultural work.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and hire workers since he is about to plant beans.  The loan will help him buy the supplies he needs to grow the crop.

Julio wants to have enough time and good health to work daily so he can provide his family with everything they need, including helping his children get an education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay hired workers.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio desde sus 14 años aprendió el oficio de la panadería, y adquirió mucha expereincia trabajando para muchos negocios de su barrio y posteriormente emprendió el suyo propio con el que ha logrado el sostenimiento de su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos que ya trabajan en diferentes empresas. Con sus ahorros de varios años y pequeños prestamos, logró poco a poco comprar toda la infraestructura que se requería para iniciar y crecer. En su barrio lo conocen por los deliciosos panes que ofrece a su clientela, entre los cuales estan, el pan piñita, pan dulce, pan de queso, pan de sal, pan francés, los cuales distribuye entre tiendas de su barrio principalmente y a muchas familias que le compran directamente. Antonio ensena a jóvenes el oficio para que se entusiasmen y en el futuro emprendan  su propio negocio y ganen dinero. Aunque en su area de acción existen varias panaderias, piensa que no le afectan porque el barrio es muy grande y alcanza para todos la demanda. Su creikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará insumos en mayor volumen como harina de trigo, azucar, lacteos, frutas cristalizadas etc. Su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio para lograr un mejor desempeño en el mercado y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonio learned the bakery trade when he was 14 years old.  He acquired his expertise working for many businesses in his neighborhood and later started his own business which has supported his family, comprised of his wife and two children who work in separate companies.  With his savings of several years and small loans he has been able to buy the infrastructure he needed to get started and grow.  He is known in the neighborhood for the delicious breads he offers customers, among which are "pan piñita", sweet bread, cheese bread, savory bread, and french bread which he distributes to the stores in the neighborhood.  Many families buy from him directly.  

Antonio teaches his trade to young people so they will take an interest in it and begin their own business to earn money.  Although there are several bakeries in the same area, he does not feel there is much competition because the neighborhood is large and there is enough demand for everyone.  The credikiva is his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use it to buy bulk wheat flour, sugar, dairy products and dried fruits.  His goal is to continue expanding his business to gain a greater market share and increase income.

loans.use: To buy bulk wheat flour, sugar, dairy products and .

loans.name: Rosa Edith

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, todos son mayores de edad e independientes aunque viven en su casa pero en departamentos independientes. Su esposo es Abogado.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de sabanas y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su hija le da vendiendo a sus compañeras de trabajo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Las sabanas las compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita o tiene pedidos. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y sabanas. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy responsable y unido. 

Su meta es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Nueva Estrella Solidaria meet every two weeks in the municipal community of the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital of Manabi for many years as the city of royal tamarinds.

This is where we met Mrs. Rosa, 55, who is married and has four children, all of whom are adults and live independently in different parts of the house.  Her husband is a lawyer.

In order to earn her own income, she sells bed sheets and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week and her daughter sells to her colleagues at work.  She delivers her products on a credit basis and collects payment every week.  Whenever she has orders for sheets she travels to Guayaquil to buy them.  For three years she has been in business and it is going well for her.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and sheets.  This is her second term with the communal bank and she is pleased that the group is so responsible and united.

Her goal is to have a bazaar one day.

loans.use: To buy creams,  and bed sheets.

loans.name: Raquel Maria

texts.es: La señora Raquel,  se dedica a la venta de comida,  es una clienta nueva de la institución, que demostró un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se lo hizo, la cliente vive en la zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de el Alto, La Paz Bolivia, ubicada al sur de esta ciudad. La Sra. Raquel en la actualidad vive con sus dos pequeños niños pero cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá política,  su Suegra para el cuidado de ellos, cuenta que el esposo las abandonó y no sabe donde se encuentra.   La Sra. Raquel es muy trabajadora y además abnegada con sus hijos, ella tiene la voluntad de que con trabajo, va un día tener su casa propia y además que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera profesional, por lo que se esfuerza a lograrlo día a día. El negocio es muy concurrido y por esta razón tiene la necesidad de ampliarlo por esta razon solicito el  crédito que lo utilizara en la compra de mesas, sillas y un refrigerador para la venta de comida,  para llegar a tener una mayor venta y poder de esta manera superarse y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Raquel sells food, and she is a new client of the Institución.  She demonstrated herself to be friendly and courteous during the evaluation that was done.  She lives in the Villa Adela area of the city of El Alto, La Paz, Bolivia; which is located to the south of this city.

Raquel currently lives with her two small children, and her mother-in-law helps her take care of the children.  She says that her husband abandoned them, and she does not know where he is.

Raquel is very hard-working, and she is also self-sacrificing for her children.  She has the wish that through work she will one day have her own house.  She also wishes that her children will come to have professional careers.  She works hard every day to achieve that.

Her business is very busy, and that is the reason that she needs to expand it.  That is why she requested the loan to buy tables, chairs, and a refrigerator to sell food.  This way she will have greater sales and be able to excel and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Maria Ivone

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene como actividad la venta de vajilla y utensilios de cocina,  actividad que realiza durante la semana  en su puesto de venta que esta en una céntrica feria del alto de la paz.
La familia de la cliente esta compuesta por su esposo y recientemente nació su primer hijo, es una familia joven y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida esta  actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella  y su familia, el esposo tiene como profesión la abogacía, el destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería vajilla por cantidad para así agrandar su negocio y mejorara sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María sells dishes and kitchen utensils, which she does during the week in her stall in a central market in El Alto de La Paz.

María's family includes her husband and their recently born first child.  It's a young family that wants to be successful in life.  This activity is her principal source of income for her and her family.  Her husband works in the field of law.

The purpose of the loan is to buy table service merchandise wholesale and so increase her business and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy table service merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Nuevo Despertar Group

texts.es:
Doña Elsa es coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Nuevo Despertar, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Yuscaran y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en general.

Su pequeña pulperia inició a funcionar desde hace varios años atras, desde que Doña Elsa se fue a vivir con el padre de sus dos hijos. Los padres de Doña Elsa le regalaron el capital inicial para instalar su pulperia y luego con el tiempo recuperó la inversion inicial y ahora trabaja con su propio capital. Cuando se fue a vivir con su ex-esposo dejó de estudiar y se dedicó totalmente a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, pero luego él la dejó y para superarse decidió continuar sus estudios y logró culminar y ahora es maestra de educacion primaria. Su horario lo atiende por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a dar clases y sus hijos se turnan para atender la pulperia cuando ella no está.

Doña Elsa solicita el prestamo para surtir su pulperia con productos como lacteos, carnes, embutidos, arroz, frijoles, churros, pastas, verduras, entre otros.

Su meta es mantener activo su negocio para poder seguir sosteniendo a sus hijos y darles un futuro mejor con el apoyo para que estudien. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elsa is the coordinator of the “Nuevo Despertar” (New Awakening) Communal Bank.  She is 34 years old and the single mother of two children.  She lives in the Yuscaran municipality selling general groceries.  Her small store started to function several years ago after Elsa went to live with the father of her two children.

Elsa’s parents gifted her with the startup capital to establish her store.  Later, in time, she recovered her initial investment, and she now works with her own capital.  When she went to live with her ex-husband, she stopped going to school and dedicated herself completely to the household chores and the care of her children.

Then, he left her.  In order to improve herself she decided to continue her education, and she managed to complete it.  She is now a primary school teacher.  She takes care of her schedule in the mornings, and in the afternoons she teaches classes.  Her children take turns taking care of the store when she is not there.

Elsa is requesting the loan to stock her store with products like dairy products, meat, sausages, rice, beans, churros, pasta, and vegetables, among others.

Her goal is to keep her business active in order to be able to keep supporting her children and give them a better future with the support of an education.

This is her first cycle with FAMA, and she plans to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, meat, sausages, rice, and beans, etc.

loans.name: Kari Elizabeth

texts.es: Kari tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, reside en el municipio de Moroceli y se dedica a la venta de frijoles. Ella inició con esta actividad hace tres años atras cuando se le ocurrió que en el patio trasero de su casa podia sembrar frijoles y entonces se decidió y lo hizo, y gracias a Dios el producto de su cosecha fue muy bueno y desde ese momento supo que esa actividad le permitiria sostener a su familia y darles lo mas necesario para tener una vida digna. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y sus vecinos son sus principales clientes. El prestamo que esta solicitando Kari lo necesita para comprar varias cargas de frijoles porque no se da abasto con solo el producto de su siembra. Con el apoyo de este prestamo espera aumentar sus ventas y con eso sus ingresos aumentaran y su negocio se mantendra activo. Si meta es tener una bodega y ampliar la gama de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de granos basicos. Este es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas y seguir ayudando a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su hogar especialmente espera poder seguir cubriendo los gastos de estudio de sus hijos porque ella sueña que tengan una mejor vida que la que tuvo ella.
texts.en:
Kari, 30, is married and has five children.  She resides in the town of Moroceli and works selling beans.

She started this business three years ago when it occurred to her that she could grow beans on the back patio of her house, so she decided to do it and she did.  Thanks to God the product of her harvest was very good, and from that moment on she knew that the work would allow her to support her family and give them the most things necessary to have a live of dignity.  She sells from her house and her neighbors are her main customers.

Kari will use the loan that she is requesting to buy several loads of beans because her crop doesn't give her enough.  With the help of this loan she hopes to increase her sales and, with this, her earnings will go up and her business will remain active.

Her goal is to have a grocery store and expand the range of products to offer her customers a variety of basic grains.

This is her second loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to fulfill her loan payments punctually and continue helping her husband with the support of their home.  She especially hopes to be able to continue covering her children's school expenses because her dream is for them to have a better life than she did.

loans.use: to sell beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy his own motor vehicle.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 26 years old and lives in Jimenez, MIsamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with one school-aged child. 

Benson has a motorcycle transport business. The folks called it habal-habal, a two-wheeled vehicle that carries two to six passengers and is seen most often in rural and remote areas. He has been driving around the usual destinations for one year. This job has allowed him to earn 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in each month of activity. Benson has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase motor accessories for better service. 

Benson became part of the cooperative earlier this year. He hopes to use more of the programs and services offered by GDMPC. He expects to replace immediately the damaged motor parts to resume business operations. He plans as well to extend the seating capacity of the vehicle for a better accommodation of passengers.

loans.use: To purchase motor accessories for better service.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is married with three school-aged children. Elna is 27 years old and lives in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

To earn a living, she runs a sari-sari store selling various goods from grocery items down to a display of a few school and office supplies and hardware items like nails. Sometimes, she is vending fruits outside the store to increase her income. She has been doing this for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell. 

Elna has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Elna hopes to expand and improve the business to gain more income. She plans to save some part of her monthly earnings in preparation for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a kitchen

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married with four school-aged children. Elvie is 41 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store at home. She sells grocery items like toothpaste, noodles, shampoo, rice, rice bran, soft drinks, etc. She has been handling the business for over five years. She has extra means of income and that allows her to earn a total of PHP 7,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 from GDMPC to purchase more grocery items to sell. 

In the future, Elvie hopes to expand and improve the business. She plans to invest in livestock feeding supplies to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 43 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Valentina is vending a variety of fish in the local community. She sometimes sells other seafood products like shells, seaweed, etc. It is the kind of living she obtained from her parents when she was still young. She has been doing this job for four years. Fortunately, Valentina is able to generate PHP 4,500 a month. She has borrowed PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to order a variety of fish in the local community.

Valentina has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.  In the future, Valentina would like to have a fish-vending stall in the market and to offer more seafood products to gain more income.

loans.use: To order a variety of fish to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 33 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Lina owns and operates an eatery. She cooks at least four to eight classes of viands in her business site and also offers coffees, milk, cereals, and other snacks to eat. She has sustained her business operations for over five successful years. Each month, she earns an approximate total of PHP 3,500. She borrowed PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase cooking materials for the business. She believes that work will be much easier and faster if all the necessary cooking stuffs are present. 

In the future, Lina would like to widen the area and add more tables and chairs to provide a conducive place for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase cooking materials for the business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 46 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. To earn a living, Rosalinda has a business selling different kinds of fish and other seafood products when they are available. She sells fish within her own community as well as neighboring areas. She has been successfully managing her business for six years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. Rosalinda has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.

Rosalinda is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase variety of fish and fish products to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rent a marketplace stall to gain more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish and fish products to sell

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is 34 years old and is married with three school-aged children. She lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Rosaline owns and operates a local retail store where she sells various grocery items like soft drinks, checheria, canned goods, noodles, and other items. It has been a long-time aspiration for Rosalie to run her own store. She's happy that she has this business and has managed it for three years. She earns 3,000 PHP each month. Rosaline is a new member of the cooperative.

Rosaline is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks to sell. She hopes to stay in business for many many years and expand her product offerings to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 37 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children.
