To earn a living, Sofia owns and operates an eatery where she offers various recipes everyone would love to eat. The family is depending on much of the earnings generated from the eatery for day to day consumptions. Sofia is so glad to be in the business for 10 years already. This has allowed her to receive a total of 10,000 PHP a month. She has borrowed 25,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase food supplies for the business so as to continue her operations.

In the future, Sofia would like to expand and improve the business, particularly the eating area to provide a comfortable place for customers.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for the business

loans.name: Digna Isidra

texts.es:
Doña Digna tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, reside en la comunidad de Palo Verde en el municipio de Danli y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y en pequeña escala al cultivo de cafe.

Ella inició con la venta de productos de la canasta basica desde hace 10 años atras en una pequeña parte de su casa de habitacion y luego con el tiempo fue ahorrando y actualmente se dedica al cultivo de cafe. Su hijo mayor le ayuda con el manejo y cuidado de su pequeña finca mientras ella atiende su pulperia. 

El prestamo que Doña Digna está solicitando lo necesita para la compra de productos como carnes, embutidos, verduras, pastas, refrecos, jugos, maseca, manteca, aceite, entre otros. Con la ayuda de este prestamo podra surtir su pulperia de mas y variados productos para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor diversidad y tambien una parte del prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes.

Su sueño es hacerle mejoras a su casa especialmente donde tiene instalada su pulperia y tambien llegar a ser una productora de cafe en gran escala, para asi poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el compromiso de sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo en los prestamos anteriores.
texts.en:
Digna is 46 years old and the single mother of four children.  She lives in the community of Palo Verde in the municipality of Danli and she sells groceries and grows coffee on a small scale.

She started by selling products from the basic shopping basket ten years ago in a little part of her house.  Later she saved money and currently she grows coffee.  Her oldest son helps her with the management and care of her little farm while she tends the grocery store.

Digna needs the loan she is requesting to buy products like meats, sausages, vegetables, pasta, soft drinks, juice, cornmeal, lard, and oil, among others.  With the help of this loan she will be able to supply her store with more and varied products to offer her customers greater diversity.  Also, part of the loan will be to buy fertilizers.

Her dream is to make improvements on her house, especially where she has her store.  She also wants to become a coffee grower on a large scale, so she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

This is her third loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her payments punctually as she did with the earlier loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries in general.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn (in the photo) and her husband, Chem, live in a village along National Road number five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children, one son and two daughters, who are garment workers. 

Sorn is a tailor and she puts together fabric swatches, while her husband is a driver. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon (in the photo) and her husband, Sopheap, have been married since 2003. They have three children- one son and two daughters. The family is living in a village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Mon is a rice farmer. Her husband is a mason; he also assists in his wife’s farming business. Mon is asking for loan of 500 USD to build the fence around her house.

loans.use: To build the fence around her house

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak, a 59-year-old widowed woman, has been living in Kompong Speu province. Mrs. Prak has worked as a local cultivator since she was widowed. She was married, but her husband died a few years ago. Mrs. Prak has three children, one of whom is single and works as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh city. The other two children are married and live separately. 

From her business, Mrs. Prak typically earns an income of about 1.25 USD per day. She also depends on an income from her daughter who gets a monthly salary sewing clothes. With this little income, Mrs. Prak cannot cover all of her daily expenses. Thus, Mrs. Prak would like to request some funds from Kiva to purchase some pigs for breeding and future sale. In her prospect, Mrs. Prak hopes that she will able to increase her income from her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase some pigs for breeding

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara (in the photo) is 45 years old and her husband, Mean, is 43 years old. They live in a village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1992 and have one son who is in school. Tara and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, she also sells dessert in the village. 

Tara’s son just finished his baccalaureate and he wants to continue his studying in university. Hence, Tara is asking for her first loan of 800 USD to pay school fees for her son and buy a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son and buy a motorbike for her son to drive to school

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary, pictured here, is a weaver, while her husband, Borin, is a rice farmer. They have been married since 1988 and have three sons and one daughter. Theary and her family live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Theary is asking for another loan of 500 USD to purchase materials to continue her weaving business. She will also use a part of her loan to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her weaving business and repair her house

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar is 26 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and supports the family taxi business. Erdenebaatar started his business in 2007 by driving a taxi in the city. His daily income is 30,000 MNT and his monthly profit is 400,000 MNT. When his car is clean and tidy, he receives more customers and earns more profit. He is willing to expand his business. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "the loan from XacBank will bring huge contribution to my business and to my family." 

Erdenebaatar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials to fix his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate his house

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man, who is pictured here, is a fisherman. His wife, Aimmeynas, sells the fish that her husband catches in their village. They have been married since 1980 and have three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home and the others are in school.

Man is applying for another loan of 800 USD to buy additional fishing nets to continue his fishing business.

loans.use: to buy nets for his fishing business

loans.name: Ulanbayar

texts.en: Ulanbayar is 25 years old and lives with her parents and sisters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her sisters are high school and university students. Her parents sell food and snacks. She graduated from a hairdresser's training course in 2005 and started her business in 2006. Now she provides hair care service at the local market. She has many years of business and work experience. She plans to expand her business, buy necessary equipment and tools, and decorate her commercial space to attract more customers. She is a diligent, hardworking, and energetic woman who says, "I want to have customers and provide the best service I can give. To do this, I need to have equipment and tools and attractive commercial space." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy necessary tools and to decorate her commercial space.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and to decorate her commercial space

loans.name: Top

texts.en:
Top (in the photo) and her husband, Sophea, are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village where they live. The couple hopes to continue their farming business because it’s a main source of income. Hence, Top is asking for another loan of $400 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides.

The couple has been married since 1985 and they have two daughters. One is a garment worker and the other is in school. They are living in a village along National Road Number 5, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to continue her farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin is a 45-year-old woman who resides in Kompong Speu province. She is married and blessed with three children. One of her children is a student attending a local state school, while the other two are working in garment factories in Phnom Penh city. Mrs. Yin and her husband are farmers. This couple can earn an income of approximately 1.50 USD per day. They also rely on the income from their two daughters who work in Phnom Penh. During this rainy season, Mrs. Yin doesn’t have enough capital to support her farming operation. Because of this obstacle, Mrs. Yin has decided to seek a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase some farming materials such as seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies. In the future, Mrs. Yin wishes to buy a plot of farmland for growing more rice crops.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies

loans.name: Mony

texts.en: Mony (in the photo) and her husband, Sarun, have been married since 1995 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both children are garment workers. They are living on an island in the Mekong River approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mony is a weaver, while her husband is a mason and fisherman. She is applying for another loan of 400 USD. She will use the money to buy weaving materials to continue her weaving business and to buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and fishing nets

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en: Marusya is 57 years old and lives with her two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in Ovorhangai province of Mongolia. Her son makes wooden furniture and other things at home, and her daughter works at the Unitel LLC in Southgovi region. Marusya started her business in 2006 by selling food and other products from her house. She has many years of business and work experience. She is planning to expand her business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "I want to expand both my and my son's businesses. I think my son's business has a bright future." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy foods and other products for her shop and wood materials for her son's business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of food for her shop and wood materials for her son's business

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat (pictured with her grandchild) and her husband, Leang, are vegetable farmers. They have been married since 1980 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two are married and live outside of the family home. Two are garment factory workers. One is a security guard, and another one stays at home. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Yat is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase one more motorcycle for her son who is a security guard to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Sopeakdey

texts.en:
Sopeakdey (in the photo) is 30 years old. Her husband, Sophea, is 29 yeas old. They have been married for almost ten years and have two young children: one son and one daughter. The family is living in a village on National Road Number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopeakdey and her husband are garment workers. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom (pictured here) and her husband, Sokry, have been married since 1979 and have two sons. One is a garment factory worker and the other one has full-time employment. The family is living in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Sarom and her husband are rice farmers. Her husband is also a construction worker. She is asking for her second loan of $300 in order to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 20 years-old and lives with her mother and brother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ovorhangai province of Mongolia. Her mother helps her to manage the family business. Her brother is a high school student. She started her business in 2009 selling cellphones and their spare parts at the local market. 

She has collected sufficient business and work experience so that she sells cellphones and spare parts that are following market trends. She is planning to expand her business and open another shop at another market. She is a diligent, energetic and hard working woman who says "I like my job and I plan to expand my business in the future. In addition, I will also open another shop." She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to buy cellphones and spare parts and increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and spare parts.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam is a 42 year-old woman living in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, Lam owns and operates a furniture making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  Lam has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a months.

In 2008, Lam joined Kiva partner SEDA in order to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8.736.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  Lam is now requesting a new loan of 9.184.000 VND which will be used to purchase machinery to expand the business.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Lam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lam  là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Lam Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lam thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lam kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Lam đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lam đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Lam dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

loans.use: to purchase machinery to expand her furniture making business.

loans.name: Suny

texts.en:
Suny (in the photo) is 31 years-old, and her husband, Sothea is 32 years-old.  They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have a young daughter.  

Suny sells rice, food and desserts at a local school, while her husband is a rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan of $250 in order to renovate the shop where she sells rice, food and desserts.

loans.use: tTo renovate the shop where she sells rice, food and desserts.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Mr. Nou is a 36 year-old man who has been living in Kompong Speu province. He operates a business as a firewood seller. Everyday, Mr. Nou picks up the firewood from the nearby forest, buy it from suppliers at a lower cost. He then puts the firewood in his trailer and transports it to sell in a local market for profit. 

Mr. Nou has a life partner in his wife who is a local rice cultivator. Besides farming, his wife also assists Mr. Nou in selling the firewood. They are blessed with three unmarried children who are attending school and live from the same income. 

This humble family normally earns $3USD per day to meet the family’s needs. With the coming rainfall, Mr. Nou and his wife don’t have enough capital to use on their farm. To solve the problem, Mr. Nou is applying for a loan from Kiva to buy some farming materials such as rice seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies to start the farming business. In the future, Mr. Nou hopes that he will be able to send all his children to finish at least high school.

loans.use: to buy some farming materials such as rice seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Shamsihol

texts.ru: Шамсихол занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого и мелко – рогатого скота.
texts.en: Shamsihol raises livestock for a living, mostly to sell for meat. She would like to take out this loan to buy a few more calves and lambs for her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang (in the photo), 27, is single. He lives with his widowed mother along National Road Five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samnang is a garment worker and drives a motor taxi when he is free. He is asking for a loan of 800 USD to purchase a cow to raise. He hopes he will be able to earn extra income from selling calves when the cow delivers a baby.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Sokkim

texts.en:
Sokkim (pictured with her young daughter) is 41 years old and her husband, Peou, is 45 years old. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sokkim and her husband have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two are garment workers, two are lathe operators, and the other two attend school. 

Sokkim and her husband are rice farmers. Sokkim’s husband is also a fisherman and does construction work. Sokkim is asking for her first loan of $500 to buy a new boat and fishing materials for her husband’s fishing business, because his boat and fishing materials are old and broken.

loans.use: to buy a new boat and fishing materials for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход житель района Кубодиен. Он женат.  Ему 42 года. У него четверо детей. Его жена предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Сам Фарход зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже год. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Farhod resides in the Qubadiyon region. He is 42 years old, married and has four children. His wife is a seamstress, she makes traditional Tajik dresses. Farhod makes a living by raising cattle and has had his heard for a year now. He would like to take out this loan to purchase more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, 43, is a silk weaver. Her husband is a policeman. They have three children, one son and two daughters, who are in school. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Chanthy is requesting a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

Photo: Chanthy is dyeing silk.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan (in the photo) and her husband, Sokhem, have been married since 1979 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. They live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Nan is a weaver, while her husband is a mechanic who repairs machines. She is requesting another loan of $1,000 to continue her weaving business by buying silk and thread. She will also use a part of the loan to purchase materials for her husband’s mechanical business.

loans.use: To buy silk and thread for her weaving business and purchase materials for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Kumriniso

texts.ru: Кумринисо проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Хайринисо занимается торговлей овощей. Этим видом деятельности она занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа картошки лука и моркови.
texts.en: Kumriniso lives in the town of Khujand. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. Kumriniso has been selling vegetables at the local markets for the last six years. She would like to take out this loan to purchase potatoes, onions and carrots for her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes onions and carrots

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Zorigt is a 24-year-old who lives with his wife and daughter at his parents-in-law’s old house. He has been employed as a welder, but the salary wasn't enough to meet his family's needs, so he started driving a taxi four years ago. Besides the taxi business, he makes a car service for extra earnings. 

Zorigt’s wife is pregnant and is going to give birth soon. He is very worried about the old house’s condition as the new baby is coming. Therefore, he has a plan to make adjustments to his house. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase some building materials to repair the roof and other parts of the house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials repair the roof and other parts of the house.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly is a 51-year-old low-income woman who lives in Kompong Speu province.  Mrs. Ly is married with three children, one of whom is single and works as a driver in Phnom Penh city. The other two are already married and have started new homes. 

To earn a living, Mrs. Ly has been planting rice on her existing farmland for years. Mrs. Ly can generally earn an income of about $0.75 USD per day. She also depends on an income from her husband and her son. To increase her profit, Mrs. Ly would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy some pigs for breeding for future sale. In the future, she wishes to increase her income from her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en: Oyunjargal has been running her tailoring business successfully. Now she desires to expand her business by enlarging the workplace and number of workers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a new multiple-operation sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new multiple-operation sewing machine.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора жительница города Кайракум. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Его муж строитель. Он занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Гулнора 10 лет как предоставляет услугу. По специальности она портниха. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев и других видов платьев у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа швейной машинки.
texts.en: Gulnora is a resident of Kayrakum city. She is 42 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker for hire. Gulnora herself has been working as a seamstress for the last 10 years. She makes traditional Tajik dresses as well as other garments at home. She needs this loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Govher

texts.ru: Говхер жительница города Чкаловск. Она замужем. Ей 35 лет. У нее четверо детей. Говхер занимается торговлей. У нее в городе имеется магазин бытовой техники.  В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой техники.
texts.en: Govher lives in the town of Chkalovsk. She is married. She is 35 years old. She has four children. Govher is a vendor. She keeps a store of home appliances. She has been in this business for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan to stock up on new appliances.

loans.use: to buy home appliances

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four school-going children.  Her husband is a businessman and he supports his family financially.  They own a house that has electricity and piped water.  Amina's greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and medication.

She has operated a cafe business for the past four years; her customers are the local area villagers and travellers.  She faces a major challenge from competition from other cafe operators in the area.  She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil for her cafe business.  She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of affordable financial services.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil for her cafe business.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер житель города Куляб. Ему 22 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Его отец находится за границей, а сестра учится в Вузе. Сам Алишер предоставляет услугу, он таксист. В этой области он уже три года. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the town of Kulob. He is 22 years old and single. He lives in his parents’ home. His father [works] abroad, and his sister is in college. Alisher provides taxi services. He has been in this business for three years already. He is taking out a loan in order to have his car repaired.

loans.use: to get his car repaired

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a taxi driver who greatly contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Sophia has a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for the children. 

Sophia has operated a water-selling business for the past year, selling from home and going door-to-door to her neighbours. In addition, she also owns a cereals shop, where she earns her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the business. She dreams of establishing a water-selling shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, Sophia wants to purchase a water tank. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Nusura

texts.en: Nusura is a 40 year old married woman with five children, all of whom are in the school.  For the past four years she has been in the business of selling bread in Kator, South Sudan. She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business by purchasing more bread to sell.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for sale.

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en: Chuluunbat is 50 years old and lives with his wife and children – who are college and high school students – in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  He started their family business in 2002 by selling clothes and other products in the open flee market. His wife has now been selling clothes and shoes there for several years, and currently manages this business. The couple have many years of business and work experience.  Now Chuluunbat is making wooden furniture which he sells from his home.  In the future, he plans to expand his business and provide a high level of education to his children, and prepare homes for his daughters as well. He is a hardworking and proactive man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my income. I also want to give a good education to my children. This is very important to me and my family." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy clothes for the family shop and wood for his own work.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the family shop and wood materials for his own work

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Он не имеет высшего образования. Хуршед развозит людей по маршруту Кулоб – Душанбе. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения запчастей автомашины.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 29 years old, married and has three children.  He does not have a higher education.  Khurshed transports people along the Kulob - Dushanbe route.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mdodze is a married woman with five children who are all grown up.  Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.  

For the past five years she has been in the business of buying and selling goats for meat.  Her potential customers are butcher shop operators and villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With her KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 56, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jose, an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). She is a mother of four children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Emma owns a sari-sari store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells direct selling products by means of a catalogue. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 that will help to continue her operations.  She will use the loan to buy additional grocery items and accommodate the orders in her direct selling business. Her profits allow them to enjoy some comforts in life and secure their children’s future.

Emma dreams of improving their family living. She is hopeful that her business will continue to grow. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his late 30s, is married with one child who goes to school. He takes care of his sister who is a widow. He is an electrical repairman.  He works from  8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Said’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy a meter machine and a spanner for his business. His dream is to one day be able to have a bigger workshop.  He will share this loan with his loan group, "Mt. Livingstone", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy a meter machine and a spanner for his electrical repair business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 67 and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a retired government employee.   She has two children; one in high school and one in elementary school. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Virginia owns a sari-sari store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and other primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells direct-selling products by means of a catalogue. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Virginia is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 14, 000 as an additional capital. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional grocery items and to accommodate the demands in her direct selling business. This will help her to sustain her capital and have a better income. 

Virginia dreams that her business will become successful and wants her family to have a good future.She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 36 years old and single. She supports a family of three people.  She has a retail shop which helps her in meeting her family’s needs.  She has been running her business for three years, and earns an income of KES 70,000 per month.  

She was previously given a loan of KES 50,000, which she used to expand her business.  She has been paying it back successfully.  This is her fourth loan, which she will use to buy more stock of soft drinks, wheat flour, sweets, and washing detergent. The anticipated profit that she will get will be used to expand her business. Her hope and dream for her business is to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, wheat flour, sweets, and washing detergent.

loans.name: Umjima

texts.en:
Umjima is a 39-year-old married woman with two children two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years

Umjima requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will be used for building a concrete house in future

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 27-years-old and married to Richard. She has two children who are ages 10 and 8.

Damaris has a hawking business of selling cosmetic products. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy beauty products to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to add to her stock.

loans.name: Esbol

texts.en: Esbol is 24 years old and lives with his wife and child in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed at the moment. He and his wife operate a livestock trading business. Right now, Esbol has no turnover capital. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I want to do many things in life. I want to have my own business." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy livestock from the countryside to sell in the city.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Sochida

texts.ru: Сочида жительница города Турсунзаде. Она замужем. Ей 50 лет. Она является матерью троих детей. Сочида занимается торговлей тканей. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа однотонных материалов и разных видов тканей.
texts.en: Sochida lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 50 years old, married and is a mother of three children.  Sochida is involved in fabrics sales.  She has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of solid-color materials and various types of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase of solid-color materials and various types of fabrics

loans.name: Serikbai

texts.en:
Serikbai is 41-years-old and lives with her five children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Two of her children are college students and three children are high school students. 

She started her business to sell meat to the local market many years ago and has a lot of business and work experience. Starting this year, she increased her business activity and is now selling meat at two different places. She is a hard working woman who says "I have a plan to expand my business and earn more profits. With the profits that I earned, I want to provide a good education to my children." She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy livestock from the countryside.

loans.use: to buy livestock from the countryside
